yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ni ìlú tí ó tóbi jù lọ ní ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá.
en: Ibadan is the largest city in Yoruba land.

yo: Ọ̀nàa Ìbàdàn ni àwọn ọ̀daràn náà gbà lọ ìlúu Èkó.
en: The criminals took the Ibadan road to Lagos.

yo: Ìwé kíkà ti le láyé òde òní nítorí ọ̀làjú tí ó dé òde.
en: Reading books has become difficult in today's world because of modern civilization.

yo: Lórílẹ̀-èdè e Nàíjíríà nìkan kó ni wón ti ń sọ Yorùbá.
en: It is only in the country of Nigeria that they speak Yoruba.

yo: Ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún àgbà ṣe kókó ní àwùjọ àwọn Yorùbá gidi gan ni.
en: Respect for elders is very important in Yoruba society.

yo: Nítorí àwọn ọlọpàá ni àwọn olè náà fi fẹsẹ̀ fẹ.
en: It was because of the police that the thieves immediately wanted.

yo: Adéjùmọ̀kẹ́ ti kó lọ sí ilé ọkọ rẹ̀ àtijó.
en: Adéjumoke has moved to her ex-husband's house.

yo: Èmi ni mo rán àwọn ajínigbé pé kí wọ́n pa á.
en: I sent the kidnappers to kill him.

yo: Rẹ̀mí jẹ mí ní gbèsè fún bí oṣù mẹ́jọ báyìí.
en: He owes me for about eight months now.

yo: Ìjọba ti fi òfin de ilé-iṣé mẹ́ta ní Ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Ọ̀yọ́.
en: The government has banned three companies in Oyo State.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Ìbàdàn ti dá wàhálà sílẹ̀.
en: Ibadan university students have created trouble.

yo: Ọ̀nà ẹ̀yìn ni àlùfáà gbà jáde nígbà tí àwọn olè náà dé.
en: The priest took the back way when the thieves came.

yo: Táyé sọ pé òun lè toríi Bọ́ládé
en: Táyé said that he could blame Boládé

yo: Adélérè ti mú ọ̀rọ̀ kékeré tí wón sọ fún-un jẹ.
en: Adelere has taken the small talk that they told him.

yo: Ṣíjú ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní di irun fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọbìnrin.
en: Siu has started to become the hair for young women.

yo: Inú ìkòkò dúdú ni ata aládùn tí ń jáde.
en: From the black pot is the sweet pepper coming out.

yo: Àlàní ni adigunjalè tí wón mú ní ọjà a baálẹ̀ ní ìjẹta.
en: Alani is the thief who was caught in the market.

yo: Gbogbo àwọn ọmọ ilé wa ló ti gba abẹ́rẹ́ ẹ àjẹsára.
en: All the members of our family have been vaccinated.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Ìbàdàn ti fi ẹ̀dùnnú u wọn hàn lórí ètò o àbọ̀.
en: The people of Ibadan have expressed their happiness over the half plan.

yo: Ìbomú dára púpọ̀ láti máa lò lásìkò yìí.
en: Bombs are very good to use at this time.

yo: Àjálù ńlá kan ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìlú Ajẹ́lẹ̀ ní ọjọ́ Ẹtì tó kọjá.
en: A great tragedy happened in the city of Ajele last Sunday.

yo: Kò sí iná tí àwọn ọmọ yẹn lè fi lọ aṣọ wọn.
en: There is no fire with which those children can wash their clothes.

yo: Ọ̀tẹ̀ àti jàmbá ni wón fi gba Ìlọrin.
en: Rebellion and crash were used to get Ílorin.

yo: Ogun ja ìlú mi nígbàtí mo wà ní ọmọ ọdún mẹ́wàá.
en: War broke out in my town when I was ten years old.

yo: Àdìsá ti lọ sí ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga láti le di adájọ́.
en: Adisa went to college to become a judge.

yo: Adájọ́ yẹ àga mọ́ ìjọba Adé nídìí.
en: A judge deserves a seat in the government of the Crown.

yo: Adé gún ọkùnrin yìí lọ́bẹ ní ilé ìdìbò ní Àkúrẹ́.
en: Adé stabbed this man in the stomach at the polling station in Akure.

yo: Ọmọ Òwu tí ẹ bá gbọ́ pé ó jalè, ẹ wádìí i rẹ̀ daadaa.
en: Son of Owu, if you hear that he is a thief, investigate him thoroughly.

yo: Adájọ́ tí ju Ọba sẹ́wọ̀n ni Àdìsá.
en: Adisa was the judge who imprisoned the King.

yo: Ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n-ọn Kiríkirì ni wón ju Ọba aláṣẹ sí.
en: The King was thrown into Kririkiri prison.

yo: Gbadé ti ṣe àbẹ̀wọ̀ sí àwọn ọmọ ìlú u rẹ̀ tí ó wà ní ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: Gbade has appealed to his fellow countrymen who are in prison.

yo: Àwọn tí a mú níbi ìwọ́de náà wà lọ́gbà ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: Those who were caught at the raid are in prison.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti fi Bàbá Ìjẹ̀sà sílẹ̀.
en: The police have released Baba Ijesa.

yo: Àwọn jàndùkú pa èèyàn mẹ́tàlá nínú u mọ̀lẹ́bí kan náà.
en: Thirteen people from the same family were killed by thugs.

yo: Ladé kìlọ̀ fún wọn ní ìlú òyìnbó.
en: Ladé warned them in the city of oibbó.

yo: Délé ti sọ fún àwọn ọmọ náà kí wón má dá sí ọ̀rọ̀ náà.
en: Delé has told the children not to interfere in the matter.

yo: Adájọ́ ní kí wọn sanwó o gbà má bínú fáwọn aṣòfin Òndó.
en: The judge asked them to pay and agreed not to anger the Ondo legislators.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá a Nàíjíríà gba owó ẹ̀yìn ní ojúu pópó.
en: Nigerian policemen accept bribes on the streets.

yo: Wọ́n ti rí sójà àtàwọn méjì mìíràn tí wón pa.
en: They have found the soldier and two others who were killed.

yo: Òkú àwọn ọlọ́pàá náà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní rùn nígbà tí wón fi máa ríi.
en: The dead bodies of the policemen had started to smell when they found them.

yo: Ilé e Balógun ni ìpàdé náà ti wáyé lánàá.
en: The meeting was held at Balogun's house yesterday.

yo: Ọba ti kéde pé kí àwọn ènìyàn ìlú náà fi ìmọ̀ ṣọ̀kan.
en: The king has announced that the people of the city should unite with knowledge.

yo: Ọkọ̀ mẹ́wàá mẹ́wàá ni ìjọba fún àwọn ọba ìlú kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: There are ten ships in the kingdom for the kings of each city.

yo: Òkété ti bọ sí òru ní ọjọ́ ọ Àbámẹ́ta.
en: Okete has come to night on the third day.

yo: Ìjà wáyé láàrín-in Títí àti ọkọ rẹ̀ ní alẹ́ ìjẹta.
en: There was a fight between Titi and her husband on the night of the feast.

yo: Àkọ́kọ́ irú ìpàdé yìí wáyé ní Ọjà Ọba.
en: The first such meeting was held at Oja Oma.

yo: Àkókò o waá ti lọ kí á tó dé ibi ìnáwó náà.
en: Time will be gone before we reach the financial point.

yo: Kò pẹ́ tí àwọn ènìyàn náà dé ni a bẹ̀rẹ̀.
en: It wasn't until the people arrived that we started.

yo: Lékan ti fi ojúsàájú gba àwọn ẹ̀bùn náà.
en: Once the gifts were received with partiality.

yo: Ọ̀nà a Àkúré ni àwọn bàbá à mií gbà lọ sí Ifẹ̀.
en: Akure's path was taken by our fathers to love.

yo: Ọdún tí a wà yìí ni ẹ̀gbọ́n mi ọkùnrin paríi ètò ẹ̀kọ́ọ rẹ̀.
en: This year my brother finished his education.

yo: Gbàrà tí ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọ̀n mií parí ẹ̀kọ́ọ rẹ̀ ni ó rí iṣẹ́.
en: As soon as my brother finished his education, he got a job.

yo: Bíi ọdún mẹ́jọ ni Rẹ̀mi lò ní ilé kí ó tó rí iṣẹ́.
en: Rehmi spent about eight years at home before finding a job.

yo: Bólújí ti padà wá sí ìlú Nàíjíríà lẹ́yìn-in oṣù kan.
en: Boluji has returned to Nigeria after a month.

yo: Àwọn abẹfẹ́lẹ́ inú ọgbàa wa ṣe iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn bíi iṣẹ́.
en: The blades in our garden do their job like work.

yo: Ìwé kíkó le gbéni sókè láyé tí a wà yìí.
en: Reading books can be uplifting in today's world.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ olórí ẹbí ti darapọ̀ mọ́ wa.
en: The children of the head of the family have joined us.

yo: Ìpàdé pàtàkì ni ó wáyé lẹ́yìn ikúu olóògbé.
en: An important meeting was held after the death of the deceased.

yo: Olóògbé kò fi ogún kankan sílè fún àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ rárá.
en: The deceased did not leave any inheritance to his children at all.

yo: Adé ti ta ilẹ̀ tí ó rà lọ́wọ́ ọ̀gáa rẹ̀.
en: The crown has sold the land he bought from his lord.

yo: Ìbànújẹ́ dé bá àwọn ará ilé e wa nígbà tí wón gbọ́ pé ó ti kú.
en: His family members were saddened when they heard that he had died.

yo: Ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì dé bá àwọn ènìyàn ìlú náà láìrò tẹ́lẹ̀.
en: Disappointment came upon the people of the city without warning.

yo: Ewúré ti jẹ gbogbo nǹkan inú ìkòkò náà.
en: The goat has eaten everything in the pot.

yo: Àgbàlá a wa ni bàbá àgbà waá kú sí ní alẹ́ àná.
en: Our grandfather died in our yard last night.

yo: Ọjà ni àwọn nǹkan oríṣiríṣi wà láti rà.
en: There are many different things to buy in the market.

yo: Ìfẹ́ tí mo ní sí Tómi dàbíi ti ẹyẹ àdàbà.
en: The love I have for Tom is like that of a dove.

yo: Gbogbo ìgbà ni mo maá ń rò bí ọjọ́ iwájú ù mi á ṣe dára.
en: I always think about how the future will be good for me.

yo: Ìgbélárugẹ èdè e wa ṣe pàtàkì láwùjọ.
en: The promotion of our language is important in society.

yo: Àti ọ̀nà jíjìn ni mo tí gbó ariwo àwọn ọmọ náà.
en: And in the distance I heard the noise of the children.

yo: Ajá bu àwọn ọmọ náà jẹ lálẹ́ ẹ ìjẹrin.
en: A dog bit the children on the night of the fourth.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọmọ ilé ẹ̀kọ́ wa ni ó wá sí ibi ìnáwó náà.
en: Many of our students came to the fundraiser.

yo: Ẹ̀bùn ńlá gbàǹgbà ni wón rà fún àwọn olùkọ́ ọ wọn.
en: They bought big gifts for their teachers.

yo: Gbogbo àwọn olùkọ́ ilé ìwé wa ni wón ṣe dáradára.
en: All the teachers at our school are doing well.

yo: Ọkọ̀ ti gba àárín àwọn olólùfẹ́ méjèèjì náà.
en: A boat has passed between the two lovers.

yo: Délé ti lọ fìyàwó o rẹ̀ an gbogbo àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bíi rẹ̀.
en: Delé has gone to get married and is tired of all her relatives.

yo: Iná ti gbé àwọn ọlọ́pàá tí wọn gun orí òpó iná náà.
en: Fire has taken the police who climbed on top of the fire pole.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ ti dá àwọn ọ̀daràn náà láre.
en: The court acquitted the criminals.

yo: Gbogbo iǹkan ló ti wón lọ́jà báyìí.
en: All things are sold now.

yo: Gbogbo àwọn ẹrùu Ọba ló wà nínúu ìyẹ̀wùu wọn.
en: All the King's goods were in their rooms.

yo: Ṣé àwọn ọlọ́pàá náà ti dé sí ìlú Ìbàdàn?
en: Have the police arrived in Ibadan?

yo: Irúu ọbẹ̀ wo ni ẹ má fí jẹ ìrẹsì?
en: What kind of soup should you not eat rice?

yo: Ṣé àwọn ọmọ náà ti ti ilée ẹjọ́ dé?
en: Have the children arrived at court?

yo: Ọ̀daràn gbáà ni àwọn ọmọ náà.
en: The children are criminals.

yo: Ilée ẹjọ́ ti dá àwọn ọ̀daràn ní àre.
en: The court acquitted the criminals.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ o ti rí àwọn ọmọ náà báyìí?
en: Have you seen the children yet?

yo: Òyìnbó náà ti di dúdú lẹ́nu ìgbà tí ó dé yìí.
en: The light has turned black by now.

yo: Ìgbàgbọ́ ọ wa ni pé ọjọ́ ọ̀la wa á dára.
en: Our faith is that our future will be good.

yo: Ṣé àwọn ọlọ́pàá náà ti mú ọ̀daràn náà?
en: Have the police caught the criminal?

yo: Jùwọ́n ti lọ sí ìlú Ọ̀sun láti ìjẹ́ta.
en: Juwon had gone to the city of Osun from Ijeta.

yo: Lọ́la ti dé ilée Àjàní kò ba ní ilé.
en: Tomorrow he arrived at Ajani's house and he did not have a house.

yo: Jésù nìkan ni olùgbàlà tí aráyé nílò.
en: Jesus is the only savior that mankind needs.

yo: Abala Kẹwàá ni mo wà nínúu Bíbélì kíkà mi.
en: I am in Chapter Ten in my Bible reading.

yo: Ọ̀nà inú abúlée waá dára lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀.
en: The road in the village is very good.

yo: Inú kóló ni àwọn ọmọ wa ń pa owó o wọn mọ́ sí.
en: Our children keep their money in anger.

yo: Adigunjalè ni bàbá a Bọ́lá onílé alájà mẹ́ta náà.
en: Bola's father is Adigungalele, the owner of the three-storey house.

yo: Àyìndé ti ra omi sí àmù tí omi ma ń wà.
en: The goat has bought water from the water tank.

yo: Ìkòkò tí Àbẹ̀ní gbé lọ sí odò ti fọ́.
en: The pot that Abeni took to the river was broken.

yo: Délé ti padà sí ọ̀dọ̀ àlè e rẹ̀ ní alẹ́ ẹ àná.
en: Delé had returned to her husband last night.

yo: Ọ̀nà wo ni ìlú yìí fi máa dáa?
en: How will this city be better?

yo: Inú àwọn ará ìlú dùn nígbàtí wón mú iná dé.
en: The townspeople were happy when they brought the fire.

yo: Ìjọba ti mú Ìgbòho nígbà tí ó gbìyànjú àti rin ìrìn àjò.
en: The government arrested Igbho when he tried and traveled.

yo: Mákindé ṣàbẹ̀wọ̀ sí Gomìnà Èkìtì lẹ́ẹ̀kan síi.
en: Makinde appealed to the Governor of Ekiti once again.

yo: Ìbáṣepọ̀ọ Dàda àti Àjàní kò gún régé mọ́.
en: The relationship between Dada and Ajani is not good anymore.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti mú àwọn tí wón ń jí iǹkan ìjọba.
en: The police have arrested those who were stealing government goods.

yo: Òpùrọ́ burúkú ni àwọn ọlọ́pàá a Nàìjíríà.
en: Nigerian police are bad liars.

yo: Àdìsá ṣàbẹ̀wọ̀ sí àwọn tí ara wọn kò yá ní ilé ìwòsàn.
en: Adisa appealed to those who are not well in the hospital.

yo: Ṣèyí sọ pé ọ̀rọ̀ Ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ kìí ṣe nǹkan tí ènìyàn ń yanjú lẹ́ẹ̀kàn.
en: This said that the issue of Oyo State is not something that people solve in their heart.

yo: Fáyẹmi fẹ́ dá ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ sílẹ̀ nílùú u Èkìtì.
en: Fayemi wants to establish a local government in Ekiti.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti kó gbogbo àwọn tí wón mu igbó láwùjọ.
en: The police have arrested all those caught in the community.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti mú Adéyẹmí lórí ikú tí ó pa akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọ Ifẹ̀.
en: The police have arrested Adeyemi over the death of student Ife.

yo: Ọkọ̀ ojú omi ya sí méjì láàrín alagbalúgbúu omi.
en: The boat split in two in the middle of the water.

yo: Àwọn Ìjọba tún ti dá Ìgbòho padà sí àtìmọ́lé.
en: Governments have also returned Igbho to detention.

yo: Délé ṣèlérí pé òun yóò pèsèe ohun amú ayé dẹrùn fún wa.
en: Delé promised that he would provide us with the comforts of the world.

yo: Àlè kan ló fún ìyàwó o Délé lóyún inú u rẹ̀.
en: He got Delé's wife pregnant in his womb.

yo: Ìjọba Èkó ti sọ pé àwọn ilé kan lu òfin ní ìlú Èkó.
en: The government of Lagos has said that some buildings are illegal in Lagos.

yo: Èèyàn márùn-ún ló kú láàrọ̀ kùtùkùtù ọjọ́ Ajé.
en: Five people died in the early hours of Monday.

yo: Ọ̀nàa Ìbàdàn ni wón pa àwọn ọmọ ilé ẹ̀kọ́ náà sí.
en: The students were killed in Ibadan way.

yo: Fúlàní ti jí àwọn ọmọ ìlú kọ̀ọ̀kan gbé.
en: Fulani has abducted the citizens of each town.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ẹ wa jáwé olúborí nínú ètò ìdìbò tí ó wáyé.
en: Our team emerged as the winner in the election process that took place.

yo: Afẹ́niífẹ́re ní àwọn kò ní tẹ̀lẹ́ ìjọba rárá.
en: They are selfish and they will never have a government at all.

yo: Gómìnà Ọ̀yọ́ ti rin ìrìn àjò lọ sí òkè òkun.
en: Governor Oyo has traveled overseas.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn-an wa kọ́kọ́ fi àkókò ṣòfò nínúu ìpàdé náà.
en: Our people first wasted time in the meeting.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti gbé àfẹ́sọ́nàa Títí láti alẹ́ ẹ ọjọ́ ọ Ajé.
en: The police have been engaged until Monday night.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ló pọ̀ jù nínúu ìpàdé tí a ṣe lálẹ́ẹ àná.
en: The majority of the meeting held last night were young people.

yo: Àdìsá ní òun ti kọ ìyàwó ilé rẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́fẹ́.
en: Adisa said that he had married his first wife.

yo: Ìjọba ti fi òfin de pípéjọ̀pọ̀ rẹpẹtẹ láwùjọ.
en: The government has banned mass gatherings.

yo: Èmi lọ́kàn láti jẹ Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdèe Nàìjíríà.
en: I intend to be the President of Nigeria.

yo: Ìyàwó olórí orílẹ́èdèe wa tẹ́lẹ̀rí ti kú.
en: The wife of our former head of state is dead.

yo: Gómìnà Ìpínlẹ́ Èkó ti tún ìlú Èkó ṣe gidi gan.
en: The Governor of Lagos State has really rebuilt the city of Lagos.

yo: Yẹmí fìdí rẹmi nínú ètò ìdìbò tó wáyé.
en: Yemi was confirmed in the election process that took place.

yo: Ọrọ̀ ajé ilẹ̀ẹ wa jẹ wá lógún gidi gan.
en: Our country's economy is very important to us.

yo: Ìdàgbàsókè ilẹ̀ẹ Nàíjíríà ni à ń fẹ́ láti ọwọ́ọ ìjọba.
en: The development of Nigeria is what we want from the government.

yo: Nàìjíríà nìkan ni wón tí ń gbin ìlasa.
en: They are the only ones in Nigeria that grow rice.

yo: Adé yáwó lọ́wọ́ọ, Ṣíjú kò dáa padà.
en: The crown was borrowed from the hand, Síju did not return.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀daràn náà ti pa ọlọ́pàá tí ó ṣó wọn.
en: The criminals have killed the policeman who arrested them.

yo: Lará ti gbọ̀nà Èkó lọ láti lọ wá iṣẹ́.
en: Lara has gone to Lagos to look for work.

yo: Iṣẹ́ ló sọmọ nù bíi òkò.
en: Work is like a field.

yo: Ara Jídé kò yá láti lọ sí ilée ẹ̀kọ́.
en: Jídé was not ready to go to school.

yo: Ìyàwó ẹ̀ ló puró olè mọ́ Àdìsá.
en: It was his wife who lied to Adisa.

yo: Àyìnlá ti lọ gba ìtọjú ní ilée ìwòsàn.
en: The victim went to the hospital for treatment.

yo: Gbogbo iǹkan tí Adéleré ń ṣe ni kò dáa.
en: Everything that Adéleré is doing is not good.

yo: Àwọn alàgbà ìjọ náà ti gbàdúrà fún wa.
en: The elders of the church have prayed for us.

yo: Ṣé ọjà Ọba ni Adé sọ pé òun ń lọ ni?
en: Is it the King's market that Adé said he was going to?

yo: Ṣé àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti wá mú bàbáa Bọ́lá ni?
en: Have the police come to arrest Bola's father?

yo: Ìgbà wo ni àwọn ọmọ náà fẹ́ wá sí ilé e wa?
en: When do the children want to come to our house?

yo: Àwọn òníṣẹ́ mélòó ni ìjọba nílò láti ṣe iṣẹ́ náà?
en: How many workers does the government need to do the job?

yo: Ṣé lóòótọ́ ni pé àwọn àlejò o wa ti lọ?
en: Are the guests really gone?

yo: Ọwọ́ lásán ni Adébóyè fi mú ẹran jáde nínúu ìkòkò.
en: Adéboye took meat out of the pot with his bare hands.

yo: Ṣé ara ọba ti yàtọ̀ sí ti tẹ́lẹ̀ ṣá?
en: Is the king's body different from before?

yo: Bàbá náà fipá bá àwọn ọmọ inúu rẹ̀ sùn.
en: The father forced his children to sleep.

yo: Ọlá ti fi ọlọ́pàá mú ìyàwóo rè ní ìlúu Ìbàdàn.
en: Ola has arrested his wife with the police in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ṣé Làtí ti gbé àwọn olè náà lọ sí ilée ẹjọ́?
en: Has Lati taken the thieves to court?

yo: Àkàrà alẹ́ẹ àná ni mo jí jẹ láàrọ̀ yìí.
en: I ate last night's bread this morning.

yo: Akéré ṣe àtìlẹ́yìn fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ọ ìlú náà.
en: Akere supports the youth of the city.

yo: Òtútù ń mú àwọn ènìyàn-an inúu ilé náà.
en: The cold brings people inside the house.

yo: Òtítọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ korò lára àwọn ọ̀dọ́mobìnrin wa.
en: The truth is bitter about our young women.

yo: Gbàrà tí ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọ̀n mi rí àwọn ẹja náà pa ni ó pè mí.
en: As soon as my brother saw the fish killed, he called me.

yo: Inúu igbó irúmọlẹ̀ ni wón ti rí àwọn ẹbọra náà.
en: They found the victims in the forest.

yo: Ṣé àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti rí àwòrán-an ọ̀daràn náà?
en: Have the police seen the picture of the criminal?

yo: Ìjọba ti fún àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé kọ̀ọ̀kan ní ìwé.
en: The government has given books to every student.

yo: Ilée Àdìsá ni mo sùn nígbàtí mo dé.
en: I slept at Adísá's house when I arrived.

yo: Ìyàwó Àdìsá tọ́jú mi dáadáa ni ilée rẹ̀.
en: Adisa's wife took good care of me in her home.

yo: Àdìsá ló gbé mi lọ sí pápákọ̀ ọ òfurufú.
en: Adisa took me to the airport.

yo: Ọjọ́ ajé ni àwọn olè náà lọ fọ́ ilé ìjọsìn náà.
en: The thieves broke into the church on Sunday.

yo: Àwọn adigunjalè náà pa àwọn ènìyàn mọ́júu òní.
en: The robbers killed people today.

yo: Àdìsá ti fá irun oríi rẹ̀ dán.
en: Adisa has shaved his head smooth.

yo: Wón ti ṣe ètòo ìbímọ ni abúlé e wa.
en: They have done birth control in our village.

yo: Iwájú iwájú ni ọ̀pá ẹ̀bìtì wa ń ré sí.
en: The front is where our lip sticks.

yo: Ọwọ́ àbúrò mi ni ọ̀bẹ náà wà láti àárọ̀.
en: The knife was in my younger brother's hand since morning.

yo: Ẹ̀kọ́ ilé ṣe pàtàkì láwùjọ àwa ènìyàn.
en: Home education is important in our society.

yo: Alàgbà ṣèlérí pé ìsìn tòótọ́ yóò wáyé lọ́la.
en: The elder promised that true religion will take place tomorrow.

yo: Ọ̀nà àbáyọ nìkan ni àwọn ọmọ ìlú Ìgàngàn nílò.
en: The only way out is what the citizens of Iggangan need.

yo: A gba àlejò ní alẹ́ ìjẹta kí á tó jẹun.
en: We received guests at dinner before dinner.

yo: Ìbáṣepọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn náà àti ọ̀gá kò dánmọ́rán.
en: The relationship between the people and the boss is not good.

yo: Aṣẹ́wó paraku ni àwọn ọmọ obìnrin agboolée wọn.
en: Their daughters are prostitutes.

yo: Gómìnà Ìpínlẹ́ Èkìtì pé dé ìpàdé àwọn Gómìnà.
en: The Governor of Ekiti State arrived at the Governors' meeting.

yo: Ìlú Àkúrẹ́ gba àlejò o gbogbo àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
en: Akure welcomes all workers from abroad.

yo: Àjàní ti pa ajá Àjàgbé nínúu ọgbà àjàrà náà.
en: Ajajni killed Ajajbe's dog in the vineyard.

yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ti yan ọba mìíràn lẹ́yìn ikúu ọba àná.
en: The city of Ibadan has elected another king after the death of the king yesterday.

yo: Ìyá Àjànàkú ti bí ọmọ mìíràn fún Jàkó.
en: Ajánákú's mother has given birth to another child for Jákó.

yo: Ṣẹ́gun fi ipá bá ọmọ ọdún mẹ́wàá sùn.
en: Forced to sleep with a ten year old.

yo: Ìjọba ti kó àwọn ọlọ́pàá Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn jáde sí ìgboro.
en: The government has brought the police officers out to the streets.

yo: Ìjọba ti gbé owó lé owóo ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ní ilẹ̀ẹ Nàíjíríà.
en: The government has increased the cost of education in Nigeria.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Ísírẹ́lì ti wọ ìlúu Nàíjíríà láti ìjẹ́ta.
en: The Israelis have entered Nigeria from Egypt.

yo: Ẹ̀wù ìgbàlódé ni Adébóyè àti Jàre wọ̀.
en: Adéboye and Jare wore modern clothes.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Ìbàdàn ti darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ọmọ Èkó.
en: The people of Ibadan have joined the people of Eko.

yo: Ìbọn ni wón bá lọ́wọ́ọ àwọn ènìyàn ilẹ̀ náà.
en: Guns were in the hands of the people of the land.

yo: Àwọn Ọba ìlú ńlá péjọ ni ààfin Ọ̀yọ́.
en: The Kings of the city gathered in the palace of Oyo.

yo: Ìjọba àwa arawa ló gba òde kan.
en: It was the government of us who took an outsider.

yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ni wọ́n lé àwọn olè náà lọ.
en: The thieves were sent to Ibadan.

yo: Àwọn Ọba aládé ti dé ìlúu Àkúrẹ́.
en: The princes have arrived in the city of Akure.

yo: Ọ̀nàa Ìbàdàn ni àwọn olólùfẹ́ méjèèjì ti pàdée ara wọn.
en: The two lovers met each other by chance.

yo: Àwọn olórí aṣòfin ilẹ̀ Yorùbá kéde ẹgbẹ́ tuntun.
en: The leaders of the Yoruba parliament announced a new party.

yo: Àdìsá àtàwọn ọ̀dọ́ tún ṣèwọ́de ní ìlúu Èrúwà.
en: Adisa and the youths also entered the city of Eruwa.

yo: Ọlọpàá ń wá àwọn tó jí awakùsà gbé.
en: The police are looking for those who kidnapped the miners.

yo: Àwọn ènìyàn fẹ́ dá ìjàa Yorùbá àti Íbò sílẹ̀.
en: People want to stop fighting Yoruba and Ibo.

yo: Ọlábọ̀dé lu ìyàwó ẹ pa toyúntoyún ní ìlúu Èrúwà.
en: Olábodé beat his wife to death in the town of Eruwa.

yo: Adájọ́ rán olùkọ́ọ fásitì lẹ́wọ̀n.
en: The judge sent the university professor to prison.

yo: Ó ṣe pàtàkì kí á ma lo ìbòmú u wa ní gbogbo ìgbà.
en: It is important that we use our protection all the time.

yo: Àwọn alálẹ̀ ilẹ̀ yìí ò ní jẹ́ ká tún rírú ẹ̀ mọ́ o.
en: The people of this land will not allow us to disturb you again.

yo: Olùrànlọ́wọ́ igbákejìi gómìnà Ọ̀yọ́ ti kó àrùn.
en: The deputy governor of Oyo has contracted the disease.

yo: Ọkọ̀ ọ ìjọba ni wón fi ń kó àwọn ọmọ ìta.
en: They use government vehicles to transport outsiders.

yo: Ìjọba Ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ ti yan ọ̀gá àgbà fún àwọn ọlọ́pàá.
en: The Oyo State Government has appointed a police chief.

yo: Ògúnbọ̀wálé tú gbogbo àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀.
en: Ogunbowale released all his councils.

yo: Oyẹ̀kọ́lá ti tú àwọn ajá ilé e rẹ̀ sílè.
en: Oekola has released the dogs of his house.

yo: Ilée Àdìsá ni wọ́n ti rí òkúu èèyàn méjì.
en: Two dead bodies have been found in Adisa's house.

yo: Àwọn adigunjalè kọ ìwé sí àwọn aráa àdúgbò o wa.
en: The robbers wrote letters to the local people.

yo: Tẹ́ní lu àwọn ènìyàn ní jìbìtì.
en: Then he cheated the people.

yo: Lékan ti jẹ gbogbo iyán yẹn tán.
en: Once all that hunger is over.

yo: Ẹrú ni Rẹ̀mi jẹ́ sí Lará nílùú Ìbàdàn tí a wà yìí.
en: I am a slave to Lara in the city of Ibadan where we are.

yo: Wón de Ṣadé lọ́wọ́ lẹ́sẹ̀ fún odidi oṣù kan.
en: They arrived in Şadeh on foot for a whole month.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ fẹ́ gbéná wo ojúu àwọn ọmọ náà.
en: The union wanted to look at the children's faces.

yo: Àwọn jàndùkú yin ìbọn pa àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ wa.
en: The thugs shot and killed our workers.

yo: Gómìnà ṣàbẹ̀wò sí ẹbíi àwọn tó pàdánùu ẹ̀míi wọn.
en: The governor visited the families of those who lost their lives.

yo: Àwọn ènìyàn fi ìbànújẹ́ ṣe ọdún iléyá.
en: People celebrate the wedding year with sadness.

yo: Ìdùnnú ṣubú layọ̀ ní ọjọ́ọ ọdún-un iléyá.
en: Happiness fell happily on the day of the first year of pregnancy.

yo: Ariwo sọ nígbà tí ọ̀gá àgbà náà wọ̀lú.
en: There was a noise when the boss entered.

yo: Ìbànújẹ́ ni ọba náà fi wọ inúu ìlú.
en: The king entered the city with sadness.

yo: Ìlera tí ó péye ni àwọn ará ìlú náà tọrọ.
en: The people of the city are asking for proper health.

yo: Iná ni ó jẹ́ ohun kan tí ó bà mí lẹ́rù.
en: Fire is something that scares me.

yo: Làtí ti fi ẹ̀yìn tì láti ìjẹ́rin.
en: To have turned away from the walk.

yo: Kẹ́mi gbé oúnjẹ fún àwọn ọmọ ilée wa.
en: I brought food for our family.

yo: Bùnmi ti kí àwọn lọ́balọ́ba láti àárọ̀.
en: Bummi has been greeting them since morning.

yo: Ṣúgà ni àwọn ọmọ yẹn bù sí ẹ̀wà.
en: Those children put sugar on beauty.

yo: Adájọ́ náà ti gba ilé sí Abúlée Ẹ̀gbá.
en: The judge has taken a house in Abúlée Egba.

yo: Ìgbéyàwó o Àdùnní ku ọ̀sẹ̀ kan.
en: Happy wedding is a week away.

yo: Kúnlé pàdánù ẹ̀míi rẹ̀ nínúu ìjàmbá ọkọ̀ náà.
en: Kunle lost his life in the car accident.

yo: Àwọn olè tún jà ní ojúu ọ̀nàa Ìwó.
en: Thieves also fought on the streets of Iwo.

yo: Àlàní yin ìbọn pa àwọn olè mẹ́wàá tí ó wá ilé e rẹ̀.
en: Alani shot dead 10 thieves who came to his house.

yo: Àkànní ni ọmọ tí ó tayọ jùlọ nínúu àwọn ọmọ Àlàkẹ́.
en: Akanni is the best child among the children of Alakek.

yo: Owó nìkan ni ó lè mú inúu àwọn ènìyàn náà dùn.
en: Only money can make the people happy.

yo: Títí ti lọ sí ìlúu òyìnbó lánàá láti tọ́jú ara rẹ̀.
en: Until he went to the city yesterday to take care of himself.

yo: Èkúté ti jẹ gbogbo ẹ̀wà tí a rà tán.
en: Ékúté has eaten all the beauty we bought.

yo: Àpò ìrẹsì kan ni Adé fún gbogbo wa.
en: A bag of rice is the Crown for all of us.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ọ ìlú Ìbàdàn ti sú ọba ìlú náà.
en: The king of the city was tired of the talk of Ibadan.

yo: Ọmọ àlè ni ìyàwó Rẹ̀mí gbé wálé fun.
en: Remî's wife brought him home as a son-in-law.

yo: Ìgbà kejì rèé tí Sèyí máa jẹ gómìnàa Ìpínlẹ̀ẹ Ọ̀yọ́.
en: This is the second time Seyi will be the governor of Oyo State.

yo: Ìkómọ tí ó wáyé lánàá dára púpọ̀.
en: The reception that took place yesterday was very good.

yo: Etíi odò ni igbá náà ti fọ́.
en: The river's edge was broken by the blow.

yo: Àlàní ni ọba kẹwàá tí ó jẹ lẹ́yìn ọba tó wọ àjà.
en: Alani is the tenth king after the king who ascended the throne.

yo: Àwọn obìnrin méjì kú sọ́jàa Àkúrẹ́.
en: Two women died in Akure.

yo: Ọ̀nàa Ìwọ sí ìlú Ìbàdàn kò jì rárá.
en: The road to the city of Ibadan is not far at all.

yo: Ìyábọ̀ ni orúkọ tí wọn sọọ́.
en: Welcome is the name they say.

yo: Ẹrúbìnrin ni ó pọ̀jù láàárín àwọn ẹrú tí wón kó wá.
en: Female slaves were the majority among the slaves they brought.

yo: Àdùnní ti ṣe tán láti fẹ́ Àdìsá elẹ́mu.
en: Audni is ready to marry Adisa Elemu.

yo: Olè méjì gba ìdájọ́ ikú ni ìlúu Ìbàdàn.
en: Two thieves received the death sentence in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ṣé ìjọba ti rí àwọn tí ó sá lọ?
en: Has the government found those who fled?

yo: Ogún-un ọdún ni ó gba Nàìjíríà láti gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ.
en: It took Nigeria 20 years to win the trophy.

yo: Ọba ìlú Èkìtì ti sá kúrò ní ààfin.
en: The King of Ekiti has run away from the palace.

yo: Owó ṣe pàtàkì láwùjọ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti ní ẹ̀kọ́ gidi.
en: Money is important in the society of students to have real education.

yo: Àwọn Ọba ṣe ìpàdé nílùú Èkó lálẹ́ àná.
en: The Kings held a meeting in Lagos last night.

yo: Iyán ni àwọn ọmọ abúlé maá n fi ń jẹ ẹ̀fọ́.
en: Villagers use it to eat green beans.

yo: Oko ẹ̀fọ́ pọ̀ ní ìlúu Èrúwà gidi gaan.
en: There are a lot of wheat fields in the city of Eruwa.

yo: Àgbàdo títa wu ọ̀gá a waá jẹ láti ìjẹta.
en: Selling corn to please the boss will be eaten from the third day.

yo: Ṣọlá ti lọ sí ilé àwọn àna rẹ̀.
en: Shola has gone to her in-laws' house.

yo: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ tí ẹ gbé wá lánàá kò tí ì pọ́n.
en: The bananas you brought us yesterday are not yet ripe.

yo: Sísun ni àwọn ọmọ ìlú náà sun àwọn olè náà.
en: The townspeople burned the thieves.

yo: Ìgbésè pàtàkì ni àwọn ìjọba gbé lóríi ọ̀rọ̀ọ Yorùbá.
en: Governments are taking important action on the Yoruba issue.

yo: Dòdò lásán ni àwọn ọmọ mi bá lórí oúnjẹ tí wọ́n fún wọn.
en: My children were just fine with the food they were given.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ìlú ti dá owó jọ fún aláìsàn náà.
en: Citizens have collected money for the patient.

yo: Iṣu oko Adé kò tí ta rárá láti ọjọ́ yìí.
en: The Crown farm has not been sold at all since this day.

yo: Ọ̀nà kan nìkan ni a lè gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà gbà.
en: There is only one way to take the matter.

yo: Ṣé ọba àti olorì ti parí ìjà tí ó wà láàárín-in wọn?
en: Has the king and the leader finished the fight between them?

yo: Òjò ti ń pa ìbùsùn mi láti bí ọjọ́ mẹ́wàá wá.
en: It has been raining in my bed for ten days.

yo: Ọlá ti ń ṣe iṣẹ́ gidi ní ìlúu Èrúwà.
en: Honor is doing real work in the city of Eruwa.

yo: Adé ti gbanájẹ bí ó ṣe rí àwọn olè náà.
en: Adé was furious when he saw the thieves.

yo: Àwọn àgbábóólùu Nàìjíríà ti dé ìlúu Ẹ̀kọ́.
en: The Nigerian capital has arrived in the city of Eko.

yo: Lẹ́ẹ̀kan ṣoṣo ni àwọn olè ti wá jà wá.
en: Thieves have come to fight us only once.

yo: Ọba Ìgàngàn wọ àjà ní alẹ́ẹ àná òde yìí.
en: King Iganggan entered the attic last night.

yo: Ọ̀kẹ́ fún Ìmọ́lẹ̀ lóyún lẹ́yìn ọdún méje tí wọ́n ti jọ wà.
en: Oke for Imolem is pregnant after seven years of being together.

yo: Ipò tí mo bá ọ̀gá à mi kò dùn mọ́ni.
en: My situation with my boss is not pleasant.

yo: Mo mọ̀ dájú pé, ọwọ́ epo nìkan ni ayé bá ni lá.
en: I know for sure that the world will only dream of oil.

yo: Inú òkùnkùn ni àwọn ọmọ mi sùn mọ́jú.
en: My children slept in the dark.

yo: Ilẹ̀ẹ Yorùbá nílò àdúrà gidi gaan ni.
en: Yoruba land really needs prayers.

yo: Ọkọ̀ igbákejì Ààrẹ wa ti tàkìtì.
en: Our Vice President's car is gone.

yo: Ilée babaláwo ni ọkọ Ọlá ká a mọ́.
en: Ola's husband is a gentleman.

yo: Ojú Ìyá Àjànàkú rí kísà ní ilé ọkọ.
en: Mother Ajánákaku's eyes were wide open in the husband's house.

yo: Rẹ̀mi pinnu láti máa jẹ ẹ̀bà dáadáa.
en: I decided to eat well.

yo: Ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òkùnkùn ni àwọn ọmọ yìí.
en: These children are members of the dark side.

yo: Jùwọ́n ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní kọ orin fújì.
en: Since he started to sing fuji music.

yo: Ọmọ ìlú Ìbàdàn kán ti lu Jọjú ní jìbìtì.
en: The native of Ibadan has cheated Joju.

yo: Ọwọ́ ẹ̀yìn gbígbà kò wọ́pọ̀ láàárín àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ wa.
en: Backhandedness is not common among our employees.

yo: Ará ilé ẹni ní í ṣe ni lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà.
en: Many times it is a family member.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn olùkọ́ ti jẹ gbèsè kalẹ̀ kí owó o wọn tó dé.
en: Many teachers are in debt before their money arrives.

yo: Ojú àwọn ọmọ Ísírẹ́lì rí tó nínú ìrìn-àjò o wọn.
en: The eyes of the children of Israel were in their journey.

yo: Elédùmarè nìkan ni Ọba tí ń fi ọba á jẹ.
en: Elédumare is the only King who betrays the king.

yo: Tólá rí Èṣù ní oríta mẹ́tà lálẹ́ àná.
en: Tola saw the Èṣù with three forks last night.

yo: Àwọn adigunjalè ti jí ọ̀kadà bàbá à mi gbé.
en: Thieves have stolen my father's house.

yo: Ọ̀lẹ paraku ni gbogbo àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ayé òde òní.
en: All the students of today's world are lazy.

yo: Ṣọlá ti jẹ ẹ̀fọ́ rírò náà ní òru.
en: Shalá had already eaten the fat at night.

yo: Délé padà sídìí òṣèlú lẹ́yìn-in ọdún méje.
en: Dele returned to politics after seven years.

yo: Ọdún méje ni ó gba Nàìjíríà láti san owó tí wọ́n jẹ.
en: It took Nigeria seven years to pay off the debt.

yo: Délé fún àwọn ọmọ ìlú Ìbàdàn ní owó o ẹ̀yìn.
en: Delé gave the people of Ibadan a refund.

yo: Ìjọba ti fi owó kún owó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba.
en: The government has added money to the salaries of government employees.

yo: Ọgbọ́n ni Àrẹ̀mú fi fẹ́ gbogbo àwọn ìyàwó o rẹ̀.
en: Aremu was wise to marry all his wives.

yo: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Nàìjíríà nìkan ni kò ní kópa.
en: Only the Nigerian football team will not participate.

yo: Owó ńlá ni àwọ̀n ọmọ ẹ̀yìn-in Bọ́lá gbà lọ́wọ́ ọ rẹ̀.
en: Bola's disciples received a lot of money from him.

yo: Aláàfin Ọ̀yọ́ papòdà ní ọjọ́ ọ Ẹtì.
en: The King of Oyo returned on the day of the Feast of Tabernacles.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ tú ìgbéyàwó tó wà láàárin Bọ́lá àti Ayọ̀ ká.
en: The court dissolved the marriage between Bola and Ayyo.

yo: Àwọn aṣòfin kojú ìjà sí ara wọn ní ìlúu Èrúwà.
en: Lawmakers fight against each other in the city of Eruwa.

yo: Àwọn ajínigbé pa ọmọ obìnrin náà sí ẹ̀gbẹ́ ẹ ọ̀nà.
en: The kidnappers killed the woman's son by the side of the road.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba dín àkàrà nítorí ọ̀gá a wọn tó fẹ̀yìntì
en: Government officials cut bread because of their retired boss

yo: Àkókò ti tó fún àwọn Yòrùbá láti dá dúró gẹ́gẹ́ bí orílẹ́ẹ-èdè.
en: The time has come for the Yoruba to stand as a nation.

yo: Rẹ̀mi àti Ayọ̀ wọ ṣòkòtò o ìjà.
en: Me and Ayyo wear pants and fight.

yo: Ọmọ ogún ọdún di èrò o ẹ̀wọ̀n lọ́jọ́ ọ Ajé.
en: A 20-year-old boy was arrested on Monday.

yo: Gbàdàmọ́sí di akọ̀wé owó ni ọjọ́ Ajé.
en: Gbadamosi became a cashier on Monday.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba fagilé ìyanṣẹ́lódì lẹ́yìn-in oṣù mẹ́fà.
en: Government officials canceled the assignment after six months.

yo: Àrẹ̀mú fẹ̀yìntì lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́wàá tí ó lò.
en: Aremu retired after ten years of service.

yo: Adé kò tíì lọ sí ilé ìjọsìn láti bí i ọdún mẹ́rin.
en: Adé has not been to church since he was born in four years.

yo: Ara mi yá láti jẹ oúnjẹ nígbàtí mo rí ìyá mi.
en: I was ready to eat when I saw my mother.

yo: Délé dákú nígbà tí irin náà wó.
en: Delé fainted when the metal collapsed.

yo: Aṣọ àwọn ọlọ́pàá mẹ́fà ni àwọn olè jí gbé lọ.
en: Thieves stole the uniforms of six police officers.

yo: Àwọn ènìyàn lòdì sí bí àwọn ìjọba ṣe ń ṣe ètòo ìṣèjọba.
en: People are against the way governments are doing governance.

yo: Ó dun àwọn ọmọ ìjọ àgùdà bí àlùfáà wọ́n ṣe kú.
en: It saddened the members of the church of Aguda when their priest died.

yo: Ìjọ àgùdà ni ìjọ àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ dá sílẹ̀.
en: Aguda church was the first church that was founded.

yo: Lará ni ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọn Ṣeun tí ó dàgbà jùlọ.
en: Lara is Sheun's oldest brother.

yo: Adé ti kọ ẹnuùfẹ́ da Lará tíí ṣe ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọn Ṣeun.
en: Adé has rejected Lara, who is Sheun's uncle.

yo: Fadé ni obìnrin àkọ́kọ́ tí Adé yóò kọ́kọ́ kọ ẹnu ìfẹ́ dà.
en: Fadé is the first woman that Adé will first love.

yo: Fadé ti lóyún fún ọ̀gá a ẹ̀ lẹ́yìn oṣù kan tí wọ́n tí fẹ́ ara wọn.
en: Fade is pregnant by her husband after a month of marriage.

yo: Ọ̀gá a Fadé kọ̀ láti gba oyún lọ́wọ́ ọ rẹ̀.
en: Master Fadé refused to accept the pregnancy from her.

yo: Fadé lọ sí ọ̀dọ̀ dókítà láti lọ yọ oyún inúu rẹ̀.
en: Fadé went to the doctor to remove her pregnancy.

yo: Pàbó ni ìgbìyànjúu Fadé jásí láti yọ oyún tí ó wà nínúu rẹ̀.
en: Fadé's attempt to get rid of the fetus inside her was a failure.

yo: Ìjọba ti ṣe ìlérí láti máa fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní oúnjẹ ọ̀fẹ́.
en: The government has promised to give free meals to students.

yo: Oúnjẹ ọ̀fẹ́ ni ìjọba ní fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní ìlúu Èrúwà.
en: The government has free food for students in Eruwa.

yo: Ìlú Èrúwà ni ìlú àkókò tí ó gba oúnjẹ ọ̀fẹ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ ọ ìjọba.
en: Ilu Eruwa is the city of the time that received free food from the government.

yo: Àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ mẹ́wàá ló ti kú látàrí oúnjẹ ọ̀fẹ́ tí wọ́n jẹ.
en: Ten students have died because of the free food they ate.

yo: Ilé ìwòsàn tí ó wà ní Ìbàdàn ni wọ́n gbé Fadé lọ.
en: Fadé was taken to the hospital in Ibadan.

yo: Fadé kú sí ìlú Ìbàdàn lẹ́yìn tí ó lo oṣù mẹ́fà ní ilé ìwòsàn.
en: Fade died in the city of Ibadan after spending six months in the hospital.

yo: Ìlúu Ayétòrò ni wón sin Fadé sí.
en: Fadé was buried in the city of Ayetoro.

yo: Òkúu Fadé lo oṣù kan nínú yìnyín kí wọn tó sin-ín.
en: Okuu Fadé spent a month in the snow before being buried.

yo: Àwọn àlùfáà péjọ níbi ìsìnkúu Fadé ní ìlúu Èrúwà.
en: Priests gathered at Fadé's funeral in the town of Eruwa.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Yòrùbá ti ń sọ èdèe wọn nù.
en: Yoruba people are losing their language.

yo: Adé kú ní ọjọ́ tí Dáre fi ojú kàn-án.
en: Adé died the day Dare laid eyes on him.

yo: Iṣẹ́ẹ olè jíjà ni Rẹ̀mi ṣe ní ìlú u Èrúwà.
en: He was a thief in the city of Eruwa.

yo: Bíi ilé bíi mẹ́wàá ni Rẹ̀mi ti fọ́ ní ìlú u Èkó.
en: Remi has destroyed about ten houses in the city of Eko.

yo: Ọ̀nà a àbáyọ wà fún Lará láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ẹ̀kọ́ ọ rẹ̀ padà.
en: There is a way out for Lara to resume her studies.

yo: Ṣọlá ti ṣetán láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ẹ ẹ̀kọ́ ọ rẹ̀ padà.
en: Chalala is ready to resume her studies.

yo: Dèjì ti pinnu láti fẹ́ Tómi lọ́dún tó ń bọ̀.
en: Deji has decided to marry Tomi next year.

yo: Ọdún tí ó kọjá ní Àrẹ̀mú àti Ọlá fi ìlú Ìbàdàn sílẹ̀.
en: Last year Aremu and Ola left the city of Ibadan.

yo: Fúnkẹ́ ra ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ tuntun lálé àná.
en: Just bought a new car yesterday.

yo: Ìlú òyìnbó ni Ọdún kó lọ láti máa gbé.
en: He went to live in Odun town.

yo: Ọdún àti gbogbo àwọn ẹbíi rẹ̀ ló kó lọ sí ìlúu òyìnbó.
en: Odun and all his family moved to the city of Oinbo.

yo: Gbadé darapọ̀ mọ àwọn ẹbí ní ìlú òyìnbó.
en: Gbadé joins the families in the city of Oibbo.

yo: Inúu àwọn òbí mi dùn láti rí Gbadé lẹ́yìn-in ọdún kan.
en: My parents were happy to see Gbadé after a year.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ Kútì fẹ́ da iṣẹ́ sílẹ̀ látàríi àìrí owó gbà.
en: Kuti workers want to quit their jobs due to lack of money.

yo: Lọ́jọ́ Ajé ni àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ Kútì máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ dídà sílẹ̀.
en: On Monday, Kuti workers will start work.

yo: Kútì kú lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́wàá tí ó ti dùbúlẹ̀ ẹ àìsàn.
en: Kuti died after ten years of being ill.

yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ni Kútì kú sí lálẹ́ẹ ọjọ́ ọ Àbámẹ́ta.
en: Kuti died in the city of Ibadan on the night of the third day.

yo: Ọjọ́ọ ajé ni wón gbé òkú Kútì lọ sí ìlúu Àkúré.
en: On business day they took Kuti's body to the town of Akure.

yo: Gómìnà Ọ̀yọ́ tẹ́lẹ̀ rí ni Ládọjà.
en: Former governor of Oyo is Ladoja.

yo: Àjíní fi ayé sílẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ogójì ọdún tí ó ti lò láyé.
en: Ajini left the world after forty years in the world.

yo: Àdìsá jáde nílé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Ìbàdàn ní ọdún tó kọjá.
en: Adisa graduated from Ibadan High School last year.

yo: Ẹ̀yìn ilé wa ni wọ́n ti bá òkúu Dàda.
en: They found Dada's body behind our house.

yo: Òkúu Dàda lo bí ọjọ́ mẹ́ta kí wọ́n tó ríi.
en: Dada was dead for three days before they found him.

yo: Inúu igbó ni wọ́n sin òkú ọba àná sí.
en: Yesterday's king was buried in the forest.

yo: Dàpọ̀ fún àwọn olùkọ́ ní ẹ̀bùn torípé wọ́n fakọyọ.
en: Give the teachers a gift because they excelled.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ló pọ̀jù ní orílẹ̀-èdèe Nàìjíríà.
en: Young people are the majority in Nigeria.

yo: Ẹ̀wọ̀n ni Gómìnà Àjàlá kú sí lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́wàá.
en: Governor Ajala died in prison after 10 years.

yo: Bánúsọ ti bá ènìyàn sọ lẹ́yìn-in wàhálà tí ó ní.
en: Banúso has spoken to people after the trouble he had.

yo: Adé gbádùn ẹja odò tí ó jẹ ní ilé e wa.
en: Adé enjoyed the river fish he ate at our house.

yo: Ẹja odò méjì ni Lará àti Jàre jẹ lálẹ́ ẹ àná
en: Lará and Jâre ate two river fish last night

yo: Àwọn aṣòfin fi àṣẹ sí lílo ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.
en: Legislators mandate the use of the Internet.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ọkùnrin kan ti lu Jọjú ní jìbìtì.
en: Some men have cheated Joju.

yo: Ààrẹ ti fàṣẹ sí dídá ibùjẹ ẹran sílẹ̀ ni Nàìjíríà.
en: The President has ordered the establishment of cattle feedlots in Nigeria.

yo: Iṣẹ́ ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ lóríi ibùjẹ ẹran tí ìjọba dá sílẹ̀.
en: Work has begun on the manger established by the government.

yo: Ẹran ti pọ̀ nílée ibùjẹ ẹran tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀.
en: There is a lot of meat in the manger that they set up.

yo: Dáre wà lára àwọn ọ̀bàlújé
en: Dare is among the citizens

yo: Àwọn adigunjalè ni Délé ń f’ọ̀kadà ẹ̀ẹ́ gbé.
en: Delé is living with robbers.

yo: Àwọn ẹ̀ṣó ibodè ọba ti pé jọ láàfin ọba.
en: The guards of the king's gate have gathered in the king's court.

yo: Búrẹ́dì àtàná ni Bólájí tà fún Àjàní ní ọjàa Bódíjà.
en: Bolaji sold bread to Ajani in Bodija market.

yo: Ọ̀dọ̀ ọ Kálámù ni Rẹ̀mi ti wá ṣe ọdún iléyá.
en: It was from you Kalam that I came to be pregnant.

yo: Ẹran àgbò ni Rẹ̀mi jẹ nílé e Kálámù.
en: Remi eats mutton at Kalam's house.

yo: Kò sí ọ̀rẹ́ mi kankan tí ó pè mí fún ọdún-un iléyá.
en: None of my friends invited me for a year of marriage.

yo: Lékan bẹ̀ mí pé ki ń má bínú pé òun kò pè mí fún ọdún.
en: He once asked me not to be angry that he didn't call me for years.

yo: Ọ̀dọ́ọ Ọlá ni gbogbo àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi ti lọ ṣe ọdún-un iléyá.
en: All my friends have gone to Odo Ola for their wedding anniversary.

yo: Gàní pa àgbò mẹ́wàá fún ọdún-un iléyá.
en: Why kill ten rams for the year of marriage.

yo: Ilé e Àdìsá ló jóná lálẹ́ ìjẹta tí àwọn ènìyàn ń ké.
en: Adisa's house was burnt down in the night when the people were crying.

yo: Lọ́ládé kò tíì jẹ ẹran ìgbẹ́ lọ́dún yìí.
en: Today he has not eaten wild meat this year.

yo: Ẹran ìgbẹ́ ni ó wu àwọn àlejò o wa jẹ.
en: Wild meat is what pleases the guests.

yo: Abúlé e wa ni Àdùnní ti kọ́kọ́ bí àkọ́bíi rẹ̀.
en: Our village is Addnini's first born.

yo: Ilé e dókítà Àdìsá ni Àdùnní bí ọmọ rẹ̀ àbígbẹ̀yìn sí.
en: Addinni's youngest son was born in Dr. Adisa's house.

yo: Gbàrà tí Àdùnní bí ọmọ náà tán ni ó kú.
en: As soon as Addnini gave birth to the child, she died.

yo: Ariwo sọ nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn gbọ́ pé Àdùnní ti kú.
en: There was an uproar when people heard that Addinni had died.

yo: Ọkọ Àdùnní pa ara rẹ̀ nígbà tí ó gbọ́ pé Àdùnní ti kú.
en: Addinni's husband killed himself when he heard that Addinni was dead.

yo: Ojú rí gbogbo nǹkan tí dókítà ṣe nígbà tí Àdùnní fẹ́ bímọ.
en: The eye saw everything the doctor did when Addnini wanted to give birth.

yo: Ètò ìdìbò abẹ́lé ń lọ lọ́wọ́ ní ìlúu Èkìtì.
en: Local elections are underway in Ekiti.

yo: Ọkọ̀ Rẹ̀mi fi ojú ọ̀nà sílẹ̀, ló bá tẹ ọlọ́kadà mọ́lẹ̀.
en: Remi's boat left the road, and he stepped on the road.

yo: Ìjọba kò san owó kankan fún àwọn ajínigbé náà.
en: The government did not pay any money to the kidnappers.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ti gba àwọn tí ọlọ́pàá mú sílẹ̀.
en: Members have rescued those arrested by the police.

yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ni ẹgbẹ́ náà ti gba àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ sílẹ̀.
en: The group has released members from the city of Ibadan.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ mẹ́jọ ni ẹgbẹ́ gba sílẹ̀.
en: Eight members were saved by the group.

yo: Rẹ̀mi wà lára àwọn tí ẹgbẹ́ gbà sílẹ̀.
en: I was among those who were saved by the group.

yo: Ara àlùfáà àti ìyàwó o rẹ̀ kò yá láti wá sí ilée ìjọsìn.
en: The priest and his wife were tired of coming to the church.

yo: Nínú ilé ìjọsìn ni orí ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní fọ́ àlùfáà.
en: In the church, the head has started to be washed by the priest.

yo: Kété tí a parí ìsìn ni àlùfáà lọ sí ilé.
en: As soon as we finished the service, the priest went home.

yo: Ìyàwó àlùfáà fi ayé sílẹ̀ ni alẹ́ ẹ àná.
en: The priest's wife left the world last night.

yo: Àìsàn tí kò gbọ́ oògùn ló pa ìyàwó o àlùfáà náà.
en: The priest's wife was killed by an illness that did not respond to medicine.

yo: Ìwà ọmọlúwàbí tí ń di ohun tí kò wọ́pọ̀ láwùjọ.
en: Moral behavior that is becoming something that is not common in society.

yo: Àdìsá kò wu ìwà ọmọlúwàbí kankan nínú u ìpàdé náà.
en: Adísá did not like any decency in the meeting.

yo: Ìjà ni Àdìsá fi tú ìpàdé tí a ṣe lánàá ká.
en: Adísá broke up yesterday's meeting with a fight.

yo: Èèyàn mẹ́ta ló kú níbi ìpàdé tí a ṣe lánàá.
en: Three people died at the meeting held yesterday.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti mú Àdìsá lóríi wàhálà tí ó dá sílẹ̀.
en: The police have arrested Adisa for the trouble he caused.

yo: Ìyágànkú ni wọ́n gbé Àdìsá lọ.
en: Adisa was taken to Yangaungu.

yo: Àdìsá pa ìrọ́ fún àwọn ọlọ́pàá pé òun kò sí níbi ìpàdé náà.
en: Adisa lied to the police that he was not at the meeting.

yo: Ìjọba ti ṣetán láti gbé Àdìsá lọ sí ilée ẹjọ́.
en: The government is ready to take Adisa to court.

yo: Dàmọ́lá ni ìyàwó àkọ́kọ́ tí Àdìsá fẹ́.
en: Damola was Adisa's first wife.

yo: Ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọn Tolú ti ti ìlú òyìnbó dé pẹ̀lú oríṣiríṣi iǹkan.
en: Tolu's uncle has come to the city of Oibbo with various things.

yo: Tolú kò mú nǹkankan wá fún mi láti ìlúu òyìnbó.
en: He did not bring me anything from the city.

yo: Ìlú Èkó ni Tolú kọ́kọ́ dé si nígbà tí ó dé láti ìlú òyìnbó.
en: The city of Lagos was the first place Tolu came to when he came from the city of Oibbo.

yo: Ọjọ́ kẹrin tí Tolú dé ni ó fi ìlú Èkó sílẹ̀.
en: On the fourth day of Tolu's arrival, he left the city of Eko.

yo: Ọ̀daràn gbáà ni Àdìsá tí ó ń jẹ́ Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún.
en: Adisa, who is Alani Papanekunk, is a criminal.

yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ni Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún fi ṣe ibùgbé.
en: İbadan city is where Álani Papanakunk resides.

yo: Ọwọ́ ọ àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti ba adigunjalè náà ni ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: The police have caught the robber in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Àgọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá ni Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún kú sí.
en: Alani Papanakkon died at the police station.

yo: Ogún ọdún gbáko ni Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún fi jalè.
en: Álani Papanakunk has been stealing for twenty years.

yo: Ìyàwó Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún ṣì wà láyé báyìí báyìí.
en: Alani Papanhakunk's wife is still alive today.

yo: Ọmọ ìlú Ìbàdàn ni Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún.
en: Alani Papanakunk is a native of Ibadan.

yo: Ìlú Ọ̀wọ̀ ni wón bí Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún sí.
en: Alani Papanekon was born in the City of Respect.

yo: Ọwọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti ba babaláwo Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún.
en: The hands of the police have dealt with Alani Papankunk.

yo: Abìjà ni babaláwo Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún.
en: Abigail is the father of Álaní Papanakkon.

yo: Ìlú Èrúwà ni babaláwo Àlàní Pamọlẹ́kún ti wá.
en: The town of Eruwa is where Alani Papankakun came from.

yo: Inúu oko gẹdú ni wón ti mú babaláwo náà.
en: They have taken the gentleman from the farm.

yo: Babaláwo Àlàní nìkan ni ó mọ àṣíríi Àlàní.
en: Babalawo Alani is the only one who knows the secret of Alani.

yo: Babaláwo Àlàní gbé ẹ̀mí mì lẹ́yìn-in ọjọ́ mẹ́fà.
en: Babalawo Alani died after six days.

yo: Doyin nìkan ni ó kù nílé lẹ́yìn tí àwọn òbíi rẹ̀ ti jáde.
en: Doyin was the only one left at home after his parents left.

yo: Ọkọ Doyin sun ilée Doyin nígbà tí àwọn òbíi rẹ̀ kò sí ní ilé.
en: Doyin's husband burned down Doyin's house when her parents were not at home.

yo: Ọkọ àfẹ́sọ́nàa Doyin ti fún-un ní oyún.
en: Doyin's fiance has given her a pregnancy.

yo: Oyún-un oṣù mẹ́ta ni ó wà lára Doyin.
en: Doyin was three months pregnant.

yo: Jàre pa ara rẹ̀ nítorí pé kò ní owó.
en: Jare killed himself because he had no money.

yo: Ìjọba lé Àlàbá kúrò lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ẹ rẹ̀.
en: The government fired Alaba from his job.

yo: Ìyàwó Àdìsá ṣe àìsàn fún bíi ọdún mẹ́rin.
en: Adisa's wife was ill for four years.

yo: Ìgbòho padà sí ìlú Ìbàdàn lẹ́yìn tí ó kúrò ní ọgbàa ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: Igbho returned to the city of Ibadan after leaving the prison.

yo: Oṣù mẹ́wàá gbáko ni Àlàní lò ní ọgbàa ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: Alani spent the next ten months in prison.

yo: Dáre ni ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n àkọ́kọ́ tí a ní ní ìlúu wa.
en: Dare was the first teacher we had in our town.

yo: Ilé-ìwé gíga àkọ́kọ́ ní Ìbàdàn ni Dáre lọ.
en: Dare went to the first university in Ibadan.

yo: Ìlú Ìbàdàn ni ilé ìwé gíga àkọ́kọ́ wà.
en: The first university is located in Ibadan.

yo: Ètòo ìdìbò yíò wáyé lọ́dún tí ń bọ̀.
en: Elections will be held next year.

yo: Wòólì èké ni Rẹ̀mílẹ́kún Àjànàkú.
en: Remilekn Ajanaku is a false wall.

yo: Rẹ̀mílẹ́kún Àjànàkú ti lu àwọn ọmọ Ísírẹ́lì ní jìbìtì.
en: Remelek Ajanaku has deceived the Israelites.

yo: Rẹ̀mílẹ́kún fi ìyàwóo rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ lẹ́yìn-in ọdún mẹ́wàá.
en: Remileken left his wife after ten years.

yo: Obìnrin márùn-ún ni Dayọ̀ ti mú wá inú ilé yìí.
en: Dayo has brought five women into this house.

yo: Dayọ̀ pé ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n kí ó tó fẹ́ ìyàwó.
en: He was twenty-seven years old before he got married.

yo: Àríkẹ́ ni Dayọ̀ padà fẹ́ lẹ́yìn-in gbogbo akọ rẹ̀.
en: Dayo returned to Arike after all his men.

yo: Ìlú òyìnbó ni Dayọ̀ àti Àríkẹ́ ti ṣe ìgbéyàwóo wọn.
en: Dayo and Arikeh got married in the city of Oibbo.

yo: Àwọn òbíi wọn nìkan ló wà níbi ìgbéyàwó o wọn.
en: Only their parents were present at their wedding.

yo: Ṣọlá kò jálẹ̀ ó ní òun kọ́ ni ó ni oyún inú u Fadé.
en: She did not say that she was not pregnant with Fadé.

yo: Ìyá Àjànàkú mú Àjànàkú lọ sí oríi òkè ńlá.
en: Ajánákú's mother took Ajánákú to the top of the mountain.

yo: Àdúrà bí Àjànàkú yíò ṣe fẹ́ ìyàwó ni wón bá lọ sí orí òkè.
en: A prayer as Ajanakaku will marry his wife when they go to the top of the mountain.

yo: Oríi òkè náà ni Àjànàkú ti pàdé ìyàwó tí ó fẹ́.
en: At the top of the mountain, Ajanakaku met the wife he wanted.

yo: Àjànàkú gba ààwẹ̀ fún ọdún mẹ́ta kí ó tó fẹ́ ìyàwó.
en: Ajanaku fasted for three years before marrying.

yo: Ojojojúmọ́ ni mò ń jẹ àmàlà.
en: Every day I eat amla.

yo: Jẹ́nyọ̀ sọ pé oríi Tómi tóbi púpọ̀.
en: Jenyo said that Tomi's head was very big.

yo: Iṣẹ́ takuntakun ni àwọn ọmọ náà ṣe lálẹ́ ẹ àná.
en: The children worked hard last night.

yo: Àwọn ẹ̀gbọ́n ti gbé oúnjẹ èmí àti àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mi.
en: The brothers have taken food for me and my friends.

yo: Rájí ṣe ọdún iléyá ni ilé e rẹ̀ tó wà ní ìlú u Èkó.
en: Raji spends the first year of marriage at her home in the city of Eko.

yo: Àmàlà àti ìlasa ni ẹ̀gbọ́n ṣe fún mi lálé yìí.
en: Amala and ilasa were made for me tonight.

yo: Ẹ̀bà tútù ni mo jẹ sùn lánàá.
en: I slept cold last night.

yo: Ìṣọ̀kan àti ìfẹ́ ti dé padà sí inú u ẹgbẹ́ wa.
en: Unity and love have returned to our group.

yo: Àlùfáà wa ṣe ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn ará a ìjọ.
en: Our priest held a meeting with the members of the congregation.

yo: Aṣojú ìjọba mẹ́ta ló wà níbi ìpàdé náà.
en: There were three representatives of the government at the meeting.

yo: Àlùfáà wa ṣe gbogbo àwọn aṣojú u ìjọba lálejò.
en: Our priest welcomed all the government representatives.

yo: Ìjọba àti àwọn ọmọ ìlú ṣe ìpàdé ní oṣù kan sẹ́yìn.
en: The government and citizens held a meeting a month ago.

yo: Àkàngbé náà wà lára àwọn tó ṣe ìpàdé pẹ̀lú u ìjọba.
en: The minister was among those who held a meeting with the government.

yo: Kùtùkùtù òwúrò ọjọ́ àlàmísì ni mo jí lọ sí ààfin ọba.
en: Early on Sunday morning I went to the royal palace.

yo: Ànfàní púpọ̀ ló wà fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Èdèe Yorùbá.
en: There are many opportunities for Yoruba language learners.

yo: Àwọn Fúlàní darandaran kọlu ilé mi.
en: Fulani herdsmen attacked my house.

yo: Yínká ti lọ sí òkè òkun láti lọ kọ́ Èdèe Yorùbá.
en: Yinká has gone overseas to learn the Yoruba language.

yo: Àlàní ra ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ ńlá fún gbogbo àwọn ìyàwó o rẹ̀.
en: Alani bought a big car for all his wives.

yo: Aláàfin Ọ̀yọ́ kú lẹ́yìn ọdún púpọ̀ tí ó ti lò lóríi ìtẹ́.
en: Alafin Oyo died after many years on the throne.

yo: Gbogbo owó tí mo pa lójú agbo ni mo ti ná tán.
en: I have spent all the money I paid for the group.

yo: Orúkọ rere sàn ju wúrà àti fàdákà lọ.
en: A good name is better than gold and silver.

yo: Lójijì ni àbúrò o Gómìnà Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó kú lọ́jọ́ Ajé.
en: The younger brother of the Governor of Lagos State died suddenly on Monday.

yo: Iwájú iwájú ni ọ̀pá ẹ̀bìtì Dayọ̀ ń ré sí.
en: In the front is Dayo's ear bar.

yo: Àdìsá já ìwé fún ìyàwó o rẹ̀ lọ́sẹ̀ bíi mẹ́jọ sẹ́yìn.
en: Adisa wrote to his wife about eight weeks ago.

yo: Ìjọba kò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ìwà a jìbìtì láwùjọ.
en: The government is not interested in social fraud.

yo: Àdìsá ká ìyàwó o rẹ̀ níbi tí ó ti bá ọkùnrin mìíì sùn.
en: Adisa's wife is tired of sleeping with another man.

yo: Gbogbo ìdánwò tí Pẹ̀lúmi ṣe ló yege.
en: All the tests that Pelumi did were successful.

yo: Ilé alájà mẹ́rìndínlógún já lulẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ogún ọdún.
en: The 16-story building collapsed after 20 years.

yo: Adéjàre kọ́ ilé alájà mẹ́rìndínlógún láàárín ọ̀sẹ̀ méjìlá.
en: Adéjare built a sixteen-story building in twelve weeks.

yo: Pàdée mọ̀lẹ́bíi wa yíò wáyé nínú oṣù karùn-ún.
en: Our family reunion will take place in the fifth month.

yo: Wòlíì àgbà padà sílé lẹ́yìn tí ó lo oṣù mẹ́fà lọ́gbà a ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: The great prophet returned home after spending six months in prison.

yo: Àwọn sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ ọ ilé ìwé gíga wá ti rí iṣẹ́ sí òkè òkun.
en: The university graduates have found work overseas.

yo: Ìyà burúkú ni àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ fi jẹ akápò o wọn.
en: The members of the group ate their bags badly.

yo: Gbogbo owó ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa ni akápò o wa ti kójẹ.
en: All the money of our club is in our pocket.

yo: Àrẹ̀mú wọ púpọ̀ nínú aṣọ tí mo báa rà.
en: Aremu wears most of the clothes I buy.

yo: Ọmọ Aṣíwájú ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa ló ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí fọ́mọ ẹ̀ ní ọjọ́ Àìkú nílùú Èkó.
en: Our group's pioneer son was born on Easter Sunday in Lagos.

yo: Ọmọ Nàìjíríà tí wọ́n lé nítorí ọmọ rẹ̀ náà tún ti padà sẹ́nu iṣẹ́.
en: The Nigerian son who was fired because of his son has also returned to work.

yo: Wọ́n yin ìbọn parákùnrin tí ó ń jẹ́ Láńre síwájú ilé ẹ̀ l’Ádó Èkìtì.
en: They shot a man named Lanre in front of his house in Ado Ekiti.

yo: Akérédolú tí ó jẹ́ Gómìnà Ìlú Òǹdó dá àwọn àgbẹ̀ oníkòkó lọ́lá.
en: Akeredolu, who is the Governor of Ondo City, honored the farmers.

yo: Mi ò bá wọn jí owó rí, ṣùgbọ́n ó lóhun tí mo ṣe tí mo fi di milọníà.
en: I never stole money from them, but it is what I did that made me a millionaire.

yo: Ìwúrí ńlá lodò ẹja Ọbásanjọ́ jẹ́ fáwa ọlọ́sìn ẹja nílẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá.
en: A big inspiration for Obasanjo's fish is the fish farmer in Yoruba country.

yo: Ọba Ẹlẹ́gùṣì sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn ayánilówó o ti orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: The English King spoke about the creditors of Nigeria.

yo: Nítorí ààfin ọba táwọn jàǹdùkú kọlù, a gbọdọ̀ ṣètùtù kíá kíá.
en: Because the king's palace was attacked by mobs, we must be pacified immediately.

yo: A ní láti pẹ̀tù sáwọn alálẹ̀ nínú kí wọ́n má baà bínú sí wa.
en: We have to be kind to the bad guys so that they don't get angry with us.

yo: Ó sọ pé ọmọ Íbò tí Aláàfin ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ fi ṣe Olórí rèé o.
en: He said that he was the son of Ibo who had just been made President.

yo: Arákùnrin kan lùyàwó ẹ̀ pa pẹ̀lú oyún oṣù mẹ́jọ ní Ṣakí.
en: A brother killed his wife when she was eight months pregnant in Shaki.

yo: Arákùnrin tó kú sínú ìjàmbá ọkọ̀ òfuurufú ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ṣègbéyàwó ni.
en: The brother who died in the plane crash was just married.

yo: Àwọn Alábẹdé sọ pé iṣẹ́ tó ti bàjẹ́ ni àwọn maa ń túnṣe.
en: The Alábedé people say that they repair the work that has been damaged.

yo: Ó ṣeé ṣe kí ìjọba fòfin de àwọn tó ń ta gáásì ìdáná nílùú Èkó.
en: It is possible that the government will ban those who sell fuel gas in Lagos.

yo: Ààrẹ ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí ní ìlú ẹ̀, tí àwọn èèyàn ńlá sì kan sáárá sí i.
en: The president was born in his town, and great people flocked to him.

yo: Fọlákẹ́ jẹ́ ọmọ Yorùbá àtàtà tó ń ṣe akọ-iṣẹ́ nídìí iṣẹ́ ẹ ìfowópamọ́
en: Falakeh is a good Yoruba son who is working hard in the banking industry.

yo: Ó gbàlejò ìpàdé àpérò ẹgbẹ́ agbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ lédè e Yorùbá.
en: He hosted a Yoruba-language broadcaster's conference.

yo: Ààrẹ ti rèlùú òyìnbó láti lọọ gbàtọ́jú tó tọ́ àti èyí tó péye.
en: The president of the city is able to protect the right and the right.

yo: Arákùnrin náà ya ìṣù u kokéènì mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún.
en: The brother took ninety-seven cocaine.

yo: Òkìkí àtàwọn àbúrò ẹ̀ lu sikiọ́rítì pa lọ́jọ́ ọdún-un Kérésìmesì.
en: Okiki and his siblings died on Christmas Day.

yo: Ṣèyí Mákindé gba àwọn Ọba Yorùbá lálejò ní Ìbàdàn.
en: This Mákindé hosted the Yoruba Kings in Ibadan.

yo: Orí kó arábìnrin òṣèré tíátà náà yọ nínú ìjàmbá ọkọ̀ l’Ábẹ́òkúta.
en: The theater actor's sister lost her head in a car accident in Abeokuta.

yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ṣe àfihàn ohun tí òhun àti Aṣíwájú sọ.
en: The governor of the state of Lagos showed what the voice and Asuyve said.

yo: Nígbà wo ni o sọ pé Ògúnlànà dỌba Aládé nÍbẹ̀ju Lẹ́kí?
en: When did you say that Ogunlana defeated the King in Ibiju Leki?

yo: Èyí ni ìtàn ìgbésí ayé e Táyélolú tí ó jẹ́ Ìyálọ́jà a gbogbogbò
en: This is the story of the life of Táyelolulu who is the general salvation

yo: Ìwé náà fi yé wa pé òun ni yóò jẹ́ Ìyálọ́jà tó kọ́kọ́ dipò òṣèlú mú.
en: The book tells us that he will be the first Savior instead of a politician.

yo: Wọ́n gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé owó o rẹ̀, lẹ́yìn táwọn gómìnà a Yorùbá ṣèpàdé.
en: They attacked his money, after the Yoruba governors met.

yo: Aṣọ-ẹbí táwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà mú fáyẹyẹ ìfisípò Ààrẹ Amẹ́ríkà rèé.
en: The family dress that Nigerians take lightly to the inauguration of the President of the United States.

yo: Gómìnà Ìlú Èkó lọ pàdé Aṣíwájú lẹ́yìn tó balẹ̀ sílùú Èkó.
en: The Governor of Lagos City went to meet Ashuiw after he landed in Lagos.

yo: Iṣẹ́ ẹ wa kọ́ ni láti máa darí ọkọ̀ ní ojú u títì, ààbò àdúgbò niṣẹ́ ẹ wa,
en: Our job is not to drive with your eyes closed, our job is to protect the community,

yo: Nítorí ààbò o gbogbo àdúgbò la ṣe ń lo kámẹ́rà báyìí.
en: For security reasons, we are now using cameras in all communities.

yo: Ọmọ-ọba ni ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ tí wọ́n fi rọ́pò ọ̀gá tó ṣe aṣemáṣe.
en: The king's son is the spy who replaced the negligent master.

yo: Baálé ilé mọ́kàndínláàádọ́rùn-ún nìyàwó o wọ́n fi ìyà jẹ nílùú Èkó.
en: Ninety-nine householders were beaten to death in Lagos.

yo: Èyí ni ìdí táwọn alàgbà ọ̀hún fi pàdánù iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn.
en: This is why those elders lost their jobs.

yo: Nítorí ọmú àyà mi ni mi ò ṣe fẹ́ẹ́ bímọ tèmi lásìkò yìí.
en: Because of my breasts, I don't want to have my own child at this time.

yo: Ohun tójú u màmá à mi í rí ló mú kí n máa ran àwọn obìnrin lọ́wọ́.
en: It was my mother's care that made me help women.

yo: Ọ̀wọ̀ ọ Bàbá Olóyè ni gbogbo èèyàn fi ń wọ́ wá lọ́jà Ọbaníkòró.
en: Everyone comes to Obanikorro market out of respect for Baba Oloye.

yo: Ìjọba ti kùnà láti gbógun ti ìwà-ìbàjẹ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: The government has failed to fight corruption in Nigeria.

yo: Àwọn ológun tún ń ta ìbọn fún àwọn ikọ̀ ọ ọlọ́tẹ̀.
en: The soldiers are also firing at the rebel ambassadors.

yo: Ìgbòho sọ pé Ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn ni òun ń gbéjà lọ báyìí.
en: Igbho said that he is now fighting for Ogun State.

yo: Ìròyìn fi yé wa pé wọ́n ti tú ṣẹkẹ́ṣẹkẹ̀ tó wà lọ́wọ́ àti ẹsẹ̀ ẹ Ìgbòho.
en: News tells us that they have removed the bracelet from Igbho's hands and feet.

yo: Akọni obìnrin tí a kò le gbàgbé láéláé ni Màmá Mọ́gàjí.
en: A heroine who can never be forgotten is Mamma Mogaji.

yo: Ìjọba san kàbìtì owó fún àwọn ẹbíi òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ kánsù tó di olóògbé.
en: The government paid a sum of money to the families of the deceased workers.

yo: Akérédolú gbàlejò olórí ọlọ́jà ilẹ̀ Nàìjíríà nílùú Àkúrẹ́.
en: Akeredolu hosted the Nigerian businessman in Akure.

yo: Àjọ náà tún gbógun ti gómìnà àná ìlú Èkó.
en: The organization also attacked the previous governor of the city of Eko.

yo: Wọ́n fi kọ́kọ́rọ́ ti ilé ẹ̀ pa nítorí ìwádìí tí wọ́n ń ṣe.
en: They kept the key to your house because of the investigation they were doing.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ọ èèyàn sunkún níbi ìsìnkú olórí ẹgbẹ́ àwọn onígbàgbọ náà.
en: Many people cried at the funeral of the leader of the group of believers.

yo: Ọba Onírù sọ pé Ṣẹ́gun fọwọ́ sí í bí wọ́n ṣe yan àwọn lọ́ba.
en: King Oniru said that Shegun agreed as they were chosen as the king.

yo: A ti bẹ gómìnà pé kí wọ́n jẹ́ kí a máa ṣiṣẹ́ lábẹ́ ẹ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ńlá.
en: We have begged the governor to allow us to work under you big companies.

yo: Ó bèrè nípa àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ń gbéṣẹ́ fún ní Èkó.
en: He asked about the companies they work for in Lagos.

yo: Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ àwọn abánikọ́lé ló sọ èyí di mímọ̀ ní àná ọjọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun.
en: The president of the builders union made this known yesterday on Victory Day.

yo: Olorì Ọọ̀ni ṣayẹyẹ ọjọ́ọ̀bíi Tadénikáwò pẹ̀lú u àwòrán-an rẹ̀.
en: Olori Oni celebrated Tadenikawo's birthday with his portrait.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin oníṣòwò kékèké la fẹ́ẹ́ ràn lọ́wọ́ báyìí.
en: We want to help 4 thousand small businessmen now.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ń gbé ìṣúná owó lọ sílé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin láìpẹ́.

yo: Amósùn dójúti àwọn ẹlẹ́gàn, lẹ́yìn tí òun náà lọ sọ́dọ̀ Aṣíwájú.

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni ohun tí ẹ gbọ́, mo ní ìjọ onìgbàgbọ́ tí mò ń lọ.

yo: Wọ́n ti kéde pé Amòfin Bọ́lájí ti di Olúpo Àjàṣẹ́-Ìpo.

yo: Arábìnrin náà fẹ́ẹ́ ṣẹ̀filọ́lẹ̀ ìwé ìròyìn-in tirẹ̀ ní ìlú Èkó ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kànlá èèyàn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ẹ mọ́tò àti ọ̀kadà ni a yá lówó.
en: One thousand and eleven people who work in the car and in the kitchen were given money.

en: We want to celebrate the 'Culture Day' to promote the economy of our country.

yo: Ó mà ṣeé o! Wọn ni ààrùn-un Kòrónà ló ṣekúpa Ọ̀ṣínọ́wọ̀.
en: It's possible! It was the Corona virus that killed Osinnowo.

yo: Àjàyí tó ń jalè nínúu súnkẹrẹ-fàkẹrẹ ọkọ̀ ní ìlú Èkó ti wọ gàù.

en: The Lagos state government has also issued a warning to workers against night work.

en: I have no intention of being a market leader before

yo: Wọ́n nípé èyí jẹ́ ọlá Aṣíwájú tí kò sí nílé ni.

yo: A ní láti jẹ́ kí ó yé gbogbo ò lú mọ̀ pé kìí ṣe gbogbo olóṣèlú lolè.

yo: Gbèsè tí à ń jẹ lórí iná a mọ̀nà-mọ́ná la ṣe fi kún owó iná.

yo: A máa fa ẹ̀rọ ayélujára s'áwọn ilé-ìwé ọgọ́rùn-ún kóṣù tóó parí.

yo: Ìyálọ́jà sọ pé wàhálà àwọn daran-daran ń fa ọ̀wọ́ngọ́gó o oúnjẹ.
en: Iyalojja said that the problem of herdsmen is causing a shortage of food.

yo: Àtẹ̀jáde náà fi yé wa pé òṣìṣẹ́ ilé ìfowópamọ́ tó ń ṣe jìbìtì ti há.
en: The publication tells us that the bank employee who committed the fraud has been arrested.

yo: Egbinrin ọ̀tẹ̀ lọ̀rọ̀ yìí o, Elédùmare nìkan ló lè gbani.
en: Only Elédumare can help this rebellious woman.

yo: Ìparí oṣù ni wọ́n máa sìnkú Yínká Odùmákin ní Ifẹ̀.
en: At the end of the month, they will bury Yinká Odumákin in Love.

yo: Àwọn méjèèjì yóò kojú ara wọn níbi ìbò o Gómìnà a Èkìtì.
en: The two will face each other at the Ekiti Governorship election.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́tàlélàáádọ́rin, Aláàfin Ọ̀yọ́ gbé adé lórí Onísòlú.
en: After seventy-three years, Alaafin Oyo put the crown on Onisoli.

yo: Gbogbo ilé táwọn olówó pín mọ́ra wọn lọ́wọ́ ni wọ́n fagilé.
en: All the houses shared by the rich were cancelled.

yo: Ọba ti ṣ'àdéhùn pé láìpẹ́ a máa ní Ìyálọ́jà tuntun ní ilẹ̀ Ẹ̀gbá.
en: The king has promised that soon we will have a new salvation in the land of Egba.

yo: Àgbéyẹ̀wò gbọdọ̀ wà fún òfin tó de ẹnubodè ilẹ̀ ẹ wa.
en: There must be a review for the law that reaches the gate of our land.

yo: A gbìyànjú láti du ẹ̀mí i Àjìmọ̀bi, ṣùgbọ́n Olúwa ló yé.
en: We tried to take Ajimobi's life, but the Lord understood.

yo: A ò ní gba owó lọ́wọ́ ẹnikẹ́ni láti paríi gbọ̀ngán táà ń kọ̀.
en: We will not take money from anyone to finish the hall we are building.

yo: Ètò ìgbanisíṣẹ́ ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ fáwọn dọ́kítà àti nọ́ọ̀sì ní ìlú Èkó.
en: The recruitment process has started for doctors and nurses in Lagos.

yo: Ìdí tí a fi ṣèfilọ́lẹ̀ àkójọpọ̀ ọ iṣẹ́ ìwádìí lórí àwọn ogúnléndé nìyí.
en: This is the reason why we have launched a collection of research work on these legends.

yo: Bí ìrọ̀rùn ṣe máa bá gbogbo ọmọ ọjà ló jẹ mí lógún.
en: I was amazed at how easy it would be for every child in the market.

yo: Kàyèéfì! Ọlọ́pàá a gómìnà dákú lójijì níbi ayẹyẹ òmìnira lọ́jọ́ Ajé.
en: Wonder! The police and the governor suddenly fainted at the Independence Day celebration.

yo: Ìyalájé e gbogbogbò ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí alárinrin ní òkè òkun lọ́sẹ̀ tó lọ.
en: The general public had a wonderful overseas trip last week.

yo: Ohun ojú wá rí lákòókò o kónílé-ó-gbélé e Kòrónà kìí ṣe kékeré.
en: What we saw at the time when he went home, Corona is not small.

yo: Àwòrán ọkọ̀ tuntun tí gómìnà ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ kó wọ̀lú fáwọn ará Èkó rèé.
en: A picture of the new vehicle that the governor has just brought in for the people of Eko.

yo: Ẹ jẹ́ kí ó yé wọn pé ọgbọ́n ju agbára, ariwo kọ́ nìjà.
en: Let them understand that wisdom is greater than strength, noise is not a challenge.

yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ṣèdárò Bàbá Ètò tó jáde láyé.
en: The governor of Lagos state mourned the death of Baba Etto.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ọ̀sẹ̀ kan tí Alàgbà náà jáde láyé, ọrọ̀ ajé fìdí jálẹ̀ níkọ̀tún
en: After a week of the Elder's death, the economy was completely restored.

yo: Kání mo gbéjọba fún Abíọ́lá ni, wọn ì bá pa á sórí oyè.
en: If I had given power to Abiola, they would have killed him.

yo: Kò fi mẹ̀kúnù, opó àtàwọn aláìníyàá ṣeré nígbà ayé ẹ̀.
en: He did not play with the poor, the widow and the unmarried during his life.

yo: Kíni ìdí tí o fi fi Àlàbí ṣe alatilẹyin rẹ ní àsìkò yìí?
en: Why did you choose Álibi as your supporter this season?

yo: Ìdààmú ńlá làwọn tó ń ba ohun ìní ìjọba jẹ́ ń kó bá wa.
en: Those who destroy government property are causing us great trouble.

yo: Ìjọba ti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ilé tí atúnléṣe fi lu jìbìtì l'Ékòó.
en: The government has taken action against the housing scam in Ekoo.

yo: Nítorí ọ̀wọ́n-gógó ọjà, Akérédolú fòfin de àwọn tó ń já ìwé.
en: Because of the high price, Akeredolu banned those who broke books.

yo: Gbèsè rèé o! Wọ́n ti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé owó Bàbá Ìjẹ̀bú ní ilé ìfowópamọ́.
en: It's your fault! They have tracked down Father Ijebu's money in the bank.

yo: Ó ní pé ọjọ́ kan ni òun fi ọkọ̀ mẹ́tàlélógún tọrẹ.
en: He said that one day he donated twenty-three boats.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́jà ti ní ànfààní àti ṣiṣẹ́ daago márùn-ún ìrọ̀lẹ́.
en: Traders have had the opportunity and work five hours in the evening.

yo: Ẹ fura o! Wọ́n fẹ́ẹ́ fi ìwọ́de dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ ni.
en: Suspect it! They want to cause trouble.

yo: Bàbá àgbàlagbà ti Bàrígà lọ bá aṣẹ́wó sùn lo gójì, ló bá kú.
en: The elderly father of Bariga went to bed with a prostitute and died.

yo: Àwọn oníná a mọ̀nà-mọ́ná nìṣòro wà lórí ọ̀rọ omi-ẹ̀rọ tí kò sí.
en: Firefighters are concerned about the lack of water.

yo: Mi ò le gbàgbé ọjọ́ tí iná ara gbohùngbohùn gbé mi.
en: I can't forget the day the speaker caught fire.

yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé nígbà tí mo fẹ́ẹ́ kọrin ní Ṣakí.
en: The incident happened when I was about to sing in Shaki.

yo: Ọgbọ́n inú ló yẹ kí Ìgbòho fi jìjà ìlú, kìí ṣe ariwo lásán.
en: Igbho should fight the city with wisdom, not just noise.

yo: Ẹ wo àwọn àwòrán tí àgbà òṣèré e tíátà náà fi ṣayẹyẹ ọjọ́ọ̀bí i rẹ̀.
en: Look at the pictures that the old theater actor used to celebrate his birthday.

yo: Ilé-ìjọsìn olówó-iyebíye tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ kọ́ parí ni wọn á ti pàdé.
en: They will meet the newly completed expensive church.

yo: Alàgbà àgbà Abíóyè ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí alárinrin ní ìlú Àbújá.
en: Elder Abioye was born in the city of Abuja.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ ti dá arákùnrin onítíátà náà padà sẹ́wọ̀n.
en: The court has returned the theater brother to prison.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ pàṣẹ pé kí olùkọ yunifásítì dá mílíọ̀nù mẹ́sàn-án náírà padà.
en: The court ordered the university teacher to return nine million naira.

yo: Gbogbo owó táà ń gbà lágbàdo Òkè Odò ló bófin mu.
en: All the money we get from Oke Odò is legal.

yo: Ìdààmú bá olówó oníṣòwò nígbà tí ó pàdánù owó kàbìtì.
en: A rich businessman is troubled when he loses money.

yo: Wọ́n fẹ́ẹ́ gbàjọba lọ́wọ́ Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà o!
en: They want to take power from the President of Nigeria!

yo: Kàyéfì ló jẹ́ fún gbogbo wa bí olóyè náà ṣe di Òsì ilẹ̀ ẹ Ẹ̀gbá.
en: It is a wonder for all of us how the chief became the left of Egba land.

yo: Ìyálọ́jà sọ fún àwọn oníròyìn pé Àtàndá kò ní ìsò ní ọjà àwọn.
en: Iyalojja told reporters that Atanda has no interest in their products.

yo: Tí o bá fẹ́ ra ọjà gidi, o gbọdọ̀ dé inú níbi tí àwọn èèyàn pọ̀ sí.
en: If you want to buy the real product, you must go inside where there are more people.

yo: Ìjọba gbọdọ̀ ran àwa àgbẹ ẹlẹ́ja lọ́wọ́ fún ìlọsíwájú iṣẹ́ ẹ wa.
en: The government must help us fish farmers for the advancement of our work.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ wa lati ní kí wọ́n lọ jókòó sílé.
en: Many of your workers came to ask them to go and sit at home.

yo: A ò lè máa tú àṣírí ìgbésẹ̀ táà ń gbé lábẹ́lẹ̀ lóri ọ̀rọ̀ náà.
en: We cannot reveal the secret of the action we are taking underground on the issue.

yo: Àwọn wọ̀nyí ni sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ orí ẹ̀rọ ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ tó ń ṣe bẹbẹ
en: These are the speakers on the radio that are pleading.

yo: Mo ṣetán àti mú ìrọ̀rùn bá àwọn oníṣòwò nílẹ̀ẹ Ẹ̀gbá.
en: I am willing and able to facilitate the traders in Egba.

yo: Oṣòdì Ìsọlọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbógun ti àwọn tó ń tajà lójúu títì.
en: The evil of Isolo began to attack those who sell with their eyes closed.

yo: A ti sọ fún wọn kí wọ́n yé dúró sí oríi kòtò ìdaminù.
en: We have told them to stay at the top of the drainage ditch.

yo: Ẹ wo owó rẹpẹtẹ tí akọ̀wé-owó dá padà sápò o ìjọba.
en: Look at the huge amount of money that the secretary-treasurer returned to the government.

yo: Ẹ̀bùn Ọlọ́run tí kò ní àfiwé ni ọkùnrin apanilẹ́rìín náà.
en: The comic man is God's incomparable gift.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ṣèfilọ́lẹ̀ ilé-ìwòsàn àwọn aláboyún nílùú Ẹ̀pẹ́.
en: Sanwó-Olu funded a maternity hospital in Ephe town.

yo: Ìjọba fẹ́ẹ́ dí gbogbo kòtò tó wà lójúnà a ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó.
en: The government is about to block all the potholes on the road in Lagos state.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ṣètò ìrànwọ́ fún ìyá ọmọ tí wọ́n yìnbọn pa níbi ìwọ́de.
en: Sanwó-Olu organizes help for the mother of the child who was shot dead at the gate.

yo: Abẹ́rẹ́ tó lókùn niwá, a kìí jalè, a kìí ṣe gbọ́mọ-gbọ́mọ.
en: It's a strong start here, we don't steal, we don't steal on purpose.

yo: Onífàájì táa jẹ́ ni wọ́n ṣe ń pè wá lọ́kọ aṣẹ́wó.
en: They call us prostitutes because we are leisurely.

yo: Bí ẹ ṣe lè so nọ́mbà ìdánimọ̀ ọ yín pọ̀ mọ́ nọ́mbà fóònù tí ẹ̀ ń lò.
en: How to link your social security number to the phone number you use.

yo: Ìjọba gbọdọ̀ ṣe afárá ẹlẹ́sẹ̀ sí ìlú u wa láti díwọ́ ìjàmbá tó ń ṣelẹ̀.
en: The government must build a pedestrian bridge in our city to prevent the accidents that are happening.

yo: Ìfipábánilòpọ̀ máa dínkù bí ìjọba bá ṣí ilé-ìgbáfẹ́ àti ilé-ẹjọ́.
en: Rape will decrease if the government opens prisons and courts.

yo: Ẹ fura! Wọ́n fẹ́ẹ́ kọlu àwọn ilé-ìjọsìn, àtàwọn olórí ẹlẹ́sìn.
en: Suspect! They want to attack churches and religious leaders.

yo: Gbajúgbajà òṣèré tí àwọn èèyàn mọ̀ sí Ọmọ ọba Akínwálé ti kú o!
en: The famous actor who is known as Prince Akinwalé is dead!

yo: Ọ́ jẹ́ ọmọ Yorùbá àtàtà tó mọ̀ nípa ká gbéṣẹ́ ìfowópamọ́ lárugẹ
en: He is a good Yoruba son who knows how to promote banking

yo: Ilé-ìjọsìn náà ni ilé olókè àkọ́kọ́ ní ìlú u wa.
en: The church is the first tall building in the city.

yo: Àwọn olómi inú ọ̀rá fi àṣejù bọ̀ ọ́ ni, ọ̀rá kò wọ́n.
en: The liquids in the fat feed you too much, the fat does not weigh you down.

yo: Wọ́n ti kìlọ̀ fún wọn kí wọ́n má fi kún owó omi.
en: They have been warned not to add water bills.

yo: Alàgbà ọ̀hún sọ pé Ọlọrun Ọba kòrira àwọn tó ń tako òfin ìjọba.
en: The elder said that God the King hates those who oppose the law of the government.

yo: Àwọn gómìnà a gúsù Nàìjíríà sọ pé àwọn nipò ààrẹ kàn.
en: The governors of southern Nigeria said that they are only the president.

yo: Lẹ́yìn oṣù keje la máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í fòfin de àwọn ọlọ́kadà.
en: After the month of July, we will start banning the illegals.

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun ti gbé ìpologo Kòrónà lọ sọ́jà
en: Osun state government has taken the Corona campaign to the market

yo: Gbogbo àwọn gómìnà ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá ni wọ́n kí ọba tuntun náà.
en: All the governors of Yoruba land greeted the new king.

yo: A máa bá àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ṣẹ̀pàdé láìpẹ́.
en: We will meet with the telecommunications companies soon.

yo: Ọmọbìnrin ẹni ọdún mẹ́tàlélógún fipá bá ọmọ kékeré lòpọ̀.
en: A 23-year-old girl raped a young child.

yo: Pẹ̀lúu gbogbo ìkìlọ̀ tí wọ́n ṣe fun, ọmọ náà ti róyún he.
en: Despite all the warnings, the child is pregnant.

yo: Eléwé-Ọmọ àti Ìgbòho fẹ́ẹ́ kọlu ara wọn ní Èkó níbí.
en: Elelewe-Omo and Igbho are about to attack each other in Lagos here.

yo: Ṣé arákùnrin òṣèré e tíátà náà ti di mùsùlùmí ni?
en: Has the actor's brother become a Muslim?

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá fẹ́ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú u wa lórí àwọn ayédèrú ògùn.
en: The police department wants to cooperate with him on drug counterfeiting.

yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó bá àwọn tó ń ṣèwọ́de ní àná sọ̀rọ̀.
en: The Governor of Eko State spoke to those who arrived yesterday.

yo: Àwòrán àwọn tí wọ́n jalè e mílíọ̀nù mẹ́fà a owó dọ́là lámẹ́ríkà rèè.
en: Picture of those who stole six million dollars.

yo: Mi ò ní fèsì sọ́rọ̀ t’Ọ́básanjọ́ sọ sí mi báyìí, ó kù díẹ̀.
en: I will not respond to what Obasanjo said to me now, there is little left.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ń sọ̀rọ̀ burúkú sí okùnrin onítíátà ọ̀hún.
en: Young people are talking bad about that theater man.

yo: Ìwà tí ń tini lójú ju olè lọ ni àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ ń hù.
en: His children are committing acts that are worse than theft.

yo: Orúkọ burúkú ni wọ́n fẹ́ sọ àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa.
en: They want to call our members a bad name.

yo: Ìwà ìbanilórúkọjẹ́ yìí ló jẹ́ ka sinmi iṣẹ́ fún ìgbà díẹ̀.
en: This slander caused him to be temporarily suspended.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí Wòlíì èké kan sọ sí Bàbá à mi ló mú mi kọrin.
en: The words that a false prophet said to my father made me sing.

yo: Ọlọ́run kọ́ ló sọ pé kí n yan ọ̀nà iṣẹ́ orin tí mò ń tọ̀.
en: God did not tell me to choose the path of music that I am on.

yo: Ó ní ohun tó wu òhun jù láyé ni àwọn ìbejì.
en: He has the best thing in the world are twins.

yo: Iṣẹ́ lórí ọjà a wa tuntun máa parí títí oṣù tó ń bọ̀.
en: Work on our new market will be completed by next month.

yo: Ọjà kejì náà máa gbàlejò ọjà ẹ̀rọ ayélujára láìpẹ́.
en: The second market will soon host an online market.

yo: Wọ́n ti sọ ìdí tí Aláàfin ṣe fi Okùnọlá joye Àkọ́sìn ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá.
en: They have told why Aláafin made Okunola the Chief Minister of Yoruba land.

yo: Wọ́n ti jogún ìdókòwò ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún-un mílíọ̀nù u dọ́là tí ó fi sílẹ̀
en: They have inherited the multi-billion dollar investment he left behind.

yo: Ọ̀nà wo làwọn adàlúrú fẹ́ẹ́ gbà yọ báyìí?
en: What way do the evildoers want to escape now?

yo: Gbèsè ńlá ni Kòrónà àsìkò yìí jẹ́ fún àwọn ọmọ ìlú.
en: Corona is a big debt this season for the citizens.

yo: Aráàlú gbọdọ̀ sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú u wa nítorí àwọn ayédèrú abániralé.
en: The public must cooperate with us because of the counterfeiters.

yo: Ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ náà ní kò sẹ́ni tó lè já òun kúrò lẹ́yìn ọ̀gá òun.
en: The member said that no one can separate him from his boss.

yo: Àwa oníṣègùn ìbílẹ̀ gbọ́dọ̀ tẹra mọ́ iṣẹ́ lóríi àwọn ààrùn òde-òní.
en: We traditional healers must continue to work on modern diseases.

yo: Ìròyìn ṣàlàyé bí olórí ogun ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ náà ṣe gbẹ̀mi ara rẹ̀
en: The report explains how the leader of the rebel army committed suicide

yo: Gbajúmọ̀ akọrin ọ̀hún ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí pẹ̀lú irinṣẹ́ ìgbàlódé tuntun.
en: The famous singer was born with a new modern tool.

yo: Ìyálọ́jà náà jẹ́ni t'áwọn oníṣòwò kò le gbàgbé láéláé.
en: The rescue is one that the traders will never forget.

yo: Àwòrán àwọn irinṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá tí ààrẹ wa á ṣèfilọ́lẹ̀ rẹ̀ ní Èkó nìyí.
en: Here is a picture of the police tools that our president will introduce in Lagos.

yo: Ilé-ìfowópamọ́ àkọ́kọ́ fẹ́ ró àwọn obìnrin lágbára.
en: First Bank wants to empower women.

yo: Àwọn ọkọ̀ tó máa pààrọ̀ ọ̀kadà yóó bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ lọ́sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.
en: The vehicles that will change the color will start working next week.

yo: Ẹní bá máa ṣiṣẹ́ ẹ pèdè-pèdè gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ ọlọ́pọlọ pípé.
en: The person who is going to work for you must be a perfect person.

yo: Bílíọ̀nù mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́je náírà la pa wọlé láàárín oṣù mẹ́ta.
en: We brought in 77 billion naira within three months.

yo: Ìtura dé! Iṣẹ́ afárá-ńlá a tiwá ti parí, kí a ṣe ìfilélẹ̀ lókù.
en: Relief has arrived! Our big bridge work is finished, let's do the laying tomorrow.

yo: Àwọn ará Àkútè ń bẹ Dàpọ̀ Abíọ́dún kí ó tún ojú ọ̀nà àwọn ṣe
en: The people of Akute are asking Dapo Abiodun to repair their roads

yo: Eré Abẹ̀joyè apá karùn-ún ń bọ̀ ní sinimá láìpẹ́.

en: After 50 years of marriage, the love between the king and the leader is still burning.

yo: Ilé ìfowópamọ́ ọ̀hún gbé ìdíje fáwọn ọmọdé jáde.
en: The bank held a competition for children.

yo: Ó ṣojú mi kòró nígbà ti ìyàwó Àkànbí fa ọ̀bẹ yọ síi.
en: He looked at me bitterly when Akanbi's wife pulled out a knife.

yo: Ọ̀gá a mi ni Lágbájá, ṣùgbọ́n a jọ dá ẹgbẹ́ eré sílẹ̀ ní Mushin ni.
en: My boss is Lagjaja, but we started a play club together in Mushin.

yo: Lẹ́yìn tíyàwo alàgbà ọ̀hún gbapò adarí, ìjọba ránṣẹ́ pè é.
en: After the elder's marriage took over as leader, the government sent for him.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ogún ọdún nígà, Olóyè Adésọjí Àjàyí-Bẹ̀m̀bẹ́ sọ ìrírí i wọn.
en: After 20 years, Chief Adésoji Ajayi-Bembe shared his experience with them.

yo: Wọ́n sọ àwọn ohun tí wọ́n ti ṣe gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ọbaníkòró o ìlúu Èkó.
en: They said what they had done as the King of the city of Eko.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ọ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù-ẹlẹ́sẹ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà di ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.
en: The speech of the Nigerian national football player is next week.

yo: Àtolówó àti mẹ̀kúnnù ni ọkọ̀ ojú-irin tuntun wà fún.
en: New trains are cheap and expensive.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogójì i náírà là ń san fáwọn ọ̀dọ́ táa gbà síṣẹ́.
en: We are paying 40,000 naira to the youths we hire.

yo: Ìpolongo Aṣíwájú fún ipò o ààrẹ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní òkè òkun ní àná.
en: The presidential campaign started overseas yesterday.

yo: Ọ̀ṣínbàjò àtàwọn ọmọ-iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ náà ṣẹ̀pàdé ìdákọ̀nkọ̀ pẹ̀lú Aláàfin.
en: Oshinbajo and his staff also had a meeting with Alafin.

yo: Irọ́ ni pé Oyètọ́lá gba bílíọ̀nù méjìdínláàádọ́ta lọ́wọ́ ọ ẹnìkan.
en: It is a lie that Oyetola took 58 billion from someone.

yo: Lásìkò ìjọba Fáṣọlá ni mo dábàá a iṣẹ́ ojú-ọ̀nà Agége.
en: During Fashola's reign, I proposed the Agége road project.

yo: Ẹ wo ohun tí Sanwó-Olú ń ṣe lẹ́yìn tó kó ààrùn-un Kòrónà.
en: Look at what Sanwó-Olu is doing after contracting the Corona virus.

yo: Bí ọ̀rọ̀-ajé e Sòlú-Aládé ṣe máa tẹ̀ síwájú ló jẹ mí lógún.
en: How the economy of Solu-Aládé will continue is what worries me.

yo: Ṣèyí Mákindé fìtàn balẹ̀ pẹ̀lú owó tó fẹ́ ná lọ́dún tí ń bọ̀.
en: Here Makinde is calm with the money he wants to spend in the coming year.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ ẹlẹ́ran ti yàtọ̀ sí tàtijọ́, a kìí yọ àdá yọ̀bẹ mọ́.
en: The carnivore group is different from the old one, we don't remove it anymore.

yo: Oyèdépò rọ̀jò àdúrà ńlá lóríi Tọ́pẹ́ Àlàbí níbi ọjọ́ọ̀bí ẹ̀.
en: Oyedepo prayed a big prayer on Tope Alibi at his birthday.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ àtúnkọ́ ilé-ìwòsàn fáwọn ọmọdé e ọ̀hún.
en: Sanwó-Olu has started rebuilding a hospital for those children.

yo: Èyí ń wáyé lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́fà tí wọ́n kọ́ ilé-ìwòsàn náà.
en: This is happening after fifty-seven years that the hospital was built.

yo: Ayọ̀rìndé tó ń ṣe ayédèrú abánigbalé níkòròdú ti wọ gàù!
en: The joker who fakes the internet has worn gaue!

yo: Àwọn àgbà ẹgbẹ́ ti fọwọ́ sí Sanwó-Olú fún sáà a ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kejì.
en: The leaders of the group have signed the Sanwó-Olu for the second term.

yo: Ọládàpọ̀ máa di alága kánsù Àgbàdo Òkè-Odò ní ọ̀la.
en: Oladapo will become the chairman of Agbado Oke-Odo tomorrow.

yo: Ẹ wo àwọn bọ̀rọ̀kìnní oníṣòwò méjìlá tí Onírù fi joyè láìpẹ́ yìí.
en: Take a look at the 12 business leaders that Oniruu recently held.

yo: Ohun táwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà ń sọ nípa owó iná rèé.
en: What Nigerians are saying about their electricity bills.

yo: Lójijì, iná ṣẹ́yọ níle Ìgbòho ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá lọ.
en: Suddenly, a fire broke out in Igbho's house last week.

yo: Ìdí tí mo fi gbà láti ṣe aṣojú ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń ṣe ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ náà nìyí.
en: This is the reason why I agreed to represent the company that makes the communication device.

yo: Ẹ wo iye tí Bàbá Ìjẹ̀bú dá níbi ìfilọ́lẹ̀ tí wọ́n ṣe fún Ìyàwó o Ààrẹ.
en: Look at how much Mr. Ijebu created at the farewell party for the First Lady.

yo: Kò sí wàhálà, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn èèyàn kò jáde wáá dìbò.
en: There was no problem, but people did not come out to vote.

yo: Rògbòdìyàn bẹ́ sílẹ̀ nínú ìjọ, nítorí ọjọ́ọ̀bí i Kúmúyì olórí i ìjọ.
en: Trouble broke out in the church because of the birth of Kumuyi, the head of the church.

yo: Ìròyìn ẹlẹ́jẹ̀! Mi ò sá lọ sí Ilẹ̀ ẹ Faransé o, ilé ni mo wà.
en: Bloody news! I did not run away to France, I am at home.

yo: Ṣẹ́gun Ọ̀ṣọbà náà ti lọọ ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ́ ẹsẹ̀ ní òkè òkun.
en: Conquering the Beauty has gone to work under foot overseas.

yo: Mo fẹ́ kí Sanwó-Olú ràn wá lọ́wọ́ nípa ètò ìsìnkú u ọkọ mi
en: I want Sanwó-Olu to help us with my husband's funeral plan

yo: Làtí Alágbádá ti gbòmìnira, lẹ́yìn tí ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga àpapọ̀ dáa sílẹ̀.
en: The civil society has become independent, after the federal high court was established.

yo: Àkànbí tó fipá bá ọmọbìnrin ní àjọṣepọ̀ l’Éjìgbò ti wọ gàù.
en: A man who raped a girl in a relationship in Éjibbo has been arrested.

yo: Ọwọ́ ọ àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti tẹ̀ẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ̀ tí wọ́n jọ hu ìwà náà.
en: The hands of the police have followed along with his friends who committed the act.

yo: Ó mà ṣeé o! Ìyàwó alága kánsù kú lójijì ní Ìbàdàn.
en: It's possible! The chairman's wife died suddenly in Ibadan.

yo: Ìgboro ó dàrú nítorí ikú u Ìbídùńní ní ìlú u Èkó.
en: Igboro was disturbed because of his death in Ibidunni in his city of Ego.

yo: Yéèpà! Ọmọ ilé-ìjọsìn Oyèdépò bímọ mẹ́fà lẹ́ẹ̀kan ṣoṣo.
en: Yep! A member of the Oyedepo church gave birth to six children at once.

yo: Iṣẹ́ táwọn ará Èkó gbé lé wa lọ́wọ́ kìí ṣohun tẹ́nìkan lè dá ṣe.
en: The work that the people of Eko entrusted us with is not something that anyone can do.

yo: Nígbà wo gangan ni Bàbá olórin náà fi ayé sílẹ̀?
en: When exactly did the singer's father leave the world?

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́jà tí kò f'ọwọ́ mẹ́wẹ̀ẹ̀wá jẹun ló móríbọ́ lásìkò o Kòrónà.
en: Shoppers who don't eat with their hands are the victims of Corona.

yo: Ọdún kan Dàpọ̀ tayọ gbogbo àwọn tó ti ṣe gómìnà l’Ógùn.
en: A year together with all those who have been the governor of Ogun.

yo: Olúọmọ sọ pé ọlọ́pọlọ pípé làwọn ọmọlẹ́yìn òun.
en: Olumoma said that his followers are perfect.

yo: Àwọn olórí ẹlẹ́sìn-in Mùsùlùmí ilẹ̀ Yorùbá f'ẹjọ́ Olúwòó sun Oyètọ́lá.
en: The Muslim leaders of the Yoruba land sued Oluwoo sun Oyetola.
