yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ayélujára náà máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní Èkó lọ́dún tó ń bọ̀.
en: The internet company will start operations in Lagos next year.

yo: Àṣeyọrí ilé ìfowópamọ́ ọ wa fihàn pé ẹni tó ṣe é bá dòwòpọ̀ ni wá.
en: The success of our bank shows that we are the people who do it together.

yo: Òun nìkan àtàwọn mínísítà ṣàbẹ̀wò sílé e ilé ààrẹ ní Àbújá.
en: He alone and the ministers visited the president's house in Abuja.

yo: Ọjà ìlú u wa máa parí láìpẹ́, a ò ní fohunkóhun du ẹnìkan
en: Our city market will end soon, we will not agree with anyone

yo: Ètò ẹ̀kọ́ àti iṣẹ́ ojú-ọ̀nà la máa bójútó jù lọ́dún yìí.
en: We will take care of education and road work this year.

yo: Kàkà ká pín owó tí a kọ́kọ́ rí lórí orin wa, irinṣẹ́ orin àti ọkọ̀ la fi rà.
en: Instead of sharing the money we first got from our music, we used it to buy musical instruments and vehicles.

yo: Èmi kìí bá wọn bú olórin ẹ̀mí ní tèmi, Ọlọ́run kò f'ìdájọ́ sí wa lọ́wọ́.
en: I don't curse my soul singer with them, God doesn't give judgment to us.

yo: Aṣíwájú fẹ́ ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn gómìnà ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá.
en: Ashyuw wants to meet with the governors of Yoruba land.

yo: Ohun kékeré kọ́ l'oúnjẹ tó dára ń ṣe lágọ ara
en: Little things in good food make the body happy

yo: Fúnmiláyọ̀ Adékúnlé sọ pé iṣẹ t'áwọn yàn láàyò nìyẹn.
en: Mrs. Adékunle said that this is the work they prefer.

yo: Sanwó-Olú dá àjọ tó ń mójútó ìwà ìbàjẹ́ pada sí Èkó.
en: Sanwó-Olu brought back the anti-corruption organization to Lagos.

yo: Àtẹ̀jáde náà tún fi yé wa pé ó fẹ́ pààrọ aṣọ wọn.
en: The publication also tells us that he wants to change their clothes.

yo: Lẹ́yìn oṣù mẹ́fà tí Àjàdí jáde láyé, Òrìṣábùnmi náà ti kú o!
en: Six months after Ajadi was born, the Orishabunmi is dead!

yo: Àwọn daran-daran bẹ̀bẹ̀, wọ́n láwọn kò ní ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́.
en: The herdsmen pleaded, they said they will not do that again.

yo: Ọwọ́ tẹ Òjó àti ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ̀ tí wọ́n ń fi ẹ̀kú eégún jalè ní ìlú u Òndó.
en: The hands of Ojo and his friend who are stealing the cursed corpse in the city of Ondo.

yo: Iṣẹ́ ẹ àjọ tó ń mójútó rírà àti títà ilé ní Èkó ti ń so èso rere.
en: The work of the organization that manages the buying and selling of houses in Lagos is bearing good fruit.

yo: Ọ̀rẹ́kùnrin-ìn mi ni, ṣùgbọ́n ó fipá bámilòpọ̀ ni mo ṣe gún un pa.
en: He was my boyfriend, but he forced me to kill him.

yo: Ọpẹ́ o! Dáre olórin ralé olówó ńlá ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá.
en: Thank you! Dare the singer was very rich last week.

yo: Wòlíì Olúsọjí tún ju gbankọgbì àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ ìdajì ọdún sílẹ̀.
en: The Revival Prophet also dropped the half-year prophecy.

yo: Ìdìbò o gómìnà Ẹdọ́ máa ya àwọn aráàlú lẹ́nu gan-an.
en: The election of Edo governor will surprise the people.

yo: Àwọn jàǹdùkú tún máa yawọ ilẹ̀ Yorùbá ní ẹ̀ẹ̀kan síi.
en: The mobs will once again invade Yoruba land.

yo: Ohun ńlá kan máa ṣẹlẹ̀ sí Aṣíwájú ní ọdún yìí.
en: A big thing is going to happen to Assywh this year.

yo: Àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn mí-ìn tún máa bẹ́ sílẹ̀ lágbàáyé.
en: There will also be an epidemic of influenza in the world.

yo: Àwọn abániwálé àti àwọn tó ń tún ilé ṣe gbọdọ̀ tẹ̀lé òfin.
en: Homeowners and renovators must follow the law.

yo: Tí wọn ò bá ní ìwé mẹ́wàá, wọn ò lè ṣiṣẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó.
en: If they do not have ten books, they cannot work in the state of Lagos.

yo: Olorìi Ọọ̀ni sọ pé olóògbé ti kọ́ wa ní ẹ̀kọ́ púpọ̀.
en: Olorii Oni said that the deceased has taught us many lessons.

yo: Ìkìlọ̀ ńlá lohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí ẹni tó wà látìmọ́lé jẹ́ fún gbogbo wa.
en: What happened to the prisoner is a great warning for all of us.

yo: Èmi ò ní kẹ́nikẹ́ni polongo ipò ààrẹ fún mi ò.
en: I will not have anyone announce the position of president for me.

yo: Nítorí àwọn gbọkọ-gbọkọ, onítíátà náà fọkọ rẹ̀ pamọ́.
en: Because they were the only ones, the marketer hid it.

yo: Iǹkan dé! Wọ́n yìnbọn pa Ọba Yorùbá ní Àkúrẹ́.
en: Something has arrived! The Yoruba King was shot dead in Akure.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ló fi Olúsànyà rọ́pò o Gbọ́láhàn ní oṣù tó kọjá.
en: Sanwó-Olu replaced Olusanya with Illolahan last month.

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni Aṣíwájú fún mi ní mílíọ̀nù méjì i náírà fówó ọkọ̀.
en: It's true that the foreigner gave me two million naira to buy a boat.

yo: Ààrùn-un jẹjẹrẹ ló pa àbúrò oníṣòwò náà s’Ámẹ́ríkà.
en: Cancer killed the businessman's younger brother in America.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́jà mọ́kànlélọ́gbọ̀n wọ gàù ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó.
en: Twenty-one shopkeepers were arrested in Lagos state.

yo: Pẹ̀lú u gbogbo ìwé tí mo kà, ìyá mí ní dandan ni láti tajà.
en: With him, every book I read, my mother had to sell.

yo: Ó ní ohun tó sọ òun dìyálọ́jà Ìbàdàn nìyẹn.
en: He said that's what he said he was a survivor of Ibadan.

yo: Olórin náà ṣ'àbẹ̀wò sí Olúọmọ ní ilé rẹ ẹ̀.
en: The singer visited Olúmomo at his home.

yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ ní kí wọ́n ṣàyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀ fọ́mọbìnrin onítíátà náà.
en: The court asked them to examine the blood of the actress.

yo: Ọọ̀ni ṣ'àbẹ̀wò sí ilé-iṣẹ́ ìfọpo tuntun tó wà ní Èkó.
en: Oni visited the new headquarters in Lagos.

yo: Ọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ lààrùn-un Kòrónà fa ètò ẹ̀kọ́ sẹ́yìn lọ́dún yìí.
en: Due to the Corona virus, the education system has been postponed this year.

yo: Sanwó-Olú tún fòfin de ayẹyẹ òpin ọdún àt'àwọn ilé-ìjọsìn.
en: Sanwó-Olu also banned end-of-year celebrations in churches.

yo: Gbogbo ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa ló tako ọ̀rọ̀ burúkú tí alága náà ń sọ.
en: All our members are opposed to the bad words that the chairman is saying.

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni nǹkan nira fáwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ aránṣọ.
en: It is true that things are difficult for the weavers.

yo: Gbogbo wa ni iṣẹ́ wa ò lọ déédé mọ́ nítoríi ààrùn-un Kòrónà.
en: All of us, our work is not going as usual because of the Corona virus.

yo: Pẹ̀lúu bí ìlú ṣe rí, ìjọba Sanwó-Olú ń ràn wá lọ́wọ́.
en: Despite the state of the city, the Sanwó-Olu government is helping us.

yo: Aya Sanwó-Olú àti Olúọmọ kìlọ̀ f'áwọn tó ń fìyà á jẹ obìnrin ní Èkó.
en: Aya Sanwó-Olu and Olumómo warned against those who abuse women in Lagos.

yo: Ajọ tó ń rísí ṣíṣe ògùn gbọdọ̀ ṣàlàyé ìdí tí wọ́n kò fi pè wá sípàdé.
en: The organization that sees the making of medicine must explain why they did not invite us to the meeting.

yo: Bí wọ́n bá ní ọmọlẹ́yìn-in Dàpọ̀ Abíọ́dún ni mí, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni.
en: If they have a follower of Dapo Abiodun, I am.

yo: Adarí Ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin Ògùn ní ìdàgbàsókè Ògùn ló so àwọn pọ̀.
en: The leader of the Ogun Legislative Council on the development of Ogun brought them together.

yo: Bíi Fáṣọlá, Sanwó-Olú náà fẹ́ẹ́ kó ọkọ̀ tuntun wọ̀lú kọ́dún tó parí.
en: Like Faşola, Sanwó-Olu likes to buy a new car every year.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn sunkún níbi ìsìnkú u Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Adúláwọ̀ náà.
en: People cried at the funeral of the President of the Republic.

yo: Òpin máa dé bá iṣẹ́ agbèrò ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó láìpẹ́.
en: There will be an end to prostitution in Lagos state soon.

yo: Mo ti dáríji àwọn tó kọlu ààfin mi, àwọn olóṣèlú ló jẹ̀bi.
en: I have forgiven those who attacked my palace, politicians are to blame.

yo: Gbogbo ọmọ ìjọ ló bá Oyèdépò yọ̀, bí ọmọ rẹ̀ ti relé ọkọ.
en: All members of the church rejoiced with Oyedepo, as his son got married.

yo: Àwọn ilé-ìfowópamọ́ fẹ́ pààrọ ogún àti àádọ́ta pọ́n-ùn.
en: Banks want to exchange 20 and 50 rupees.

yo: O gbọdọ̀ ṣe bí o ti mọ lásìkò táa wà yìí.
en: You must do as you know in this time.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ náà wà fún gbogbo àwọn oníṣòwò tó bá gbọ́n
en: The word is there for all wise traders

yo: Ẹ da músò! Akẹ̀sán Baálẹ̀ Ọjà l'Ọ́yọ̀ọ́ padà d'ọmọ tuntu
en: Get ready! Akesan Baale Oja l'Oyo returned to his son again

yo: Ó ní pé ẹ̀tàn ayérayé lohun tí wọ́n ń pè ní ààrùn-un Kòrónà.
en: He said that it is an eternal deception that they call Corona disease.

yo: A ò le gbàgbé e gbogbo àwọn akọni wa láéláé.
en: We can never forget all our heroes.

yo: Lẹ́yìn oṣù méjì tó pàdánù ọmọ kan, Ìyá a Ṣẹ̀san ṣì ń wá ọmọ rẹ̀.
en: After two months of losing a child, Iya a Shesan is still looking for her child.

yo: Wọ́n sọ pé ó wọ inú ilé kan n’Íkòyí, kò sì jáde mọ́.
en: They said that he entered a house in Ikoyi and never came out.

yo: Ọlọ́run nìkan ló lè tu ìyá olóògbé àti àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí rẹ̀ nínú.
en: Only God can comfort the deceased's mother and her family.

yo: Olú ìlú náà ré ègún t'áwọn baba ńlá rẹ̀ gé fún Nàìjíríà dànù.
en: The capital city broke the curse of its forefathers on Nigeria.

yo: Babátúndé àtàwọn agbẹjọ́rò méjìdínlógún ló fojú hàn ní Ilé-ẹjọ́.
en: Babatünde and 18 lawyers appeared in court.

yo: Mákindé, Fáyọ̀ṣe àti Adébóyè tako ààrẹ lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ayélujára.
en: Makinde, Fayose and Adéboye opposed the president on the internet.

yo: Aàrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà ti padà dé láti òkè-òkun.
en: The president of Nigeria has returned from overseas.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ méjì gba àṣẹ láti bá àwọn oníbàárà fowó pamọ́.
en: Two companies are authorized to save money with customers.

yo: Kò sí ibi tí wọ́n ti fààyè gba àwọn ẹ̀yà a wa bí i Èkó.
en: There is no place where they have allowed our tribes like in Lagos.

yo: Bàbálọ́jà a Ládiípọ̀ ní nítorí èyí, àwọ́n gbọdọ̀ bu ọlá fún ìlú náà.
en: Babaloja a Ladiippo said because of this, they must honor the city.

yo: Àyìndé kéde ayẹyẹ ọdún kẹwàá ní ìrántí aṣíwájú ẹ̀ tó dolóògbé.
en: Ainde announced the 10th anniversary in memory of his late predecessor.

yo: Alápatà mẹ́ta wọ gàù l’Ékòó, nítorí odò-ẹran tí ìjọba kò fọwọ́ sí.
en: Three people went on a rampage in Ékoo, because of a meat river that was not approved by the government.

yo: Ìjọba gbọdọ̀ tọ́jú àwọn arúgbó tó ń tọrọ bárà lójúu títì.
en: The government must take care of the elderly who are begging.

yo: Wọ́n ní láti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ yìí kí wọ́n tóó kó wọn kúrò.
en: They have to take this step before they are removed.

yo: Ó kìlọ̀ kí àwọn èèyàn yéé gbé àgbàsọ kiri pé Olorì Ọọ̀ni ti bímọ.
en: He warned people not to spread the word that Olori Oni has given birth.

yo: Mo rọ àwọn oníṣòwò kí wọ́n má fowó kún owó ọjà lásìkò yìí.
en: I urge traders not to invest in stocks at this time.

yo: Gbèsè rèé! Ìjọba lu àwọn ọkọ̀ tó tàpá sófin Èkó ní gbàǹjo.
en: Your debt! The government hit the vehicles that kicked the Lagos law in the first place.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló ti yẹra fún mi torí iṣẹ́ tí mò ń kọ́, ṣùgbọ́n iṣẹ́ tó wùn mí ni.
en: A lot of people have avoided me because of the job I am learning, but it is a job I like.

yo: Ìyàwó olùdámọ̀ràn pàtàkì fún gómìnà kú lójijì.
en: The wife of the chief adviser to the governor died suddenly.

yo: Ìjọba fẹ́ẹ́ gbógun ti àwọn tó ń lo ògùn olóró láwọn ìbùdókọ̀.
en: The government wants to fight those who use drugs in the stations.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn aráàlú kìí sanwó ilẹ̀ fáwọn akọ́lẹ̀-kódọ̀tí.
en: Many citizens do not pay land to the waste management.

yo: Wọ́n gbà pé iṣẹ́ ìjọba ni, ó sì ń kóbá ọrọ̀ ajé.
en: They believe that it is the work of the government, and it is ruining the economy.

yo: Ayọ̀ abara bíntín! Ìyàwó ò mi ti bí Ìbejì làntì-lanti.
en: Happy birthday! My wife has given birth to twins.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ olóṣèlú náà kí Ọ̀gágun Akínyẹlé kú oríire.
en: The political party wished General Akinyelé a happy death.

yo: A ò ní fojúure wo ẹnikẹ́ni tó bá lòdì s'ófin Kòrónà.
en: We will not look down on anyone who opposes the Corona law.

yo: Ààrẹ fẹ́ gbé àbá ìṣúná owó ọdún yìí lọ s'ọ́dọ̀ àwọn aṣòfin.
en: The president wants to take this year's budget proposal to the legislators.

yo: Alága kánsù Àgbàdo Òkè Odò kú lójijì, lẹ́yìn ikú u akọ̀wé ẹ̀.
en: The president of Agbado Oke Odo died suddenly, after the death of his secretary.

yo: Sanwó-Olú fẹ́ fi Ẹdẹ̀ẹ́gbẹ̀ta mílíọ̀nù u náírà tọ́jú àwọn aláboyún.
en: Sanwo-Olu wants to spend 100 million naira to take care of pregnant women.

yo: Oníwàásù u Mùsùlùmí náà gbóríyìn fún Wòlíì wa.
en: The Muslim preacher praised our Prophet.

yo: A fẹ́ gbógun ti gbogbo àwọn tó ń fi igbáa bárà digunjalè.
en: We want to fight against all those who are fighting against each other.

yo: Àbọ̀dé e ìwọ́de Sọ̀rọ̀ Sókè jẹ́ kí ẹ̀rù ú ba àwọn òṣìṣẹ́.
en: The medium of Speaking Up makes employees afraid.

yo: Èyí jẹ́ nítoríi dúkìá tí wọ́n dáná sun lásìkò o rògbòdìyàn ọ̀hún.
en: This is because of the property that was burned during the conflict.

yo: Ohun t’Ámẹ́ríkà n bèèrè lọ́wọ́ àwọn olùkọ́ èdè e Yorùbá nìyí.
en: This is what America is asking from Yoruba language teachers.

yo: Ẹ fura o! Wọ́n ti ń kó omi-mímu wọlé láti òkè òkun.
en: Suspect it! They have been importing drinking water from the sea.

yo: Ìgbélé ààrùn Kòrónà ló fa iṣẹ́ afárá Agége náà sẹ́yìn.
en: The Corona virus delayed the construction of the Agége bridge.

yo: Àmàlà-á ti di igba náírà, ògúnfe náà ti di ẹgbẹ̀rún kan náírà.
en: Amal-a has become two naira, the oguffe has become a thousand naira.

yo: E wo àwòrán-an Ọọ̀ni àti Oyètọ́lá níbi ọjọ́ọ̀bí Bàbá a Omíṣore.
en: Look at the picture of Oni and Oyetola at the birth of Father Omishore.

yo: Irú àkúfà wo ni kí àbúrò kú kí ẹ̀gbọ́n náà tẹ̀lé e?
en: What kind of fate is it that the younger brother dies and the older brother follows him?

yo: Àbúrò Òrìṣábùnmi náà tún kú lójijì lẹ́yìn ìgbà díẹ̀.
en: Orishabunmi's younger brother also died suddenly after some time.

yo: Àwọn abánikọ́lé gbọdọ̀ máa lo ohun ìgbàlódé fún ilé kíkọ́.
en: Builders must use modern materials for building.

yo: Nítoríi ààrùn-un Kòrónà, Adébóyè àti Olúkọ̀yà fagilé ìsìn-in àìsùn ọdún.
en: Due to the Corona virus, Adéboye and Olukoyya canceled the annual sleepless night service.

yo: Àwọn ọba Èkó sọ pé Aṣíwájú nipò o ààrẹ ọdún tó ń bọ̀ tọ́ sí.
en: The kings of Eko say that Asuyw is the rightful president next year.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ṣèfilọ́lẹ̀ ounjẹ àti oògùn ọ̀fẹ́ fáwọn aláboyún.
en: Sanwó-Olu provides free food and medicine to pregnant women.

yo: Ó ṣẹlẹ̀! Ọwọ́ tẹ ọmọ ogún ọdún tó ń gbé oògùn olóró.
en: It happened! He arrested a 20-year-old drug dealer.

yo: Gbogbo wa la níṣẹ́ láti ṣe lóríi ètò ààbò, pàápàá láti ilé kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: We all have work to do on the security system, especially from each home.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ okọ̀ ojú-omi ti ìlú Èkó gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ Ilé-iṣẹ́ tó dángájíá.
en: The Lagos-based shipbuilding industry won the Best Industry Award.

yo: Mi ò ju ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàlá lọ tí mo fi bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ẹ apèròsọ́kọ̀.
en: I was not more than thirteen years old when I started working as a speaker.

yo: Ṣé ẹ ti gbọ́ ohun tí ìyàwó olórin náà sọ kí ọkùnrin ọ̀ún tóó kú?
en: Have you heard what the singer's wife said before the man died?

yo: Lóòótọ́ làwa onídìrí fẹ́ràn oge, ṣùgbọ́n a kìí ṣe oníṣekúṣe.
en: It is true that we who are observant like to eat, but we are not immoral.

yo: Yétúndé Ọládipúpọ̀, tó jẹ́ ààrẹ ẹgbẹ náà, ló sọ èyí di mímọ̀.
en: Yetunde Oladipupo, who is the president of the group, made this known.

yo: Ilé-ìwé e wa tó digi àràbà lónìí, ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogún-un náírà la fi bẹ̀rẹ̀.
en: We have a school that looks like a mosque today, we started with a thousand and twenty naira.

yo: Ha ò ní dójúti àwọn ará Ayọ̀bọ́ Ìpájà láéláé.
en: Will he never embarrass the people of Ayobo Ipaja.

yo: Àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí kò f'ọwọ́ s'óhun tí wọ́n ń sọ nípa ikú onítíátà náà.
en: The family members did not care what they said about the death of the actor.

yo: Oúnjẹ yóò túbọ̀ pọ̀ nílùú bí a bá lè tọ́jú u èrè oko wa dáadáa.
en: There will be more food in the city if we can take good care of our farm produce.

yo: Láàárín ọdún méjì, gómìnà sọ àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn Ìlọrin d'ìgbàlódé.
en: Within two years, the governor modernized Ilorin hospitals.

yo: Ó dá àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lókoòwò, bẹ́ẹ̀ ló tún tọ́jú àwọn arúgbó.
en: He cares for the young and cares for the old.

yo: Àfikún owó iná dá nǹkan rú mọ́ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ apínnáká lọ́wọ́.
en: The increase in fuel costs is confusing for the distribution companies.

yo: Ìjọba ló ní ká fowó kún owó iná, kìí ṣe ẹ̀bi wa.
en: The government asked us to pay for electricity, not our family.

yo: Igbákejì ààrẹ ló ní pé ilé ìfowópamọ́ àgbáyé ló fẹ́ fún wa lówó.
en: The vice president said that the World Bank wants to give us money.

yo: Àwa aráàlú ń kígbe pé kò síná, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni wọ́n ti fẹ́ẹ́ fi owó iná pa wá.
en: We citizens are shouting that there is no fire, so they have tried to kill us with fire money.

yo: Àṣírí tó gbọdọ̀ hàn fáráyé ni fíìmù tí mo ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbé jáde.
en: The secret that must be revealed is the film that I have just released.

yo: Ó fagilé orúkọ Nàìjíríà nínú àwọn tó máa ta tẹ́tẹ́ oríire ìlú náà.
en: He canceled the name of Nigeria among those who will bet on the fortune of the city.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀ lọ́nà ogún-un náírà la máa ta ìrẹsì lọ́dún yìí.
en: The group will sell rice for twenty naira this year.

yo: Babálọ́jà a gbogbo wá ti dágbére f'áyé, nǹkán ṣe!
en: Babaloja we have all said goodbye to the world, let's do it!

yo: Mo fẹ́ẹ́ ṣẹ́yún ọmọ tí mo bí yìí, ṣùgbọ́n ọkọ ọ̀ mi kò gbà.
en: I wanted to abort my child, but my husband did not agree.

yo: Irọ́ ò dáa! Ilé ọkọ ọ́ dùn, mo máa padà láìpẹ́.
en: Lying is not good! Your husband's house is happy, I will return soon.

yo: Ìrànwọ́ oúnjẹ ń bọ̀ fáwọn olùgbé Èkó lọ́sẹ̀ yìí.
en: Food aid is coming to the people of Lagos this week.

yo: A ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ni, kò sóorun lójúu wa títí ìgbéga yóò fi bá Èkó.
en: We have just started, there is no rest in our eyes until the promotion comes to Lagos.

yo: Ayẹyẹ ìwúyè Ọwá lóko tuntun bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní Ìlokò Ìjẹ̀ṣà.
en: The celebration of Owa Loko's new beginning in Iloko Ijesha.

yo: Wọ́n dájọ́ ikú fún Délé Òjó tó jíṣu lóko Àjàyí.
en: They sentenced to death for Delé Ojo who died in Ajayi.

yo: Aláàfin ti kọ́lé olówó ńlá fáwọn olórí méjì.
en: Alaafin has built a big palace for two leaders.

yo: Mo máa gbógun ti ẹnikẹ́ni tó bá tún da Àpápá rú.
en: I will fight anyone who disturbs Apapa again.

yo: Ìkà àti aláìmoore làwọn jàǹdùkú tó pààyàn sóko Ọlátúndé.
en: The mob that killed Olátünde was cruel and ungrateful.

yo: Gbajúmọ̀ ọ pèdè-pèdè lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ọ̀ún kú lójijì ní oṣù tó kọjá.
en: The Nigerian celebrity died suddenly last month.

yo: Owó èlé ti sọ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọlọ́jà a wa di ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ ríru.
en: Interest has made many of our customers sick.

yo: Àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí bú sẹ́kún níbi ìsìnkú u gómìnà Èkó tẹ́lẹ̀rí ọ̀hún.
en: The family members wept at the funeral of the former governor of Lagos.

yo: Bàtà tí Màámi bọ́ sílẹ̀ tóbi fẹ́nikẹ́ni láti ti ẹsẹ̀ bọ̀.
en: The shoe that Mami dropped was too big to slip on.

yo: Ẹ gbàdúrà kí wọ́n má ba à jí àwọn adaríi wa gbé.
en: Pray that they will not steal our leaders.

yo: Ọ̀tẹ́dọlá yẹ àga mọ́ Ọba Òtúdẹ̀kọ́ nídìí ní Ilé Ìfowópamọ́ ọ àkọ́kọ́.
en: Eighteen deserves a seat in King Otudeko's first bank.

yo: Túndé Kèlání, àtàwọn mẹ́jọ míràn gbaṣẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ọ Sanwó-Olú.
en: Tunde Kelani, and eight others were employed by Sanwó-Olu.

yo: Orí ì mí kọ́kọ́ dàrú nígbà tí owó Ìyá Ìjọ Àjàyí kọ́kọ́ wọlé fún mi.
en: My head was confused when the money of Mother Church Ajayi first came to me.

yo: Mo fi títóbi Ọlọ́run búra, ó kọ́kọ́ dà bíi pé gìrì mú mi ni.
en: I swear by the greatness of God, at first I felt like I was stuck.

yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà padà sílé, lẹ́yìn tó ṣàbẹ̀wò sí Aṣíwájú.
en: The president of the country of Nigeria returned home, after visiting Assywur.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ṣàbẹ̀wò ìbánikẹ́dùn sílé Olóògbé Ìbídùńní.
en: Sanwó-Olu paid a condolence visit to the late Ibidunni's home.

yo: Èyí ni ohun tí Ìbídùńní sọ kó tóó kú ní ọjọ́ kẹrìnlá oṣù yìí.
en: This is what Ibidunni said before he died on the 14th of this month.

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá tó ń gun ọ̀kadà gan-an nìdalààmú àwa ọlọ́kadà.
en: The policemen who ride the olkada are really a problem for us olkada.

yo: Wọ́n ti mú Àlàó àtàwọn mẹ́wàá tó ń lu òyìnbó ní jìbìtì owó àti ara.
en: Álao and 10 others who were involved in fraud have been arrested.

yo: Gbogbo wọ́n ti há sọ́wọ́ àwọn ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ l’Ámẹ́ríkà.
en: All of them have joined the American spies.

yo: Ẹ wo bí ètò ìsọmọlọ́rúkọ ọmọ Ọọ̀ni ṣẹ wáyé.
en: See how the plan to name Oni's son came about.

yo: Bí a ṣe gbọ́, ọjọ́ mọ́kànlélógún ni wọ́n á fi ṣètùtù.
en: According to what we heard, they will be reconciled in 21 days.

yo: Ẹ yéé sọ ìsọkúsọ, owó kọ́ ni ọ̀rẹ́ mi bá lọ sí ọ̀dọ Olúọmọ, ìfẹ́ ni.
en: You understand, it is not money that my friend goes to Olumomo, it is love.

yo: Mọ̀lẹ́bí òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba t'áwọn ọlọ́jà lù pa gba mílíọ̀nù márùn-ún náírà.
en: The family of a government official who was beaten to death by thugs received five million naira.

yo: Nítorí irọ́ tí wọ́n pa mọ́ ọn, Ọ̀ṣínbàjò fẹ́ẹ́ wọ́ Ṣòwòrẹ́ lọ sílé-ẹjọ́.
en: Oshinbajo wanted to take Shorore to court because of the lie they kept on him.

yo: Ẹ wo owó tabua t'áwọn gómìnà-àtijọ́ ṣì ń gbà lọ́dọọdún.
en: Look at the tabua money that the former governors still receive every year.

yo: Ọkọ̀ olówó iyebíye, àt'àwọn nǹkan táwọn jàǹdùkú dáná sun rèé.
en: The expensive car, and the things that the mob burned.

yo: Ọmọ Èkó ni mí, mi ò ní gbà k'ẹ́nìkan wá fìdọ̀tí ba ìlú mi jẹ́.
en: I am from Eko, I will not allow anyone to come and destroy my city.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn ńlá ṣèdárò gómìnà Èkó tẹ́lẹ̀rí tó jáde láyé.
en: Great people mourned the former governor of Lagos.

yo: Ó fi ayé sílẹ̀ ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó lọ lẹ́ni ọdún mọ́kànléláàádọ́rùn-ún.
en: He left the world last week at the age of ninety one.

yo: Arógundádé wípé Ìgbòho gbọdọ̀ ṣọ́ra fún àwọn èèyàn kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: Arogundadé said that Igbho must be careful for each person.

yo: Nítorí àtúnṣe irinṣẹ́ ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́, ilé-iṣẹ́ náà fẹ́ẹ́ dáwọ́ iṣẹ́ dúró.
en: Due to repair of radio equipment, the company is about to stop working.

yo: Fún ọjọ́ọ̀bí Sanwó-Olú, kò síná dídá, kò sí ariwo, kò sí àríyá.
en: For Sanwó-Olu's birthday, there was no fire, no noise, no party.

yo: Gómìnà yọ̀nda ọgọ́ta mílíọ̀nù u náírà f'áwọn ọlọ́pàá tí wọ́n pa
en: Governor donates 60 million naira to slain policemen

yo: Abísóyè sọ pé àjọ náà ṣetán láti ran àwọn aráàlú lọ́wọ́.
en: Abisoye said that the organization is ready to help the public.

yo: Obìnrin tó bá yan iṣẹ́ alápatà láàyò, àṣírí ẹ̀ kò lè tú láíláí.
en: A woman who chooses to work as a prostitute, her secret can never be revealed.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́yẹmí rọ́pò o Túnjí nípò adarí ẹ̀ka kan-an ní ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá Èkó.
en: Tunji was replaced by Meshadwemi as head of a department at the Lagos police station.

yo: Bá ò bá ṣọ́ra, àwọn jàǹdùkú á bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí jí àwọn ọba wa gbé.
en: If you are not careful, the mobs will start stealing our kings.

yo: Ẹ wo àwòrán ibi tí Bàbá a Abíọ́dún ti g'ẹṣin relé pẹ̀lú ẹ̀yẹ ìkẹyìn.
en: Take a look at the picture of where Father Abiodun rode the relay with the last win.

yo: A ti pàṣẹ fún àwọn Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ káàkiri ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá.
en: We have ordered the Recruiters to start work all over the Yoruba land.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn tẹ́yà ara pè níjà ró ọgọ́rùn-ún èèyàn lágbára.
en: A group of people called to challenge and strengthen a hundred people.

yo: Ọkọ̀ akólẹ̀ tí Sanwó-Olú ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ rà máa pèsè iṣẹ́ fáwọn olùgbé Èkó.
en: The truck that Sanwó-Olu just bought will provide jobs to the people of Lagos.

yo: Ẹ jẹ́ ká kan sáárá sí Adégúnwà tó jẹ́ ọmọ Yorùbá àtàtà.
en: Let's have a look at Adégunwa who is a good Yoruba child.

yo: Ó figagbága pẹ̀lú àwọn òyìnbó nínu iṣẹ́ ẹ ọtí ẹlẹ́rìndòdò.
en: He competes with the best in the craft of beer.

yo: Gómìnà ti f'orúkọ olórí-ìgbìmọ̀ méjì ránṣẹ́ sí ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin.
en: The governor has sent the names of two committee leaders to the legislature.

yo: Ẹ wo ayẹyẹ ọgọ́ta ọdún òmìnira Nàìjíríà.
en: Look at the 60th anniversary of Nigeria's independence.

yo: Iǹkán dé! Tọkọ-taya lu ọmọ wọn pa ní ìlú Àkúrẹ́.
en: Hurry up! Tok-tyra beat their child to death in the city of Akure.

yo: Hẹ̀ẹ̀mèjì ni mo sọ fún Aṣíwájú kó fọkànbalẹ̀, kò séwu.
en: Twice I told Ashuyw to calm down, it's safe.

yo: Olùdámọ̀ràn pàtàkì fún gómìnà ni yóò gbà wọ́n lálejò.
en: The special adviser to the governor will host them.

yo: Ó fẹ́ẹ̀ gbàlejò àwọn abániralé àti abániralẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó.
en: He wants to host the poor and the poor in the state of Lagos.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ṣẹ̀filọ́lẹ̀ afárá tuntun tí ó wà ní Agége.
en: Sanwó-Olu inaugurated the new bridge in Agége.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Anímáṣáun kìlọ̀ f'áwọn ayálégbé tí kò sanwó.
en: The children of Animashaun warned tenants who did not pay.

yo: Ìjọba ṣètò ìrànwọ́ f'áwọn àgbẹ̀ ọlọ́sìn nílùú Èkó.
en: The government has organized aid for livestock farmers in Lagos.

yo: Wọ́n ṣe ìkìlọ̀ pé kí a fura nítorí àwọn ológun tó fẹ́ bẹ́ sí ìgboro.
en: They warned that we should be suspicious because of the soldiers who want to go to the streets.

yo: Olúbàdàn dìde fún Ìgbòho, ó ti rán aṣojú lọ sílẹ̀ náà
en: Olubadan stood up for Igbho, he had sent a representative

yo: Alàgbà Adébóyè ra okọ̀ òfurufú agbéra-pá tuntun.
en: Elder Adéboye bought a new hovercraft.

yo: Sanwó-Olú sọ Ìyá Àwẹ̀ró onítíátà di onílé-ńlá n’Íkòròdú.
en: Sanwó-Olu made Mother Awëró the theater owner of a big house in Ikorodu.

yo: Ẹ̀sùn àgbèrè gbé ọ̀gá ilé-ìfowópamọ́ kan ṣubú lulẹ̀.
en: Allegation of adultery brought down a bank manager.

yo: Gbogbo wa la mọ obìnrin tó wà nídìí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí.
en: We all know the woman in this scene.

yo: Àwọn tó ń ṣe fàyàwọ́ obì àti orógbó ló ń kóbá wa.
en: We are being harmed by those who care for our parents and elders.

yo: Alàgbà Ọ̀ṣífẹ̀sọ̀ sọ pé owó rẹpẹtẹ ló yẹ kí ìjọba máa rí níbẹ̀.
en: Elder Osifeso said that the government should see a lot of money there.

yo: Ikú Àjìmọ́bì dá nǹkan sílẹ̀ láàrin àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí.
en: Ajimobi's death caused a stir among the family members.

yo: Àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí ní àwọn fẹ́ mọ ikú tó pa gómìnà náà.
en: It is the family members who want to know the death of the governor.

yo: Àwọn ẹ̀sùn tí ìjọba Nàìjíríà kà sí Ìgbòho lẹ́sẹ̀ rèé.
en: The allegations that the Nigerian government considers to be blatant.

yo: Ààrẹ sọ fún àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíría kí wọ́n padà s'ẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn.
en: The president told Nigerians to go back to work.

yo: Èébúdọlá bí Tọ́pẹ́ Àlàbí ṣe sọ Aláṣeyọrí di gbajúmọ̀ ńlá.
en: Eleven years ago Tope Álibi made Alaşeyor a great celebrity.

yo: Ìrànwọ́ owó dé f'áwọn oníṣòwò kéékèèké lórílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: Financial assistance to small businessmen in Nigeria.

yo: Àkànjí pe àwọn ọlọ́pàá lólè, ló bá dèrò ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: Akanji called the police a thief, and he faced jail time.

yo: Àwọn oníjìbìtì ló ń k'ówó fún àwọn onítíátà tí wọ́n ń ṣe bíi olówó.
en: Scammers are the ones who pay for the actors who pretend to be rich.

yo: Ìfètò-sọ́mọ-bíbí ló lè tètè mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ìdílé àti orílẹ̀-èdè e wa.
en: Family planning can quickly bring development to our family and our country.

yo: Kí ni ìdí tí gómìnà kò fi ṣètò ìbò ìjọba agbègbè?
en: What is the reason why the governor did not organize the local government election?

yo: Gómìnà fi múlẹ̀ pé a gbọdọ̀ ró àwọn obìnrin wa lágbára.
en: The governor confirmed that we must empower our women.

yo: Iǹkan ìtìjú gbáà ni bí wọ́n ṣe já ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n ní Ọ̀yọ́.
en: It is a shameful thing how they broke the prison in Oyo.

yo: Ọpẹ́ o! Àwọn olùkọ́ Yunifásítì ti padà s'ẹ́nu iṣẹ́.
en: Thank you! University teachers have returned to work.

yo: Ẹ wo ọ̀gá tuntun àjọ tó ń mójútó lílọ bíbọ̀ ọkọ̀ ní Èkó.
en: Look at the new boss of the organization that is in charge of the boat launch in Lagos.

yo: Ọwọ́ tẹ awakọ̀ tó já èrò fún àwọn agbénipa.
en: Hand shake the driver who broke the crowd for the bandits.

yo: Akérédolú ṣèfilọ́lẹ̀ ilé-iṣé ẹlẹ́dẹ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Òǹdó.
en: Akeredolu launched a pig factory in Ondo state.

yo: Inúu àgbo àti ata gúngún ni wọ́n tọ́jú egbòogi olóró sí báyìí.
en: Poisonous medicine is still stored in ram and pepper.

yo: Àwọn afọbajẹ fẹ́ yọ ọ́ nípò, ṣùgbọ́n kábíyèsí ní wọ́n ń ṣeré ni.
en: The corrupt want to remove you from your place, but hey, they are playing.

yo: Ìjà àwọn olórí méjèèjì túbọ̀ ń fẹjú sí i ni ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú onígbàálẹ̀.
en: The fight between the two leaders is getting more and more intense in the political party.

yo: Àlàbí, Ẹniolá àti Ṣèyí pẹ̀lú àwọn tó fi owó ta ọmọ Adélékè lọ́rẹ.
en: Álibi, Aniola and Sheyi with those who sold Adeleke's son as a friend.

yo: Kẹ́hìndé ṣá ọ̀rẹ́ rẹ ẹ̀ ládàá pa, ó tún gé orí àti ọwọ́ ẹ̀ sọ́tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
en: Then your friend killed you, and cut off your head and hands.

yo: Ó sọ pé, ayédèrú ló pọ̀ jù nínú àwọn wòlíì tó ń gbàdúrà fún òun.
en: He said that most of the prophets who pray for him are fake.

yo: Ìyá Ìjọ Àjàyí sọ ìdí tí Adébóyè ṣe wọ bàtà wọnú ilé-ìjọsìn-in Kérúbù.
en: The mother of the Ajjayi church said why Adéboye wore shoes into the Kerubu church.

yo: Tóyìn Afọlábí dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ọ Sanwó-Olú nítorí ọjà tí ìjọba ṣí pátápátá.
en: Then Adolabi thanked Sanwó-Olu for the government's completely open market.

yo: Yàtọ̀ s’Ámẹ́ríkà àti Ilẹ̀-Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, àwọn ìlú tí èèyàn tún lè lọ ṣoríire rèé.
en: Apart from America and England, there are also cities where people can be lucky.

yo: A fẹ́ kọ́ gbogbo yín ní àwọn ọ̀nà tẹ ẹ̀ lè fi pa owó láì làágùn jìnnà.
en: We want to teach you all ways to save money without breaking a sweat.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn sunkún níbi ìsìnkú alága kánsù u Etí-Ọ̀sà.
en: People wept at the funeral of the president of Eti-Osa.

yo: Yínká Bádéjọ, ìyàwó olórí-ìjọ tó d'olóògbé, náà ti jáde láyé.
en: Yínká Bádéjó, the wife of the deceased church leader, has also passed away.

yo: Gbogbo ètùtù tífá ní ká ṣe lórí ààfin Ọba Akiolú la ti ṣe.
en: We have done all the atonement we had to do on King Akiolú's palace.

yo: Ọọ̀ni dá ọgọ́rùn-ún èèyàn lókoòwò iṣẹ́ ẹ àdìrẹ.
en: Oni created hundreds of people for his work.

yo: Àwọn àwòrán ojú ọ̀nà Ọ̀tà àtijọ́ tí ìjọba Èkó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ parí rèé o.
en: The pictures of the old Ota road that the government of Lagos has just finished.

yo: Àwọn olórin bíi mẹ́ta máa kọrin níbi ìkórè ìjọ Wòlíì Fábíyìí.
en: Three musicians will sing at the harvest of Prophet Fabiyi's congregation.

yo: Fúnkẹ́ pa ẹdẹ̀ẹ́gbẹ̀ta mílíọ̀nù u náírà lórí eré tuntun tó gbé jáde.
en: He spent five hundred million naira on his new game.

yo: Moráyọ̀ Afọlábí ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí alárinrin ní àná tí mo kúrò ní Nàìjíríà.
en: Morayo Adhalabi had a wonderful birthday yesterday when I left Nigeria.

yo: Adébóyè fẹ́ darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn tó ń gbógun ti ọlọ́pàá lóríi ìwà a àìtọ́.
en: Adéboye wants to join those who are fighting against the police for their wrongdoing.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin t'ilẹ̀kùn mọ́ àwọn tí gómìnà yàn
en: Parliamentarians close doors to governor's appointees

yo: Sanwó-Olú fẹ́ gbàlejò Ìyàwó Ààrẹ àti Gbóyèga Oyètọ́lá.
en: Sanwó-Olu wants to host the First Lady and Ggoyega Oyetola.

yo: Jọkẹ́ ṣàlàyé àìsàn tó ń bá ọkọ rẹ̀ Olú jà.
en: Joke explained the illness she was fighting with her husband Olu.

yo: Wọ́n ti sìnkú alàgbà àtìyàwó ẹ̀ tó kú sínú ilé nílùú Iléṣà.
en: They have buried the elder and his dead wife in the house in Ilesha.

yo: Wọ́n ti yọ òkú ọmọ-iṣẹ́ náà kúrò nínú ilé tó wó lulẹ̀ n’Íkòyí.
en: The worker's body has been removed from the collapsed house in Ikoyi.

yo: Alága kánsù Àgbàdo Òkè-Odò ṣ'àbẹ̀wò s'áwọn iṣẹ́ ẹ àkànṣe.
en: The chairman of Agbado Oke-Odo visited the special projects.

yo: Kíni ìdí tí ìgbìmọ̀ ọjà ṣe ní igbákejì márùn-ún?
en: Why did the market committee have five vices?

yo: Oyè e Máyégún tí mo jẹ ni wọ́n ṣe ń parọ́ mọ́ mi.
en: They lied to me because I was 100 years old.

yo: Múrí Okùnọlá gba àwọn òṣìṣẹ́-ìjọba níyànjú fọ́dún tuntun.
en: Muri Okunola encouraged government officials in the new year.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ọmọ márùn-ún, Fúnmi tún bímọ márùn-ún lẹ́ẹ̀kan ṣoṣo.
en: After five children, Mrs gave birth to five children at once.

yo: Kò síjà láàárín wa, àwọn alábòsí ló fẹ́ da ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa rú.
en: There is no fighting between us, it is the loyalists who want to disrupt our group.

yo: Àwọn ni Àjọ tó ń mójútó ọ̀rọ ìforúkọsílẹ̀ àwọn olùgbé Èkó.
en: They are the organization that is responsible for the registration of the residents of Lagos.

yo: Ìgbà wo ni wọ́n fẹ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìforúkọsílẹ̀ lọ́tun?
en: When do they want to start registration again?

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ló máa pàdánù iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn ní ọdún yìí.
en: Many workers will lose their jobs this year.

yo: Ọkọ̀ òfurufú ayára-bí-àṣá tó jábọ́ nílùú Èkó gba ẹ̀mí èèyàn méjì.
en: A high-speed plane that crashed in Lagos claimed two lives.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ Èkó ni wọ́n ń lò fún iṣẹ́ aṣẹ́wó jù nílẹ̀ ẹ òkèèrè.
en: It is the people of Lagos who are used for prostitution in foreign countries.

yo: Ànfààní pọ̀ nínú ìbánidọ́rẹ̀ẹ́ lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.
en: There are many benefits to online dating.

yo: Mo gbọ́ pé àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti fi Bàbá Ìjẹ̀ṣà sílẹ̀.
en: I heard that the police have released Baba Ijessa.

yo: Ọọ̀ni ń bọ̀ níbi ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìwé e Yorùbá tí wọ́n kọ nípa Awólọ́wọ́.
en: Today is coming at the launch of a Yoruba book written by Awololwo.

yo: Ilé-ìwé àwọn oníṣègùn ìbílẹ̀ máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ láìpẹ́
en: School of traditional healers will start soon

yo: Ẹ dá ọ̀pá àṣẹ Ọba Èkó padà kíá, kí ẹ má baà kábàámọ̀.
en: Return the scepter of the King of Eko immediately, so that you will not regret it.

yo: Ọkọ̀ tí wọ́n ní kí Kúnlé fọ̀ ló jí gbé, lọwọ́ bá tẹ̀ ẹ́.
en: He stole the boat that Kunle was asked to wash, and he stepped on it.

yo: Gààrí ti kúrò lolọ́únjẹ mẹ̀kúnnù, àfi kí Ọlọ́run ṣàánú u wa.
en: Gaari has left without a word, unless God has mercy on him.

yo: Bí wọ́n ṣe fìròyìn ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ kóbá ọrọ̀-ajé ilẹ̀ ẹ Yòrùbá rèé o!
en: How they report the bloodshed that destroyed the economy of the Yoruba country!

yo: Olóṣèlú náà kò lè wọlé ìbò lágboolé rẹ̀ ní Òró, ariwo lásán ló ní.
en: The politician could not enter the polls at his house in Oró, he had only noise.

yo: Bàbá ọgọ́ta ọdún bá ọmọ-ọdún mẹ́sàn-án ní àjọṣepọ̀.
en: A 60-year-old father has a relationship with a nine-year-old son.

yo: Ẹ̀wọ̀n ni Àlùfáà Àlàmú ti máa ṣọdún nítoríi gbájú-ẹ̀ tó ṣe.
en: Alufaa Alamu has been imprisoned because of what he did.

yo: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin èèyàn la gbà ṣíṣẹ́ lásìkò ìgbélé e ààrùn-un Kòrónà.
en: Four thousand people were killed during the Corona virus outbreak.

yo: Àjọ náà yọ̀ǹda oúnjẹ fáwọn aláìní ní ìlúu Èkó.
en: The organization donates food to the needy in the city of Eko.

yo: Eré tí Fúnkẹ́ àti Tóyìn ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbé jáde d'íjà sílẹ̀ lágboolé e tíátà.
en: The play that Funkeh and Tóyin have just put out is in theaters.

yo: Ìdí tí Diméjì Bánkọ́lé fi darapọ̀ mọ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú onígbàálẹ̀ ni Ògún.
en: The reason why Diméji Bankole joined the political party is Oggun.

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó rírà àti títà ilé ní Èkó pe ìpàdé àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀.
en: The organization that manages the buying and selling of houses in Lagos called a meeting of the wealthy.

yo: Wọ́n pe ìpàdé náà lóríi àtúntò o òfin ilẹ̀ rírà ní Èkó.
en: They called the meeting on the restructuring of the land acquisition law in Lagos.

yo: Ṣẹ̀yí, ọmọ Aṣíwájú, àtìyàwó ẹ̀ tún ń palẹ̀ ayẹyẹ mọ́.
en: Now, son of Assyw, your wife is celebrating again.

yo: A máa fọwọ́ líle mú ètò ààbò láwọn ibi iṣẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ yìí
en: We will strengthen the safety system in the workplaces in this state

yo: Gbogbo ohun tí Ọlọ́run fún mi ni máa fi gbé àṣà a Yorùbá lárugẹ.
en: Everything that God has given me will be used to promote Yoruba culture.

yo: Ilé-Iṣẹ́ tó ń rísí Ilẹ̀ Kíkó ní Èkó ṣètò ìdáàbòbò fáwọn agbálẹ̀.
en: The Land Management Office in Lagos organizes protection for the locals.

yo: Àwòrán ìgbéyàwó ọmọ olórí ìjọ àwọn Olùborí nìyí.
en: This is the picture of the wedding of the leader of the church of the winners.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn bíi ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta ni wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ láti fa ìjọba ààrẹ ṣubú.
en: About 500 news agencies were created to bring down the president's government.

yo: A fẹ́ kí ìjọba Èkó pèsè ọjà ta ó ti máa ta nǹkan oko lẹ́ẹ̀kan lọ́sẹ̀.
en: We want the government of Eko to provide a market to sell farm produce once a week.

yo: Gbọ́láhàn ti ṣe àṣeyọrí nípa àwọn ògùn tó lè dẹ́kun àìsàn kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: Gollolahan has made success with medicines that can stop each disease.

yo: Mo fẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé ànjọ̀nú kọ́ ló ń fa ìjàmbá lóríi afárá a Ọ̀tẹ́dọlá.
en: I want us to know that the accident on the Otedola bridge is not caused by ignorance.

yo: Àwọn ará àríwá ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìpolongo f’Áṣíwájú ní Àbújá fún ipò o ààrẹ.
en: The people of the north have started campaigning in Abuja for the position of president.

yo: Yínká Aláṣeyọrí lóun kò sí nínú ilé tó wó lulẹ̀ n’Íkòyí.
en: Yingka Alaseyorri is not in the house that collapsed in Ikoyi.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ tó ń gba owó f'áwọn tó ń ṣèwọ́de láwọn kò gbowó mọ́.
en: The group that collects money gives those who enter those who do not have money anymore.

yo: Bílíọ̀nù mẹ́jọ náírà la ti yọ̀ǹda fáwọn olókoowò ẹgbẹ̀rún méjìlá.
en: We have released eight billion naira to twelve thousand entrepreneurs.

yo: Ẹ wo òkú àwọn àgbẹ̀ t'áwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ́ pa ní Àríwá a Nàìjíríà.
en: Look at the dead bodies of farmers killed by rebels in Northern Nigeria.

yo: Adédiméjì onítíátà máa kéde ọjọ́ ìgbéyàwó o rẹ̀ láìpẹ́
en: The actress will announce her wedding date soon

yo: Àlàmú ọmọ ìyá ẹlẹ́pà tó sọ mọ̀lẹ́bí d'olóríire ti padà sí íléwèé.
en: The trouble of the beautiful mother who told the family d'oliriire has returned to the house.

yo: Sanwó-Olú fẹ́ẹ́ gbàlejò àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ nídìí iṣẹ́ẹ abániralé lọ́la.
en: Sanwo-Olu wants to host the wealthy in the opening ceremony tomorrow.

yo: Arábìnrin tó gba góòlù fún Nàìjíríà gba ẹ̀bùn-un ilé.
en: The sister who won the gold for Nigeria took home the prize.

yo: Gómìnà ra ọkọ̀ ojú-omi ìgbàlódé tuntun f'áwọn olùgbé e Èkó.
en: The governor bought a new modern boat for the people of Lagos.

yo: Ọba náà ti yanjú u aáwọ̀ tó wà láàarin àwọn ẹ̀yà a ọ̀ún l’Ágége.
en: The king has resolved the conflict between the tribes of Agége.

yo: Nítorí Aṣíwájú, Fáyẹmí àti Akérédolú balẹ̀ sílùú Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
en: Because of Assyw, Fayemi and Akeredolu landed in the city of Gehes.

yo: Ìgbésẹ̀ náà di dandan f'áwọn tó ń ta òkúta-ìkọ́lé.
en: The move became mandatory for those selling building stones.

yo: Wọ́n gbọdọ̀ tẹ orúkọ ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn sára òkúta tí wọ́n bá ṣe.
en: They must print the name of their company on the stone if they do.

yo: Fúnkẹ́ Akíndélé ti ra ọkọ̀ bọ̀gìnnì olówó ńlá.
en: Funke Akindele has bought a very expensive car.

yo: Ọọ̀ni sọ pé Ifẹ̀ ni iṣẹ́ ẹ àdìrẹ ti lọ sí Abẹ́òkúta.
en: Oni said that love is the work of the priest who went to Abeokuta.

yo: Ìgbéyàwó Olúsànyà tó jẹ́ ọ̀gá ilé ìfowópamọ́ dàrú pátápátá.
en: The marriage of Olusanya who is a bank manager is completely messed up.

yo: Ìlépa wa ni láti túbọ̀ jẹ́ kí ẹ máa kópa nínú ẹgbẹ́ ẹ alájẹṣẹ́kù.
en: Our goal is to get you more involved in your group.

yo: Nítorí àwọn aláyédèrú làwọn abániralé ṣe gbọdọ̀ f'orúkọ sílẹ̀.
en: It is because of the criminals that the criminals must give up their names.

yo: Owó tó lé n’Ígba mílíọ̀nù náírà lati fi ran àwọn oníṣẹ́-ọwọ́ lọ́wọ́.
en: More than a million naira money to help artisans.

yo: Àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́, ajìjàgbara, àti oníṣẹ́ ọwọ́ náà ti dá ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú sílẹ̀.
en: The students, activists, and artisans have formed a political party.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ọjọ́ kìn-ín-ní tí Aya Sanwó-Olú fún lẹ́bùn rèé.
en: The children of the first day were given by Aya Sanwó-Olu.

yo: Nítoríi Kòrónà, ìjọba Èkó ṣe ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ f'áwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ aláàbò ojú-omi.
en: Because of Corona, the government of Lagos conducted training for marine security guards.

yo: Ìbùkún Kọ́mọláfẹ́ jẹ́ ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ọ̀gá àgbà ilé e ìfowópamọ́.
en: Blessing Komolafe is one of the bosses of the bank.

yo: Ó ní pé ẹní bá fẹ́ ṣòwò lásìkò tá a wà yìí, òwo oúnjẹ ló dára jù.
en: He said that if one wants to do business in this time, food money is the best.

yo: Kò s'íṣẹ́ tí mo dáwọ́lé tó yọrí sí rere, àfi iṣẹ́ ẹ àgbẹ̀.
en: There is no work that I have undertaken that has been successful, except the work of the farmer.

yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà fi kún owó o àjẹmọ́nú àwọn olùkọ́.
en: The president of the country of Nigeria increased the salary of the teachers.

yo: Ààrẹ tún sún àsìko ìfẹ̀hìntì àwọn olùkọ́ s'íwájú.
en: The president also extended the retirement period for teachers.

yo: Iye tí mò ń ra dọ́là ti fẹ́ẹ́ sọ mí s'óko gbèsè!
en: The amount that I am buying dollars is about to put me in debt!

yo: Oyèdépò fẹ́ẹ́ kọ́ gbọ̀ngán tí kò sí irú ẹ̀ ní gbogbo àgbáyé.
en: Oyedepo is about to build a hall that has no other like it in the whole world.

yo: Èmi ò bá Ajóbíewé ṣ'orogún owó o, bàbá ni wọ́n jẹ́ fún mi.
en: I will not compete with Ajobiewe for money, they are my father.

yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà tún fi kún owó o epo.
en: The government of the country of Nigeria also added oil money.

yo: Ọjọ́ ìsinmi àwọn oníṣẹ̀ṣe ń bọ̀ láìpẹ́ ní Èkó.
en: Labor Day is coming soon in Lagos.

yo: Ìpàgọ́ àwọn tó ń ṣe omi inú ọ̀rá máa wáyé láìpẹ́.
en: The camp of those who make water in the oil will be held soon.

yo: Ọdún mẹ́jọ l’Àjìmọ̀bí fi pa ètò afẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Ọ̀yọ́.
en: It has been eight years since Ajimibi killed the tourism program in Oyo state.

yo: Ọ̀tẹ́dọlá kò sí nínú àwọn gómìnà tó ń gbowó ìfẹ̀hìntì ní Èkó.
en: Fifteen are not among the governors who fund pensions in Lagos.

yo: Ojoojúmọ́ làwọn èèyàn ń bèèrè pé kínni mo lọ ṣe lọ́dọ̀ ọ Ọọ̀ni.
en: Everyday people ask what I went to do with you Oni.

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ alájẹṣẹ́kù tí kò bá lọ́wọ́ ìjọba nínú, wọ́n máa gbá a yín ni.
en: If you are a leftist group that is not in the hands of the government, they will beat you.

yo: Ọ̀tá ìbá yọ̀mí lórí Aṣíwájú, Ọlọ́run ni kò jẹ́.
en: The enemy would rejoice over the Foreigner, not God.

yo: Aṣíwájú àt'àwọn àgbà a Yorùbá kìlọ̀ fún Ìgbòho.
en: Yoruba leaders and elders warned Igbho.

yo: Onísòlú tilẹ̀ ẹ Sòlú-Aládé, Ọba Balógun, gbọ̀pá a àṣẹ.
en: A politician, even the king, King Balogun, obeyed his orders.

yo: Wòlíì sọ àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ nípa Aṣíwájú àti Fáyẹmí.
en: The Prophet prophesied about Ashuyw and Fayemi.

yo: Sanwó-Olú máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe ìlú Èkó láìpẹ́.
en: Sanwó-Olu will soon begin the reconstruction of the city of Lagos.

yo: Àṣírí tí ẹ kò mọ̀ nípa àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ mẹ́ta tó pa awakọ̀ kan rèé.
en: The secret you don't know about three friends who killed a driver.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ọ Adénúgà àti olólùfẹ́ ẹ̀ d'iṣu ata yán-an yàn-an
en: Adenuga's words and his lover are hot and spicy

yo: Gómìnà sọ pé arákùnrin náà ṣì ni alága ẹgbẹ́ onígbàálẹ̀ ní Ìlọrin.
en: The governor said that the brother is still the chairman of the security association in Ilorin.

yo: Ẹ sọ fún gbogbo àwọn alábòsí kí wọ́n lọ sinmi àwáwí.
en: Tell all the faithful to go and rest.

yo: Kàyéfì! Baálé ilé ṣá ìyàwó ẹ̀ ládàá nítorí i oúnjẹ.
en: Wonder! The head of the house scolded his wife for eating.

yo: Àwọn aráàlú gbé Màmá ọ̀ún ṣẹ́pè nítorí ìwà burúkú tó hù.
en: The people called his mother because of her bad behavior.

yo: Wọ́n ní oúnjẹ tí ìjọba ní kó pín ló fi ṣọjọ́ọ̀bí ẹ̀.
en: They had the food that the government had to distribute to support him.

yo: Ìjìyà dé fún òbí àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òkùnkùn ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó.
en: Punishment came for the parents of members of the cult in the state of Lagos.

yo: Sanwó-Olú pàdé àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́-ogúnléndé láti ìlú mìíràn.
en: Sanwó-Olu met twenty-two students from another city.

yo: Gómìnà tẹ́lẹ̀rí náà ti há sí ọwọ́ Àjọ tó ń Mójútó Ìrúfin tó jẹ mọ́ owó.
en: The former governor has been arrested by the Financial Crimes Commission.

yo: Ìgbòho ti kó s'ọ́wọ́ àwọn ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ ní ìlú òdìkejì.
en: Igbho has been taken into the hands of the spies in the other city.

yo: Ìdìbò o kánsù Èkó máa wáyé nínú oṣù keje ọdún yìí.
en: The Lagos State election will be held in July of this year.

yo: A ti fẹnukò láti lè àwọn aláyédèrú kúrò nídìí iṣẹ́ ẹ abániralé.
en: We have decided to get rid of criminals from their illegal activities.

yo: Ká má parọ́, ẹ̀rú bà mí lọ́jọ́ tí Sanwó-Olú ní kí n wá sí ibi-iṣẹ́ ẹ òun.
en: Let's not lie, I was scared the day Sanwó-Olu asked me to come to his office.

yo: Amẹ́ríkà ń wá àwọn olùkọ́ èdè e Yorùbá gidigidi.
en: America is in desperate need of Yoruba language teachers.

yo: Wọ́n gbọ́ pé mo dá owó tí mo rí he lọ́jà padà.
en: They heard that I returned the money I found in the market.

yo: Òmùgọ̀ ni gbogbo èèyàn ń pè mí nígbà tí wọ́n gbọ́.
en: Everyone called me stupid when they heard.

yo: Ọ̀ọ̀ni Ifẹ̀ sọ pé ẹni tó tọ́ sóyè náà la fi jẹ Ìyalájé e Oòduà
en: Oni Ife said that the rightful person should be Iyalajé e Oodua

yo: Àwòrán ọkọ̀ òfurufú agbéra-pá tó jábọ́ ní Èkó nìyí.
en: This is a picture of the helicopter that crashed in Lagos.

yo: Àwọn tó ń tọrọ bárà ti ń pọ̀jù l'Ékòó, a máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kó wọn.
en: There are too many beggars in Ekoo, we will start collecting them.

yo: Olúọmọ ń palẹ̀ ayẹyẹ mọ́ nítorí ọmọ Ẹdó tó fẹ́ẹ́ ṣègbéyàwó pẹ̀lú.
en: Olumoma is celebrating because of Edo's son who wants to get married as well.

yo: Ọkùnrin gbọ́dọ̀ máa dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ìyàwó ẹ̀ lẹ́yìn-in ìbálòpọ̀.
en: A man should thank his wife after sex.

yo: Ọkùnrin tó nílé alájà mọ́kànlélógún tó pààyàn nílùú Èkó rèé.
en: A man who owns a 21-storey house who was killed in his town of Eko.

yo: Ẹ wo àwòrán-an pápá ìṣeré f'áwọn ọ̀dọ́ tí Sanwó-Olú ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ kọ́.
en: Look at the picture of the playground for the youth that Sanwó-Olu has just built.

yo: Èyí ni bí Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ṣe nu omijé ojú àgbà òṣèré e tíátà
en: This is how the Governor of Lagos State wiped the tears from the eyes of the old theater actor

yo: Bàbá náà ti wà lórí ìdùbúlẹ̀ ẹ àìsàn fún bíi ọdún mẹ́fà.
en: The father has been bedridden for six years.

yo: Àwọn àádọ́ta èèyàn mi wà lára àwọn ènìyàn tó ṣàánú fún.
en: My 50 people were among the people he had mercy on.

yo: Ó léwu láti f'ipá mú ọmọ kọ́ṣẹ́ tí kò bá wù ú.
en: It is dangerous to force an apprentice if he does not like it.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ńlá méjèèjì fẹ́ dá àwọn obìnrin lókoòwò.
en: Both big companies want to hire women.

yo: Wọ́n ti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé owó t'áwọn kan ń dá fún Bàbá Ìjẹ̀ṣà.
en: They have stepped on the money that some are giving to Father Ijessa.

yo: Òfín ti de ẹni tí kò pé ọdún méjìdínlógún láti máa lo ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀.
en: Offin has reached a person who is not 18 years old to use a communication device.

yo: Lẹ́yìn ọdún kan nípò o gómìnà, Dàpọ̀ Abíọ́dún kò tí ì kó lọ sílée ìjọba.
en: After one year as governor, Dapo Abiodun has not moved to the government office.

yo: Igbákejì ààrẹ wípé ọjọ́ ọ̀la Ìrù dára pẹ̀lú irú ọba tí wọ́n ní.
en: The vice president said that the future of Iru is good with the kind of king they have.

yo: Àwọn òṣèré kí Bùkúńmi onítíátà kú oríire nítorí àwòrán tó gbé síta.
en: Actors congratulate Bukúnmi, the actress, because of the image she released.

yo: Aláboyún tó ní ààrùn-un Kòrónà bí ìbejì sí ilé-ìwòsàn ní Èkó.
en: A pregnant woman with Corona gave birth to twins in a hospital in Lagos.

yo: Àgbà òṣèré onítíátà tí gbogbo èèyàn mọ̀ sí Bàbá a Sùwé ti kú o!
en: The old theater actor known to everyone as Baba a Suwe is dead!

yo: Kò síjà láàárín wa, àwọn alábòsí ló fẹ́ẹ́ da ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa rú.
en: There is no fighting between us, it is the loyalists who want to disturb our group.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ní kí àwọn ilé-ìjọsìn àti ilé-ìtajà oúnjẹ bẹ́rẹ̀ ẹ iṣẹ́.
en: Sanwó-Olu asked churches and food stores to start working.

yo: Ìyàndá olórin Fújì ǹ palẹ̀ ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ ọ ìbí ẹ̀ mọ́
en: The creation of the musician Fuji is celebrating your birthday

yo: Ọjà náà máa parí láìpẹ́, a ò ní fohunkóhun du ẹnìkan.
en: The product will end soon, we will not agree with anyone.

yo: Lóòótọ́ sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ ni mí, ànfààní tí mo rí ló sọ mi di oníṣòwò.
en: I am really talkative, the opportunity I saw made me a businessman.

yo: Lóòótọ́ la fẹ́ fowó kún owó o ẹ̀wà, nítoríi yín la ṣe dáwọ́ dúró.
en: We really want to invest more money, so we stopped.

yo: Ìyábọ̀ Òjó sọ ọ̀rọ̀ burúkú s'áwọn tó ń tọrọ owó lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀.
en: Iyabo Ojo says bad things to those who ask for money from him.

yo: Aṣíwájú kò ṣàárẹ̀, àlàáfíà ló wà nílùú u òyìnbó.
en: Assyw is not tired, there is peace in his city.

yo: Bàbá arúgbó j'ẹ̀bùn-un mílíọ̀nù u náírà lọ́wọ́ olórin lóríi ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.
en: An old man gave a million naira gift to a musician on the internet.

yo: Wọ́n jẹ́ abiyamọ tán ń f'ọ̀já pọn àwọn èèyàn nílẹ̀ ẹ adúláwọ̀.
en: They are motherless people in a liberal country.

yo: Ọba Akiolú ti padà sáàfin ẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí àwọn èèyàn ya wọbẹ̀.
en: King Akiolu has returned to his palace after the people broke into it.

yo: Nítorí iṣẹ́ ẹ afárá Agége, ìjọba fẹ́ẹ́ ti ọ̀nà pa fọ́sẹ̀ kan.
en: Because of the Agége bridge project, the government wants to close the road.

yo: Ṣé ẹ mọ ìdí tí mi ò ṣe bá ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ̀ mi lọ sínú u ẹgbẹ́ ẹ onígbàálẹ̀?
en: Do you know why I didn't go with my friend to your group?

yo: Kàyèéfì! Arákùnrin kan gún àlùfáà pa, torí ìyàwó ẹ̀ tó bá sùn.
en: Wonder! A brother stabbed a priest to death because his wife was sleeping.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ ọ ipò d'íjà ńlá sílẹ̀ nínú ẹgbẹ́ náà ní oṣù tó lọ.
en: The issue of position caused a big fight in the group last month.

yo: Wọ́n tún f'ẹ̀sùn ìkówójẹ kan àwọn adarí ẹgbẹ́.
en: The party leaders were also charged with corruption.

yo: Ìparí iṣẹ́ ojú ọ̀nà Agége tún dinú u oṣù kejì ọdún tuntun.
en: The completion of the Agége road also reduced the second month of the new year.

yo: Ẹ da músò! Àbẹ̀ní olórin pé ọgọ́ta ọdún láyé.
en: Get ready! The singer was sixty years old.

yo: Ọba Akiolú gbàlejò Ọba Gbọ́láhàn, Onírù tuntun nígà.
en: King Akiolû hosted King Ibolahan, the new Oniruru.

yo: Ẹ gbàdúrà kí ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà paríi ọdún mẹ́rin yìí.
en: Pray that the president of Nigeria will complete these four years.

yo: A máa ṣí ojú ọ̀na ọkọ̀-ìjọba-ńlá Oṣòdì sábúlé Ẹ̀gbá láìpẹ́.
en: We will open the Osodi highway to Egba sub-district soon.

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó ìwà ìbàjẹ́ fẹ́ gbógun ti àwọn onílé tó ń ṣe ọ̀bùn.
en: The anti-corruption organization wants to fight against the landlords who make gifts.

yo: Mákindé, gbà wá lọ́wọ́ àwọn agbèrò, wọn kò jẹ́ ka ṣiṣẹ́ n’Íbàdàn.
en: Makinde, save us from the crooks, they are not allowed to work in Ibadan.

yo: Oṣù kínní ọdún tó ń bọ̀ ni Aṣíwájú máa sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìdìbò.
en: In the first month of next year, Asuyw will talk about the election.

yo: Oore ńlá ni Ilé Ìfowópamọ́ Àkọ́kọ́ ṣe f'áwọn aráàlú lásìkò o ìgbélé.
en: The First Savings Bank did a great favor to the people during the construction period.

yo: Nítorí i èrò wìtì-wìtì la ṣe pín ọjọ́ fáwọn ọlọ́jà níbí.
en: Because of the witty idea, we divided the day for the traders here.

yo: Ojoojúmọ́ kọ́ ni wọ́n ń wá sọ́jà nítorí òfin táa ti fi kalẹ̀.
en: It is not everyday that they come to market because of the law that has been established.

yo: Wọ́n ti ń kó ẹ̀yà ara èèyàn lọ tà ní òkè òkun fún owó gọbọi.
en: They have been taking human organs to sell overseas for huge money.

yo: Aláàfin lọ síbi tí igi ti wó pààyàn ní Ọ̀yọ́.
en: Alafin went to the place where the tree fell to death in Oyo.

yo: Èmi ò bẹ̀rù ẹnìkan ò, ṣùgbọ́n kò s'ẹ́ni tí mi ò lè dọ̀bálẹ̀ fún.
en: I am not afraid of anyone, but there is no one I cannot bow down to.

yo: Irọ́ ni ọkọ ọ̀ mi ń pa mọ́ mi, òkóbó lẹni tó ń pè ní àlè mi.
en: My husband is lying to me, he is the one who calls me my wife.

yo: Jìnnì-jìnnì bá àwọn oníṣòwò nítorí àwọn ààrùn tuntun tó wà níta.
en: Businessmen are panicking because of the new diseases that are out there.

yo: Ó ti di ọ̀gá àgbà iléeṣẹ́ ẹ agbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ ti ìlú u Èkó.
en: He has become the CEO of the radio station in the city of Lagos.

yo: Akérédolú ṣèfilọ́lẹ̀ ẹ ọjà ìgbàlódé e Ọbádá lókè igbó.
en: Akeredolu launched the modern market in Obada above the forest.

yo: Ìgbòho sọ pé wọ́n ti sọ ara wọn di ẹrú àwọn ẹ̀yà kejì.
en: Igbho says that they have made themselves slaves of other tribes.

yo: Àwọn gómìnà f'òfin de àwọn daran-daran nílẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá.
en: The governors banned the herdsmen in Yoruba land.

yo: Ìlú náà ti yọ̀ǹda ajá tó ń tọpinpin oògùn olóró oní-mílíọ̀nù méjì.
en: The city has released two million drug-tracking dogs.

yo: Àádọ́ta èèyàn farapa yánna-yànna níbi ìjàmbá iná tó wáyé.
en: Fifty people were seriously injured in the fire accident.

yo: Ilé-ìjọsìn kan pẹ̀lú ọkọ̀ rẹpẹtẹ náà jóná ráúráú.
en: A church and a car were burnt down.

yo: Èèmọ̀ ọ́ wọ̀lú! Mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá èèyàn pàdánù u iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn.
en: You are welcome! Ten million people lost their jobs.

yo: Iǹkán dé! Àyìndé fàbínú yọ, orin burúkú ló kọ nípa ìjọba.
en: Hurry up! Goat is sorry, he wrote a bad song about the government.

yo: Lóòótọ́ ọ̀rọ ìbálòpọ̀ là ń sọ, ṣùgbọ́n a máa ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìdílé.
en: Of course we talk about sex, but we always talk about family.

yo: Ìdílé e wa ti dàrú fógójì ọdún, ṣùgbọ́n gbogbo wa là ń wá àtúnṣe.
en: Our family has been broken for forty years, but we are all looking for a fix.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ọ ìwé e àkọsílẹ̀ ilé-ẹjọ́ ni wọ́n ti dáná sun n’Ígbóṣeré.
en: Many court documents were burned in Igbosere.

yo: Oore ńlá làwa aláwàdà orí ayélujára ṣe f'áwọn aráàlú.
en: We, the comedians of the world, did a great favor to the people.

yo: Ìyàwó ẹ̀ ti fi ọkọ̀ bọ̀gìnnì olówó ńlá ta á lọ́rẹ fún ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ ọ ìbí ẹ̀.
en: His wife has bought him a luxury car for his birthday.

yo: Bí ètò ìsìnkú àwọn ológun tó kú sínú u ìjàmbá ọkọ̀ òfurufú ṣe lọ rèé.
en: How did the funeral of the soldiers who died in the plane crash go?

yo: Sanwó-Olú fagilé owó gọbọi tí àwọn gómìnà a àtijọ́ ń gbà.
en: Sanwó-Olu cancels the stipends received by former governors.

yo: Àsìkó ti tó k'áwọn obìnrin máa dipò o aṣáájú mú.
en: It's time for women to take the lead.

yo: Àwa là ń jà fún ẹ̀tọ́ ọ wọn.
en: We are fighting for their rights.

yo: Wọ́n ti ń fi àwọn nǹkan tó lè pa ni sí ẹran adìe lọ́jà.
en: They have been putting things that can kill chicken in the market.

yo: Mo gbọ́ pé ilé-ìtajà ìyàwó o Àjìmọ̀bí tún jóná n’Íbàdàn
en: I heard that Ajimobi's wife's shop was also burnt in Ibadan

yo: Ìyàwó òṣèré yìí náà ti bímọ lẹ́yìn ọdún méje tí wọ́n ti ń wá ọmọ.
en: The actor's wife has given birth after seven years of trying to have a child.

yo: Àwọn agbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ ní orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà ṣèdásílẹ̀ ẹgbẹ́ tuntun.
en: Broadcasters in Nigeria have formed a new group.

yo: Ẹ̀wọ́n dé f'áwọn tó ń fi ẹ̀yà ara èèyán ṣowó tàbí ṣoògùn owó.
en: Jail is given to those who sell human organs or medicine for money.

yo: Ẹ má fùn-ún ẹnikẹ́ni lówó láti gbàwé àṣẹ ìjọba.
en: Don't give money to anyone to obey the government's orders.

yo: Iǹkan tí Ìgbòho ń ṣe tẹ́ wa lọ́rùn, ṣùgbọ́n ó gbọdọ̀ kíyèsíi.
en: We are satisfied with what Igbho is doing, but it must be noticed.

yo: Ó jẹ́ ìránṣẹ́ àwọn olóṣèlú tó di gbajúmọ̀ oníṣòwò àti ajìjàgbara.
en: He was a servant of politicians who became a famous businessman and a powerful man.

yo: Ọ̀gá ilé-iṣẹ́ àwọn fàyàwọ́ tó kówó ìlú jẹ ti kú o!
en: The boss of the company that brought the city to eat is dead!

yo: Bílíọ̀nù mẹ́jọ náírà la tọ́jú nínú owó àwọn òṣìṣẹ́-fẹ̀yìntì.
en: We saved eight billion naira in pension funds.

yo: Ìdíje ‘Ìyálọ́jà' fẹ́ẹ́ wáyé láàrin àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé e Èkó.
en: The 'Rescue' competition is about to take place among the students of Eko school.

yo: Ohun tó pa èmi àti Olúwòó pọ̀ rèé, kí gbogbo ayé wá gbọ́.
en: What brought me and Oluwoo together, let the whole world hear.

yo: Kò sẹ́ni tó kójú òṣùwọ̀n láti di ààrẹ lẹ́yìn Aṣíwájú.
en: No one is up to the task of becoming president after Assywt.

yo: Aláàfin ti ránṣé pe ọ̀gá àgbà ilé iṣẹ́ ńlá náà.
en: Alafin has sent for the head of the big company.

yo: Àwòrán àwọn tórí kó yọ, tí wọ́n ń gbàtọ́jú lọ́wọ́ ní ilé e ìwòsàn.
en: Picture of the survivors, who are being cared for in the hospital.

yo: Sanwó-Olú fẹ́ gbàlejò àyájọ́ ọjọ́ ààbò àti ìlera lágbàáyé
en: Sanwó-Olu wants to host the World Health and Safety Day

yo: Ojú ti rí nídìí iṣẹ́ orin wákà, ṣùgbọ́n Ọlọ́run Ọba ti gbé wa lékè.
en: It's hard to do music, but God the King has lifted us up.

yo: Àjọ tó ń Mójútó Iwà Ìrúfin tó jẹ mọ́ Owó fẹ́ gbógun ti Aṣíwájú.
en: The Financial Crimes Commission wants to fight against foreigners.

yo: Kò sí àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ tẹ́nìkan tún le sọ nípa Aṣíwájú mọ.
en: No other prophecy can be said about Ashyuw anymore.

yo: Ògèdèǹgbé ni Ọlọ́run ti yàn-án láti gba Nàìjíríà sílẹ̀.
en: Ogedengbe was chosen by God to save Nigeria.

yo: Ààrẹ tuntun fagilé òfin tó de àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti wá s’Ámẹ́ríkà.
en: The new president revoked the law that allowed Nigerians to come to America.

yo: Abíóyè, igbákejì Oyèdépò ṣẹ̀yẹ ìkẹyìn fún bàbá ẹ̀.
en: Abioye, Oyedepo's deputy is the last victory for his father.

yo: Ìjọba kò fẹ́ k'áwa ẹlẹ́sìn mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta ṣọ̀rẹ́ ara wa.
en: The government does not want to consider the three religions as friends.

yo: Àwa oníṣẹ̀ṣe ń gbìyànjú lóríi ìbáṣepọ̀ àlàáfíà ní orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.
en: We workers are trying for peaceful relations in this country.

yo: Àrẹ̀mú ṣépè fáwọn òṣèré tó gbowó ṣèwọ́de Sọ̀rọ̀-Sọ́kè.
en: Aremu called for the actors who are paid to enter Soor-Sokke.

yo: Àwọn olóúnjẹ là ń tẹ ewúrẹ́ táa bá jí gbé fún.
en: The herdsmen press the goats that are stolen.

yo: Ìjọba fẹ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí kó àwọn oníbárà kúrò ní Èkó.
en: The government wants to start moving customers away from Lagos.

yo: Àwòrán ìgbà tí Aláàfin àti Onírù fojú kan ara wọn nìyí.
en: Here is a picture of the time Aláafin and Oníru looked at each other.

yo: Ọ́ ti sìnkú Ìyálọ́jà a gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ tó jáde láyé.
en: He has buried the Salvation of all the states of Oyo that appeared in the world.

yo: Àwọn tó ní kí wọ́n bá òun pín owó fáwọn ọmọ aláìníyàá rèé.
en: Those who asked to share money with him for childless children.

yo: Awakọ̀ tó ṣá òṣìṣẹ́ Ìjọba Èkó pa ti sá lọ.
en: The driver who killed the Lagos State worker has fled.

yo: Bí mo bá di Gómìnà Ọ̀ṣun, mo máa fún Ọọ̀ni ní bàlúù tiẹ̀.
en: If I become the Governor of Osun, I will give Oni his own ball.

yo: Ta ló maa dipò Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Ọjà mú lẹ́yìn gbogbo ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí?
en: Who will replace Mr. Market after all this incident?

yo: Ìrọ̀rún dé f'áwọn tó ń ralẹ̀, orí ayélujára ni iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn wà báyìí.
en: It's easy for those who are struggling, their work is now on the internet.

yo: A ò ṣetán àti ṣí àwọn iléègbafẹ́ báyìí nítorí i ààrùn tó ṣì wà níta.
en: We are not ready and open the clubs now because of the disease that is still outside.

yo: Mákindé àtàwọn Gómìnà ilẹ̀ Yorùbá balẹ̀ sí ìlú u Èkó.
en: Makinde and the Yoruba Governor landed in the city of Eko.

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Ògùn ló dá ẹgbẹ́ ọlọ́kadà náà sílẹ̀.
en: The government of Ogun state created the group.

yo: A ò fààyè gba ìwà ọ̀daràn lọ́wọ́ ẹnikẹ́ni rárá.
en: We do not tolerate crime from anyone.

yo: Wọ́n l'óúnjẹ ọmọ Ẹniọlá ti dẹnukọlẹ̀, ló bá ń gbé wọn ṣépè.
en: They ate the food of Anola's son, and he cursed them.

yo: Ìbùdó Ọ̀jájá tó wà ní Ilé-ifẹ̀ máa gbà àwọn Ẹgbẹ̀ta ọ̀dọ́ sẹ́nu iṣẹ́.
en: The Market Center located in Ile-Ife will employ thousands of young people.

yo: Ó ní kí Mákindé gba àwọn Ìbàràpá lọ́wọ́ àwọn daran-daran.
en: He asked Mákindé to save the Ibarapa people from the herdsmen.

yo: Kúnlé Àjàyí àtàwọn òṣèré ṣ'ọjọ́ọ̀bí fún Olúwatúnmibí.
en: Kunle Ajayi and the actors were born for Lordutunmibi.

yo: Ara ẹ̀ kò yá gidigidi ṣùgbọ́n adájọ́ kọ̀ láti fún-un ní ìyọ̀nda.
en: He was not very well but the judge refused to give him permission.

yo: Sanwó-Olú ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú Aṣíwájú lókè òkun, ó ní Àlàáfíà ló wà.
en: Sanwó-Olu had a meeting with the Foreigner across the sea, he said there was peace.

yo: Ẹ wo àwòrán Bàbá Adébóyè níbi ìgbéyàwó ọmọ Ṣọkọyọ̀kọ̀tọ̀.
en: Look at the picture of Father Adéboye at the wedding of Chokoyokoto's son.

yo: Gómìnà náà fẹ́ẹ́ ṣàtúnṣe ilé-ìwòsàn ìjọba tó wà ní Òró.
en: The governor wants to repair the government hospital in Oro.

yo: Ó tún ṣèlérí ìrànwọ́ f'áwọn ọlọ́jà káàkiri gbogbo ìlú náà.
en: He also promised help to traders all over the city.

yo: Dàpọ̀ Abíọ́dún fẹ́ pààrọ aṣọ àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé sádìrẹ.
en: Dopa Abiodun wants to change the school children's clothes.

yo: Ọ̀rínlénírinwó-ó-lé-méjì ọ̀kadà ni àwọn ọlọ́pàá gbà.
en: The police took 200,000 pounds of cash.

yo: Gbogbo rẹ̀ pátápátá ni wọ́n ti lọ̀ lẹ́nu ẹ̀rọ tútù.
en: All of them have gone cold.

yo: Wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kan obìnrin onítíátà náà pé ó ń sá fún ìwé e ìpẹ̀jọ́.
en: The actress was accused of running away from the court.

yo: Àṣírí owó ìfẹ̀hìntì Ògúnlẹ́yẹ tí ilé ìfowópamọ́ fẹ́ẹ́ tẹ̀ mọ́lẹ̀ rèé.
en: The secret of Ogungleya's pension that the bank is about to reveal.

yo: Mo fẹ́ kí ó yé e yín pé obìnrin nìkan kọ́ ló ni oge àti akọ ṣíṣe.
en: I want you to understand that women are not the only ones who have time and manliness.

yo: Àwa ọkùnrin náà gbọdọ̀ túnraṣe nítorí ayẹyẹ tó ń bọ̀.
en: We men must prepare for the coming celebration.

yo: Ìfẹ́ tí mo ní sí ẹ nípọn gidigidi, kódà ó le ju irin lọ.
en: The love I have for you is very thick, even harder than steel.

yo: Ògì àti ẹran díndín ni mo jí-jẹ ní àárọ̀ kùtùkùtù òní kí n to wá.
en: I ate wood and thin meat early this morning before I came.

yo: Ogúnlọ́gọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ni àgbàrá ti gbé dúkìá wọn lọ ní Èkó.
en: Hundreds of people have taken their property away in Lagos.

yo: Àṣà àti ìṣe wa nílùú yìí yàtọ̀ gédéńgbé sí ti ibikíbi lóòtọ́ọ́.
en: Our culture and behavior in this city is completely different from anywhere else.

yo: Onítọ̀hún ṣàárẹ̀ fún ọdún bíi mẹ́ta gbáko kí àlàáfíà tó tọ̀ọ́ wá.
en: He was tired for three years before the right peace came.

yo: Ọpẹ́ ni fún Ọba Òkè tó jẹ́ kí a rí ayẹyẹ yìí ṣe láì sí làásìgbò kan.
en: Thank you to King Oke for allowing us to see this celebration without any delay.

yo: Ìwé yìí máa tọ́ ẹ sọ́nà nípa bí o ṣe lè gbé ìgbéayé ìfọkànbalẹ̀.
en: This book will guide you on how to live a peaceful life.

yo: Mo fẹ́ẹ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ òwò ṣíṣe ní ọdún tó ń bọ̀, àmọ́ ẹ̀rù ń bà mí.
en: I want to start a business next year, but I'm scared.

yo: Ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ alágbèéká ìyàwó mi jábọ́ s'ínú omi ní ọ̀sán-an àná.
en: My wife's cell phone fell into the water yesterday afternoon.

yo: Tí mo bá ní ọ̀nà míràn, mi ò ní dábàá láti yáwó lọ́wọ́ọ àbúrò mi.
en: If I had my way, I would not propose to borrow from my younger brother.

yo: Ọ̀fẹ́ ni àyẹ̀wò ikọ́-ife ní àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn tó wà ní agbègbè yí.
en: Tuberculosis screening is free in hospitals in this area.

yo: A ní láti tẹ̀síwájú nípa ti ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ ògún òyìnbó àti ti ìbílẹ̀.
en: We have to move forward in terms of traditional and traditional knowledge.

yo: Ìsinmi ojọ́ méjì ni ìjọba fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ fún ọdún-un Iléyá.
en: The government gave two days of holiday to the workers for the year of Ilya.

yo: Ọdún-un Kérésìmesì jẹ́ ìgbà tí gbogbo ẹbí máa ń wá papọ̀
en: Christmas is a time when the whole family comes together

yo: Ọmọ náà ń ṣe wánranwànran bíi ẹni tí àlùjọ̀nú kó wọ̀ ní ara.
en: The child is looking like a person who has been clothed in the body.

yo: Gbogbo ara ló ń kan mí nítorí iṣẹ́ oko tí mò ń ṣe láti ọjọ́ ọ Ẹtì.
en: My whole body is aching because of the farm work I have been doing since the days of Eti.

yo: Báwo ni a ṣe máa dé ibi ìnáwó náà nílùú Ìbàdàn láì sí ọkọ̀ ọ èrò?
en: How will we get to the financial center in Ibadan without a car?

yo: Àṣírí oníjìbìtì orí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára tó fi èèyàn ṣòògùn owó ti tú o!
en: The secret of the online fraudster who cheated people for money has been revealed!

yo: Kí a tó lè ṣiṣẹ́ ẹ àjà ilé yìí, a gbọdọ̀ wá àkàbà tó ga gan-an.
en: Before we can work on the roof of this house, we must find a very high ladder.

yo: Àkọ́bí àwọn òbí ì mi ni mo jẹ́, nítorí náà mo gbọdọ̀ tọ́jú àbúrò mi.
en: I am the first born of my parents, so I have to take care of my younger brother.

yo: Mo fi àwòrán-an erin han ọmọ mi kékeré lórí i amóhùnmáwòrán.
en: I showed a picture of an elephant to my little son on the phone.

yo: Ago mélòó ni ayẹyẹ máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ nígbà tí a ti fi gbogbo ọjọ́ palẹ̀mọ́?
en: What time will the party start when we have booked all the days?

yo: Àwọ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ funfun ni mo máa ń wọ̀ ní gbogbo ìgbà nítèmi.
en: I always wear a white shirt.

yo: Ìṣòro ńlá ni láti rí bàtà tó ṣe déédéé fún ẹni tó ní ẹsẹ̀ ńlá.
en: It is a big problem to find the right shoes for someone with big feet.

yo: Kò sí ibi tí àwọn awakọ̀ èrò àti agbèrò kò le tọ̀ sí ní ìpínlẹ̀ ẹ Èkó.
en: There is no place in the state of Lagos that the drivers and passengers cannot go to.

yo: Ọkọ̀ méjì ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ló jábọ́ láti orí afárá tuntun Ojúẹlẹ́gba sí ilẹ̀.
en: Two separate ships fell from the new Ojuhegba bridge to the ground.

yo: Mo níi lọ́kàn láti fojú kan àwọn ẹranko inú igbó kànkan kí n tó lọ.
en: I wanted to see some wild animals before I left.

yo: Ìjọba ti kéde pé ẹni tó bá wa ìwàkuwà ní ojú-u pópó ti ṣetán-an ẹ̀wọ̀n.
en: The government has announced that the person who commits misconduct in the street is ready to be jailed.

yo: Àdìó ti gbàgbé àti mú kọ́kọ́rọ́ ilé ìtajà a rẹ̀ dání kí ó tó jáde.
en: Chicken has forgotten and misplaced the store key before going out.

yo: Abọ́ mẹ́fà àti ṣíbí méjìlá ni mo fẹ́ kó dání tí mo bá ti ń lọ.
en: I want to have six bowls and twelve spoons when I go.

yo: Àwọn tó ń dá àjọ sí Àjọkẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ti ko sí gbèsè ńlá.
en: Those who contribute to Ajheke do not have large debts.

yo: Ṣé wọ́n lè gba ilé ọ̀hún láì t'ọwọ́ bọ ìwé àdéhùn kankan?
en: Can they get that house without any contract?

yo: O ti fi òógùn bo orí ibùnsùn tó yẹ kí gbogbo wa pátá sùn.
en: He has covered the head of the bed with medicine that we should all sleep on.

yo: Àwọn ará àdúgbò ọ̀hún dáná sun ọkùnrin gbọ́mọgbọ́mọ tí wọ́n mú.
en: The people of that area burned the wise man they caught.

yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé láàrin ago méjìlá ọ̀sán sí ago mọ́kànlá a alẹ́.
en: The incident happened between 12 noon and 11 pm.

yo: Ọmọ kékeré kan ló kọ́kọ́ pariwo nígbà tórí àgbàrá ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó ń ṣàn.
en: A small child was the first to scream at the sound of blood.

yo: Ariwo ẹ gbàmí tó ké ló jí àwọn aráalé àti ará àdúgbò kalẹ̀.
en: The noise of his breath woke up the citizens and the local people.

yo: Ní ọjọ́ kejì oṣù kẹfà ọdún yìí ni ó pé ọdún mẹ́fà tí Àlàbí jáde láyé.
en: On the second day of the sixth month of this year, it was six years since Álibi was born.

yo: Kílódé tí ò ń ranjú mọ́ gbogbo ọmọ kékeré tó fẹ́ bá ẹ ṣeré?
en: Why are you staring at every little child who wants to play with you?

yo: Ó ṣeni láàánú pé ìwọ lo ma hu ìwa adójútini yìí nínú ẹgbẹ́.
en: It is unfortunate that you are the one who shows this behavior in the group.

yo: Kódà bí òjò bá rọ iná àti òkúta ní òní, ẹ máa dé ilé-ìwé.
en: Even if it rains fire and stones today, you will come to school.

yo: Àkọ̀yìnsí Àlàbí tí mo rí ni mo fi mọ̀ pé ẹ̀yin lẹ pé jọ sí orí òkè náà.
en: The last Alabi I saw is how I know that you have gathered on the mountain.

yo: Àsìko ó ti tó kí àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ọkọ wá dọ̀bálẹ̀ gba aya wọn.
en: The time has come for the husband's friends to visit their wives.

yo: Oúnjẹ àdàlù tó jẹ ní àná ló jẹ́ kí ó máa só isó burúkú báyìí.
en: The mixed food that he ate yesterday caused him to vomit badly now.

yo: Àkọ́kọ́ ni pé kí á wá àwọn olùkọ́ tó yanrantí fún ilé-ìwé yìí.
en: The first thing is to find the right teachers for this school.

yo: Òtútù ti kó wọ Ajíbádé lára dé'bi pé ará ẹ̀ ń gbọ̀n pẹ̀pẹ̀.
en: The cold has affected Ajibáde so much that his people are shivering.

yo: Àgbo jẹ̀dí tó mu lọ́jọ́ náà ló múu bẹnu jẹ́ nínú u àwòrán yìí.
en: It was the wine he drank that day that inspired this image.

yo: Ìtọ̀ ọ ṣúgà ti fẹ́ rán ọmọkùnrin náà lọ sí ọ̀run àpàpàndodo.
en: A drop of sugar is about to send the boy to heaven.

yo: Ẹ̀rí ọkàn ń jẹ́ mi nítorí ẹran méjì tí mo mú nínú u ìsasùn.
en: My conscience is burning because of the two meats I took in my sleep.

yo: Báwo ni àwọn olè náà ṣe fo ìgàná yìí wọlé pẹ̀lú u bí ó ṣe ga tó?
en: How did the thieves jump into this fire with him how high it is?

yo: Irun tuntun tíyàwó mi ṣe ló ń jẹ́ kí gbogbo orí máa kán gógó.
en: My wife's new hair is making everyone's head itch.

yo: Ẹ̀yà aṣọ dúdú méjèèjì yàtọ̀ gédégbé síra wọn.
en: The two black dresses are completely different from each other.

yo: Túndé ti ra ẹ̀rọ agbohùnsílẹ̀ tuntun méjì fún iṣẹ́ orin rẹ̀.
en: Tunde has bought two new recorders for his music.

yo: Á tó mílíọ̀nù méjì náírà àtààbọ̀ tó ná lóríi irinṣẹ́ náà.
en: About two and a half million naira was spent on the tool.

yo: Òkùnkùn ma ń dẹ́rù bà mí tí mo bá dáwà nínú u yàrá.
en: The dark scares me if I am alone in the room.

yo: Ọwọ́ ẹ̀ ti wà lókè láti ìgbà ta ti sọ pé a máa fún wọn ní ẹ̀bùn.
en: Their hands have been up since who said that we will give them a gift.

yo: Ó lòdì sófin kí èèyàn máa d'alẹ̀ sí ẹ̀gbẹ́ ẹ títì.
en: It is against the law for a person to spend the night next to you.

yo: Ìdààmú bá gbogbo àwọn ọlọ́jà nígbà tí wọ́n gbọ́ pé ààrẹ ḿ bọ̀.
en: All the traders were worried when they heard that the president was coming.

yo: Inú ìgò ló tọ̀ sí nítorí pé kòsí igbó tàbí ilé-ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀ nítòsí.
en: He had to go inside the bottle because there was no forest or toilet nearby.

yo: Ó ṣe kókó kó máa tẹríba fún àwọn àgbàlagbà ní àdúgbò.
en: It is important to obey the elders in the community.

yo: Kò sí bo ṣe lè bínú síi tó, o gbọ́dọ̀ fa ojú ẹ̀ mọ̀ra.
en: No matter how angry you are, you must draw your eyes.

yo: Ìdìbò ipò ààrẹ tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà ń ba àwọn aráàlú lẹ́rù gan.
en: The upcoming presidential election is scaring the public.

yo: Ó ṣeéṣe kí arákùnrin náà gba ọ̀nà àlùmọ̀kọ́rọ́yí wọlé.
en: The brother may have taken a more sophisticated approach.

yo: Etí ìjọba ti di sí igbe àti ariwo àwa ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: The ears of the government are closed to the cries and noise of us Nigerians.

yo: Báwo ni Àjàdí ò bá ṣe ṣe ara ẹ̀ kání owó náà sọnù?
en: How can Ajadi not make himself lose the money?

yo: A gbàdúrà kí Olúwa bá wa pẹ̀tù sí wọn nínú.
en: We pray that the Lord will be gentle with them.

yo: Bí mo bá lágbára ìyàwó mẹ́ta, kódà màá fẹ́ wọn.
en: If I could have three wives, I would even marry them.

yo: Ẹ̀ẹ̀kan lọ́sẹ̀ péré ni Àjàní ma ń bá ìyàwó ẹ̀ lò pọ̀.
en: Ajani has intercourse with his wife only once a week.

yo: Mo gbàgbọ́ pé ayẹyẹ ìgbéyàwó aláriwo kò bá kádàrá mi mu.
en: I believe that a noisy wedding ceremony does not suit my destiny.

yo: Ẹbí kọ̀ọ̀kan kò gbọdọ̀ bí ju ọmọ méjì lọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí òfín ṣe sọ.
en: Each family must not have more than two children according to the law.

yo: Inú bíbí maa ń da ilé rú ni, ó sì mọ ń ba nǹkan jẹ́ ni.
en: Childbirth always disturbs the house, and it destroys things.

yo: Ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́fà la fi seré kiri lóríi pápá kí eré ìdárayá náà tó bẹ̀rẹ̀.
en: We walked around the field for six minutes before the game started.

yo: Ní àná, ó fapá rọ́ níbi tó ti ń ṣe eréépá ní iléèwé.
en: Yesterday, he collapsed while doing radio at school.

yo: Gbogbo ara ló ń ro mí bíi pé mo gbé gẹdú.
en: My whole body feels like I'm living here.

yo: Bámi fi ọwọ́ tẹ igi yíì mọ́lẹ̀ kí n lè ríi kàn dáadáa.
en: Bami pressed this tree down with my hand so that I could see it better.

yo: Tani ó lè wẹ̀ fún wákàtí kan láì sí ìsinmi rárá?
en: Who can bathe for an hour without any rest?

yo: Ojú orun ni mo wà nílé tí ìpè Ọ̀gá fi wọlé.
en: I was at home with the eyes of heaven when the Master's call came.

yo: Wọ́n ní ka dá ẹgbẹ̀rún ọgọ́rùn-ún náírà fún ìrìnàjò tó ń bọ̀
en: They said that they will save hundreds of thousands of naira for the next trip

yo: Ó ní àwọn ohun tí mo kọ tí mo fẹ́ kó o bá mi wò ní ọ̀la.
en: It has things I wrote that I want you to see with me tomorrow.

yo: Kò sẹ́ni tí kò fẹ́ràn-an ìfà láàárín gbogbo àwa táa jókòó síbí.
en: There is no one who doesn't like it among all of us who are sitting here.

yo: Mo ti ní kí ẹ yé máa tojú bọlé onílé tẹ́ ẹ bá ti dé láti ilé e kéwú.
en: I have asked you to pay attention to the owner of the house if you come from your house.

yo: A ti pinnu pé a ò ní máa lọ sí Ògbómọ̀ṣọ́ fún ọdún mọ́.
en: We have decided that we will not go to Ogbomoso for another year.

yo: Odindi ọ̀sẹ̀ kan ni wọ́n fi ṣe ìgbéyàwó nílùú Ìlọrin.
en: They got married in Ilorin for a whole week.

yo: Ìjọba ní láti tètè rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn ajínigbé tó ń sọṣẹ́ ní àríwá.
en: The government needs to quickly deal with the kidnappers who are working in the north.

yo: Tẹ́ ẹ bá dé àwọn ilé míràn ní Èkó, kò ní sí balùwẹ̀.
en: If you come to other houses in Lagos, there will be no bathroom.

yo: Wọ́n ní á dúró ká jẹun kí á tó máa lọ sí ibi-iṣẹ́ padà.
en: They told us to stop and eat before going back to work.

yo: Ìgbésẹ̀ wo gan-an pàtó lo fẹ́ gbé lóríi àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ọ̀lẹ.
en: What action exactly do you want to take on lazy workers.

yo: Ológbò mi náà gbìyànjú, ó ti bímọ mẹ́fà lẹ́nu ìgbà tó ti wà níbí.
en: My cat also tried, she has given birth to six children in the time she has been here.

yo: Ìròyìn náà tó gbogbo wa létí nípasẹ̀ ẹ bàba bàbáà mi.
en: The news came to all of us through my grandfather.

yo: Ẹ̀yìn mí ti gan, mi ò rò pé mo lè r'oko mọ́ bíi tìgbà èwe.
en: My back is so bad, I don't think I can farm anymore like I did when I was young.

yo: Ilé e àwọn ọmọ mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta jìnà sí ibi tí wọ́n ti ń kọ́ṣẹ́.
en: The house of the three children is far from the place where they are training.

yo: Lọ́dọọdún, a má ń lọ sí orí òkè láti lọ gbàdúrà fún ọjọ́ mẹ́ta.
en: Every year, we go to the mountain to pray for three days.

yo: Kíni àpẹẹrẹ àwọn ẹranko tó ní ojú ní ẹ̀gbẹ́?
en: What are examples of animals with side eyes?

yo: Ìrọ̀rùn ni jíjẹ àti mímu ń bá dé láti ìgbà tí a ti yan olórí tuntun.
en: Eating and drinking have become easier since the new leader was elected.

yo: Àbúrò mi obìnrin máa ń kàwé tó bá délé nígbàgbogbo.
en: My younger sister always reads when she comes home.

yo: Ààmì i títóbi Ọlọ́run wà nínú àwọn ohun tó dá pátápátá.
en: The sign of God's greatness is in the things he created.

yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ náà ti gbé ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ fún òṣìṣẹ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: The company has provided a car for each employee.

yo: Àwọn abiyamọ àti àwọn ọmọ tuntun nílòo ìtọ́jú tó péye.
en: Mothers and newborns need proper care.

yo: Bàbá Òǹdó ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ ríran mọ́ tààrà lẹ́hìn ìjàmbá ọkọ̀ náà.
en: Ondo's father was unable to see immediately after the car accident.

yo: Orí àpáta la dúró sí nígbà tí ejò ńlá wọ inú ilé.
en: We stopped at the top of the rock when a big snake entered the house.

yo: Wọ́n ti fi ọwọ́ agbára gba ilẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ ọ ogunlọ́gọ̀ ọ èèyàn.
en: They have taken the land from you by force.

yo: Ṣé o ṣì rántí orúkọ 'áwọn olóyìnbó máa ń pe ẹni tó fẹ́ràn-an òṣùpá?
en: Do you still remember the name 'the wise call the one who loves the moon?

yo: A ṣe ìgbéyẹ̀wò kékeré fún-un, ṣùgbọ́n kò yege.
en: We did a small test for him, but it was not clear.

yo: Irú olóòótọ́ bíi tìrẹ kò wọ́pọ̀ ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní òde òní.
en: Honest people like you are rare in Nigeria today.

yo: Wọ́n bá ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan wúrà níbẹ̀ nígbà tí yàrá náà di ṣíṣí.
en: They found a lot of gold there when the room was opened.

yo: Bí mo ṣe kúrò nínú ilé tó ń jó láì farapa jẹ́ ohun ìyanu.
en: How I got out of the burning house unscathed is a miracle.

yo: Ní bíi ọdún mẹ́fà sẹ́yìn ni Ajíbọ́lá pàdánù ọmọ méjì.
en: About six years ago, Ajibola lost two children.

yo: Ooru burúkú tó mú ti jẹ́ kí orí inú ike náà yọ́ọ́.
en: The intense heat caused the head inside the plastic to melt.

yo: Ṣé ẹ ní àkọsílẹ̀ àwọn iǹkan tí ẹ fẹ́ rà lọ́jà lọ́la?
en: Do you have a list of things you want to buy at the market tomorrow?

yo: Onílé ti kìlọ̀ pé kí a yé gbé ọkọ̀ síwájú ìtà láì gbàṣẹ.
en: The owner has warned that we should leave the vehicle in front of the street without permission.

yo: Ògá ni Àríkẹ́ nípa ká ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ ní kíkọ.
en: Arikek is a master of word structure in writing.

yo: Bí wọ́n ṣe gbọ́ pé ó ti fi sílẹ̀, ọkàn wọn ò balẹ̀ mọ́.
en: When they heard that he had left, their hearts were not calm.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ àǹfàní ni èso máa ń ṣe fún àgọ̀ ara.
en: Fruit has many benefits for the body.

yo: Tó bá ti jí ní àárọ̀ kùtùkùtù, orin kíkọ ló máa n fi ń jí gbogbo ará-ilé.
en: When he wakes up early in the morning, he wakes up everyone in the house by singing.

yo: Kò rọrùn láti máa kàwé kó sì tún máa ṣiṣẹ́ nígbà kannáà.
en: It is not easy to study and work at the same time.

yo: Níbi tí mo dùbúlẹ̀ sí ni kòkòró ti ta mí ní apá.
en: Where I lay, a bug stung my arm.

yo: Òjò wẹliwẹli àná ni kò jẹ́ ka lè wá síbi ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún náà.
en: Yesterday's heavy rain prevented us from attending the festival.

yo: Ẹ gbúdọ̀ ṣàkíyèsí irú àwọn èèyàn tí ẹ̀ ń gbà sílé.
en: You must pay attention to the kind of people you welcome home.

yo: Aṣojú olùdásílẹ̀ ilé-iṣẹ́ wa ló bá àwọn oníròyìn sọ̀rọ̀.
en: The representative of the founder of our company spoke to the reporters.

yo: A máa yanjú-u gbogbo iṣẹ́ tó wà nílẹ̀ kó tó di ago méjì ọ̀sán.
en: We will solve all the work on the ground before two o'clock in the afternoon.

yo: Ṣé ẹ ti kó yìnyín sórí àwọn ọtí tí ẹ ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbà?
en: Have you put ice on the beers you just bought?

yo: Ó wà ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé-ìtajà ògùn jákè-jádò orílẹ̀-èdè e Nàìjíríà.
en: It is available in many drug stores across Nigeria.

yo: Ìdá mẹ́wàá ló kù tí mo fẹ́ san tí mo bá ti délé padà.
en: There is 10 percent left that I want to pay when I return home.

yo: Ojú-u fèrèsé ni wọ́n gbà yọwó táa kó sínú ilé.
en: They took the money that was brought into the house through the window.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ èèyàn ló gbàgbọ́ pé ọ̀run ni ìdájọ́ wà.
en: Many people believe that judgment is in heaven.

yo: Ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ alágbèéká ẹ̀ ló fi tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sínú ilé.
en: It was his cell phone that turned on the light in the house.

yo: Kó irúgbìn àgbálùmọ́ mẹ́rin sínú ilé to gbẹ́.
en: Put four seeds in a dry house.

yo: Ọmọ èèyàn ò gbọdọ̀ dàgbà sí àdúgbò tí wọ́n ti ń ṣe jàgídíjàgan.
en: A human being should not grow up in an area where violence has been going on.

yo: Bùbá tó o rán ṣe déédéé ọmọ tí mo gbàá fún.
en: If you send it regularly, I will give it to the child.

yo: Àjọ wá ti ń fi àkókò ṣòfò lóríi gbígba àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tuntun.
en: The organization has been wasting time on recruiting new employees.

yo: Ọ̀sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ ló yẹ kí á máa fi oúnjẹ ránṣé sí abúlé òdìkejì.
en: Every week we should send food to the other village.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ yan Ìgbòho láti gbógun ti àwọn adigunjalè
en: The members chose Igbho to fight the robbers

yo: Níbo ni gbogbo àwọn owó táwọn ìjọba wa yìí maá ń pè wà.
en: Where are all the money that our government is calling for?

yo: Àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun ń ṣelédè lẹ́yìn àkọni ilẹ̀ ẹ wọn tó lọ.
en: The people of Osun state are protecting after the first of their land is gone.

yo: Akíndélé ní ẹgbẹ́ òun ló ń gòkè láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tí ìbò kò tíì parí.
en: Akindele in his party is gaining ground in the states where the polls have not yet ended.

yo: Oríṣiríṣi oúnjẹ ló wà ní ilẹ̀ Yorùbá tí ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ò mọ̀
en: There are different types of food in Yoruba land that many people do not know

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìdìbò nílẹ̀ yìí ti ṣe àkójọpọ̀ orúkọ ọdún yìí
en: The organization that oversees the electoral system in this country has compiled the names of this year

yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ní kí àwọn ará ìlú dẹ́kun àti máa dí àwọn lọ́wọ́.
en: The police asked the citizens to stop and stop them.

yo: Ọ̀gá ọlọ́pàá ní ó yẹ kí àwọn ará ìlú òún lè mọ̀ pé iṣẹ́ ẹ wọn ò rọrùn
en: The police chief said that the people of his town should know that their job is not easy

yo: Bí àwọn ará ìlú ṣe maa ń ràgà bo ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n bá mú kò dára.
en: How the people of the city are eager to cover the criminal when they are caught is not good.

yo: Akíbòwálé ní àwọn ìdíwọ́ tó le è de ilẹ̀ Yorùbá mọ́lẹ̀ kò tíì yí padà.
en: Akibowale said the obstacles that prevent him from reaching Yoruba land have not changed.

yo: Ìdí tí ìdìbò kò fi yanjú lórílẹ̀èdè wa ni à ń gbìnyànjú àti ṣàlàyé.
en: The reason why the election is not resolved in our country is what we are trying to explain.

yo: Fáyọ̀ṣe ní kò sí ìyàtọ̀ láàárín ìwà àwọn ọmọ ẹ̀ àti tèmi
en: There is no difference between the behavior of your children and mine

yo: Ẹgbẹ́ ẹ wa ló gba ìjókòó tó pọ̀ jùlọ ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àwọn ìpínlẹ̀
en: Our party won the majority of seats in the state parliament

yo: Àfikún ìdìbò yóò wáyé ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ mélòó kan ní oṣù tó ń bọ̀.
en: Additional elections will be held in several states next month.

yo: Kí ló ṣẹlẹ̀ níbi ìgbẹ́jọ́ Àlàó Akálà ní Ìbàdàn lónìí?
en: What happened at Alao Akala's trial in Ibadan today?

yo: Àwọn olórí ti gbà pé pípa ni kí wọ́n pa àwọn tó ń fipá bá èèyàn lò.
en: The leaders have agreed that those who abuse people should be killed.

yo: Akín dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ fún sùúrù wọn lórí owó oṣù tuntun.
en: Akin thanked the workers for their patience on the new salary.

yo: Ìjọbá ní ìwadìí yóò yàtọ̀ lórí ilé tó wó nítorí i ààrẹ́ fẹ́ mọ ìdí ẹ̀.
en: The government in the investigation will be different on the house that collapsed because the president wants to know the reason.

yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìdìbò pín ìwé ẹ̀rí fún àwọn aṣòfin àpapọ̀
en: The organization that oversees the election process distributes certificates to federal legislators
