yo: Ìbáṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ ìyá jẹ́ ohun tó ń to ìlú tàbí da ìlú rú.
en: Relationships between mothers and children are what make or break a city.

yo: Ọbásanjọ́ pàrọwà fún àwọn ẹbí tó ní ọmọ ní ilée ìwé gíga.
en: Obasanjo appealed to families who have children in higher education.

yo: Ìrírí nǹkankan ló máa ń bí irúfẹ́ ìwà tí wọ́n lé wù lóríi nǹkan náà.
en: Experiencing something gives birth to the kind of behavior that they like about that thing.

yo: Àwọn ewúrẹ́ ní àdúgbò yìí máa ń ṣe bíi pé wọn kò ki ń jẹun rárá.
en: The goats in this area act as if they are not eating at all.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn kán gbàgbọ́ pé jíjẹ ẹran ti adìẹ tàbí ewúrẹ́ kò da rárá.
en: People tend to believe that eating chicken or goat meat is not bad at all.

yo: Àwọn ilé tó ń wó ní àdúgbò yìí kìí ṣe nítorí ohun èlò tí ò da
en: The houses that are collapsing in this area are not because of bad materials

yo: Wọ́n ní kí àwọn èèyàn dẹ́kun láti máa pe àwọn obìnrin ní aṣẹ́wó.
en: They asked people to stop calling women prostitutes.

yo: Àwọn ọ̀daràn ní wọn kò le è fí tọkàntọkàn jẹ́wọ́ fún àwọn ọlọ́pàá.
en: Criminals are unable to sincerely confess to the police.

yo: Àwọn jàdùkú àti ọmọ ilé ìṣẹ́ ológun ló wà nídíi bí ìdìbó ṣe dàrú.
en: Rioters and members of the military were involved in the election.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn máa ń fi ojú aláìlẹ́kọ̀ọ́ wo àwọn tó wọ aṣọ tó ṣíraálẹ̀
en: People look at those who wear loose clothes with uneducated eyes

yo: Ohun tí wọn kò mọ̀, ó pọ̀ ju èyí tí wọ́n mọ̀ lọ
en: What they don't know is more than what they know

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ọmọ ilé ìwé gíga ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí jẹ́ ohun tó nílò ọpọlọ tó péye.
en: Does a university student in this country need the right brain.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn àjọ tó ń rí sí ètò ẹ̀kọ́ lásán ti tó rò fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ wọ̀nyí.
en: The idea of ​​the organizations that are looking at the education system is just a thought for these students.

yo: Ẹ wá lónìí, ẹ jókòó lọ́la jẹ́ ohun tó ń ba púpọ̀ nínú un wọn lọ́kàn jẹ́
en: You come today, you sit tomorrow is what hurts many of them

yo: Àrokò ìbànújẹ́ àti àìlègbẹ́kẹ̀lé sì ni èyí jẹ́ fún wọn àti àwọn òbí i wọn.
en: This is an essay of sadness and distrust for them and their parents.

yo: Àyàfi tí ọwọ́ bá tẹ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tó na òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ wa, ni iná yóò tó tàn ní Orílé.
en: Unless there is a hand on the youths who are attacking our workers, there will be a fire in Orile.

yo: Ojú oníṣekúṣe ni wọ́n fi ń wo àwọn ọmọ ilée ìwé gíga náà.
en: They look at the students of the high school with immoral eyes.

yo: Púpọ̀ èyí dá lóríi pé àárín-in gbùngbùn Èkó ni ilé ìwé yìí wà.
en: A lot of this depends on the fact that this school is located in the center of Lagos.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ni wọ́n rí Èkó gẹ́gẹ́ bí orísun ohun burúkú ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: Many people see Eko as the source of evil in this country.

yo: Wọ́n gbà pé owó ni àwọn ará Èkó ń lé, wọn kò ní Ọlọ́run.
en: They believe that the people of Eko are after money, they don't have God.

yo: Àgbèrè, ìpànìyàn, ṣíṣẹ́yún, olè, àìlóòótó, àìní ìtẹríba jẹ́ ìwà burúkú
en: Adultery, murder, abortion, theft, dishonesty, disobedience are evil.

yo: Èyí náà ni wọ́n kà mọ́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilé ìwé gíga Èkó náà.
en: This is also what the students of the Eko University are considered to be.

yo: Wọ́n gbàgbé pé ilé àti ọ̀nà ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni gbogbo wọ́n ti wá.
en: They forgot that they all came from different homes and paths.

yo: Bí àwọn ilé ìwé gíga ní ibòmíràn ṣe rí gan ni àwọn náà rí.
en: They are just like the universities elsewhere.

yo: Púpọ̀ nínú un wọ́n ní ẹ̀sìn, wọ́n ní ìwà, wọ́n sì ní ẹwà pẹ̀lú.
en: Most of them have religion, they have character, and they have beauty too.

yo: Bí a ṣe ní àwọn èèyàn burúkú náà ni a ṣẹ ní àwọn èèyàn rere
en: As we have bad people, we have good people

yo: Ìjọbá ti sọ pé oríṣiríṣi àǹfààní ni wọ́n máa ń ní fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́
en: The government has said that they have various benefits for students.

yo: Ohun tó sì hàn gbangba ni pé, Èkó ló ni wọ́n, àwọn ni wọ́n ni Èkó.
en: What is clear is that, they are Eko, they are Eko.

yo: Orin ní ilẹ̀ ẹ Yorùbá jẹ́ ohun tó pàtàkì, tí kò ṣé fọwọ́ rọ́ sẹ́yìn.
en: Music in Yoruba land is an important thing that cannot be ignored.

yo: Ohun tó ba àwọn èèyàn jẹ́ ni kí wọ́n yáwó kí wọ́n má da padà
en: The thing that destroys people is that they borrow money and not pay it back

yo: Ọmọ bíbí láì lo iṣẹ́ abẹ́ ti ń di ohun ìgbàgbé.
en: Child birth without surgery is becoming a thing of the past.

yo: Àwọn màmá ti ń pariwo lórí àwọn olóyún tí wọn kìí fẹ́ dá ọmọ bí
en: Mothers are shouting about pregnant women who do not want to give birth

yo: Ohun tí wọ́n máa ń wí gẹ́lẹ́ tí wọ́n bá ń rọbí ni pé àwọn fẹ́ ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ.
en: What they always say when they are pregnant is that they want to operate.

yo: Wọ́n máa ń gbàgbé pé iṣẹ́ abẹ kìí ṣe ohun tó rọrùn rárá
en: They tend to forget that surgery is not an easy thing

yo: Dídá ọmọ bí kìí ṣe ohun tó rọrùn lóòótọ́ ṣùgbọ́n iṣé abẹ́ léwu jù ú lọ.
en: Giving birth is not an easy thing, but surgery is more dangerous.

yo: Ṣé ohun tí ẹ̀ ń sọ ní báyìí ni pé wọn kò lè rọ́mọ bí?
en: Is what you are saying now that they can't be soft?

yo: Wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ ara wọn gidi gan, wọ́n lè kú fún ara wọn.
en: They love each other so much, they can die for each other.

yo: Láti kékeré ni bàbá àti ìyá a yín ti fẹ́ràn ara wọn gidi gan.
en: Since childhood, your father and mother have loved each other very much.

yo: Kò pé tí bàbá a yín lọ ìlú òyìnbó ni ó mú ìyá a yín sọ́dọ̀.
en: It wasn't until your father went to the village that he brought your mother to him.

yo: Ilé ìwé ni wọ́n ti kọ́kọ́ pàdé ara wọn kí wọ́n tó fẹ́ ara wọn
en: They met each other at school before they got married

yo: Kò sí obìnrin kankan tó fẹ́ kí ọmọ wọ́n ní aṣa lọ́kọ tàbí láya.
en: No woman wants their child to have a bad husband or wife.

yo: Obìnrin tí ó bá le è fa àwọn ẹbí ọkọ rẹ̀ mọ́ra ó ti ṣetán ilé ọkọ.
en: A woman who can attract her husband's family is ready for her husband's house.

yo: Gbogbo àwọn ẹbí ti gbà kí Adéyanjú fẹ́ Ìbùkún gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìyàwó
en: All the families have agreed for Adeyanju to marry Ibukun as a wife

yo: Ìgbéyàwó tí àwọn èèyàn ń ṣe ní òde òní ni èyí tí wọ́n ń ṣe ní ilé ẹjọ́.
en: The marriage that people do today is the one that is done in court.

yo: Ìdí pàtàkì fún èyí ni láti ní àṣẹ lórí àwọn nǹkan tí ẹni a bá fẹ́ bá ní.
en: The main reason for this is to have authority over the things that the person we want has.

yo: Àfi bí ìgba pé wọ́n máa ń lérò láti pínyà kí wọ́n tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ rárá.
en: Except when they think to separate before they start at all.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyan ti gbàgbé pé lóòótọ́ ni Ọlọ́run wà
en: Many people have forgotten that God really exists

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ni wọ́n ń ṣe ìgbéyàwó lẹ́yìn àwọn òbíi wọn
en: Many young people marry after their parents

yo: Wọ́n á gbàgbé pé ìgbeyàwó tí ò bá ní ìfọwọ́sí òbí.
en: They will forget that marriage without parental consent.

yo: Oríṣiríṣi àṣà ló rọ̀ mọ́ ìgbeyàwó ní àwùjọ Yorùbá.
en: There are many customs associated with marriage in Yoruba society.

yo: Nígbà tí Adé fẹ́ lọ sanwó ni àwọn adigunjalẹ̀ fipá gba owó lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀.
en: When Adé was about to pay, the robbers took money from him.

yo: Ó ní pé ìgbà tí òun bá ra ọkọ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ ni òun yóò tó yọjú sílé.
en: He said that when he buys a car, he will come home.

yo: Obìnrin tórí kó yọ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ajínigbé ní ewé ni òun ń jẹ nínú igbó.
en: The woman who escaped from the kidnappers was eating leaves in the forest.

yo: Ìjọbá ní láti ṣe àtúntò fún wọn láti rí owó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ san.
en: The government has to make arrangements for them to get the salaries of the workers paid.

yo: Adéyanjú àti àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ̀ tí wọ́n jọ ń mọtí ní ìjàm̀bá ọkọ̀ lánàá.
en: Adeyanju and his friends who were drinking together had a car accident yesterday.

yo: Níbo ni gbogbo àwọn ọmọ mí wà báyìí?
en: Where are all my children now?

yo: Ẹ̀gbọ́n mi ló gbégbá orókè nínú ìdíje orin tí wọ́n ṣe parí lọ́sẹ̀ tó lọ.
en: My brother won the music competition that ended last week.

yo: Bí wọ́n ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀ lọ ni àwọn ọmọ ìyalọ́jà wọlé wá kí bàbá.
en: As they were talking, the children came in to greet father.

yo: Ìtan Ẹfúnṣetán Aníwúrà jẹ́ ìtàn tó ń lani lóye.
en: The story of Effunsetán Aniwura is a story that makes sense.

yo: Kò sí nǹkan tí àwọn èèyàn ò lè ṣe nítorí owó ní ayé òde òní.
en: There is nothing that people cannot do for money in today's world.

yo: Akín sọ wípé gbogbo iṣẹ́ àgbàṣe tí ó ṣe lẹ́yìn ìbò ni wọ́n gbéyẹ̀wò.
en: Akin said that all the good work he did after the election was reviewed.

yo: Nínú ìròyìn ni a ti ríi gbọ́ pé ọ̀gá iléèwé kan jí akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọ rẹ̀ kan gbé
en: In the news we have heard that a school principal kidnapped a student

yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ náà là ń gbọ́ tí olùkọ́ ń fi ipá bá àwọn ọmọ kékèké lòpọ̀.
en: That's how we hear that the teacher is using force to have sex with the children.

yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè yí ò wulẹ̀ bìkítà bóyá àwọn èèyàn òún wà ní àlááfíà.
en: The president of this country does not care if his people are at peace.

yo: Ìwé atúmọ̀ èdè tí o rí yẹn kìí ṣe tirẹ̀, tí ẹlòmíràn ni.
en: That dictionary you saw is not yours, it belongs to someone else.

yo: Ìbọn ni wọ́n fi lé àwọn jàǹdùkú tó rísí àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lágbègbè Orílé.
en: Guns were put on the mobs who saw the youths in Orile area.

yo: Ìjà ẹ̀bi ni ìyá àfín ń jà, àbíkẹ́yìn wọn ló kọ́kọ́ na Táyélolú.
en: Afif's mother is fighting a family feud, the youngest of them was the first to fight Táyélolú.

yo: Gbogbo ìlú ló ń tẹ́tí sí ohun Adájọ́ Àgbá fẹ́ sọ lórí ẹjọ́ ìdìbò lọ́ṣun.
en: Every town is listening to what Judge Agba has to say on the election case.

yo: Ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọn wa a máa pe Similólúwa ní ẹlẹ́yinjú ẹgẹ́.
en: Our brother-in-law used to call Similoluwa the trapper.

yo: Láti kékeré ni mo ti ń dá ara mi tọ́ láìsí olùrànlọ́wọ́ kankan
en: From a young age I have been self-correcting without any help

yo: Morẹ́nikéjì fúnra ẹ̀ ló san owó ilé ìwé gíga ẹ̀ látàrí oúnjẹ tí ó ń tà.
en: Morenikeji himself paid his school fees from the food he sold.

yo: Ẹ̀wọ̀n-ọn gbére ni adájọ́ fún arákùnrin Adé pé ó jí olólùfẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ gbé.
en: The judge sentenced Adé's brother to prison for kidnapping his lover.

yo: Ó ti yẹ kí ẹ tọrọ ìdáríjì ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ ọmọ yìí láti ọdún tó ti pẹ́.
en: You should have asked for forgiveness from this child since the last year.

yo: Èrò mi ni láti fi gbogbo owó tí mo bá kó jọ rán ọmọ mi lọ ilée ìwé.
en: My plan is to use all the money I save to send my son to school.

yo: Adájọ́ àgbà ti yí ìgbẹ́jọ́ ọ rẹ̀ padà lóríi àtúndì ìbò o ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.
en: The Chief Judge has changed his judgment on the re-election of Oyo state.

yo: Àwọn ọmọ wọ̀nyí nífẹ̀ẹ́ à ti máa kọrin ní inú un balùwẹ̀ tí wọ́n bá ń wẹ̀.
en: These children love to sing in the bathroom when they bathe.

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló nífẹ̀ẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìwé, ṣùgbọ́n kìí ṣe gbogbo wa la ní àǹfàání.
en: Many people love reading, but not all of us have the opportunity.

yo: Oríkì jẹ́ ohun tó ṣe kókó fún ìdánimọ̀ ní àwùjọ Yorùbá.
en: Poetry is essential to identity in Yoruba society.

yo: Ilà kíkọ, asọ wíwọ̀ àti adé orí tàbí ilẹ̀kẹ̀ jẹ́ àmì ìdánimọ̀ láwùjọ
en: Stripes, clothing and crowns or beads are symbols of social identity.

yo: Àṣà máa ń yàtò síra láti agbègbè ságbègbè.
en: Culture varies from region to region.

yo: Kò yẹ kí ìyá jẹ bàbá àti ìyá, kó tún wá jẹ ọmọ náà.
en: The mother should not eat the father and the mother, and then eat the child.

yo: Oríṣiríṣi ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga ló wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.
en: There are various universities in Lagos state.

yo: Èwo ni ìyá yí ń kó sí inú ọkọ̀ ní àárọ̀ kùtùkùtù báyìí?
en: What is this mother carrying in the car this early in the morning?

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ ọ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn dá Fáyẹmí láre lórí ẹjọ́ ilẹ̀ òun àti ẹ̀gbọ́n ọn rẹ̀.
en: The Court of Appeal acquitted Fayemi on his and his brother's land case.

yo: Ọlá kìlọ̀ fún Adé lórí ohun tó leè ṣàkóbá fún sáà kejì i rẹ̀.
en: Ola warned Adé about what could happen to him during his second term.

yo: Adájọ́ Ilé ẹjọ́ gíga ló ní òfin kò mọ olówó tàbí tálákà
en: The Supreme Court judge has no knowledge of rich or poor

yo: Mo ti fún bàba ẹlẹ́ran ní owó èmi àti ti ẹ̀gbọ́n mi.
en: I have given my brother's and my brother's money to the butcher.

yo: Bá mi kó àwọn ẹ̀fọ́ àti iṣu yìí sí ọ̀dọ̀ rẹ, kò sí àyè mọ́ ní ibí.
en: Take these weeds and yams with me to you, there is no more room here.

yo: Adé sọ fún àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ ní ilé ọtí kan pé òun ṣẹ̀ ra ọkọ̀ kan
en: Adé told his friends at a bar that he just bought a car

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ẹ já ẹrù bàbá àgbàlagbà yẹn kalẹ̀ ní?
en: Did you let go of that old father's burden?

yo: Níbo ni ẹ fẹ́ gbé gbogbo ẹrù tí ẹ̀ ń sún sínú báyìí sí?
en: Where do you want to put all the stuff you are pushing in now?

yo: Àdúrà ò ní padà gbà mọ́ nígbà tí àbòsí bá ti pọ̀ jù.
en: Prayer will not be answered when there is too much bias.

yo: O jọlá àwọn èèyàn bí èèyàn lónìí nítorí ìwà ẹ ò da rárá.
en: It's a pity that people are born today because their behavior is not right at all.

yo: Ṣé dandan ni kẹ́ ẹ sanwó èèyàn tí ẹ ò mọ̀ rárá ni?
en: Do you have to pay someone you don't know at all?

yo: Bó bá ti ẹ̀ jẹ́ ti èèyàn tí ẹ mọ̀, ṣé dandan ni kẹ́ ẹ sanwó o wọn ni?
en: If it belongs to someone you know, do you have to pay them?

yo: Ọlọ́run mà ló ní kí ọkọ̀ ó tètè kún, ṣé ẹni tí mo ma bá jókòó nì yẹn?
en: God asked the boat to fill up quickly, is that the person I sit on?

yo: Ẹ wo ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ nílẹ̀ adúláwọ̀ lọ́ṣẹ̀ tó lọ nípa àrùn tó ṣẹ̀ ń jà kiri.
en: Look at what happened in the country last week due to the disease that is raging.

yo: Àwọn olùgbé rawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀ sí ìjoba lẹ́yìn tí ìjì ṣí òrùlé mọ́ wọn lórí
en: Residents appeal to the government after the storm blew their roofs off

yo: Àwòrán nípa àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ẹ̀ṣọ́ etí òkún ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jáde ní orí i ayélujára.
en: A picture of the stone guard has just surfaced on the internet.

yo: Ààrẹ wa Adébáyọ̀ ti kọ̀wé fipò sílẹ̀ nítoríi rògbòdìyàn tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀.
en: Our president Adébayo has resigned because of the ongoing conflict.

yo: Ṣé o wá lè jókòó láì farapa ní ààyè yẹn?
en: Can you sit there without getting hurt?

yo: Èmi kọ́ ni mo ni àwọn oúnjẹ́ tí mo rà, ẹ̀gbọ́n mi ló ni iṣu náà.
en: I don't have the food I bought, my brother has the yams.

yo: Iṣé kan náà ni Táíwò àti Kẹ́hìndé ń ṣe ṣùgbọ́n ìkán lówó ju ìkan lọ
en: Taiwo and Kehinde are doing the same work but the money is more than the money.

yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ ní Adélékè kò lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti díje dupò fún adarí ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń jàá sí.
en: The court in Adeleke does not have the right to compete against the director of the business.

yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ ìṣèdájọ́ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí nìkan ló lè yọ Adájọ́ Amòfin nípò.
en: Only the National Judicial Council can remove the Judge.

yo: Àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyẹ́n mà láyà gan tí wọ́n fi le pa ejò
en: Those children were so brave that they could kill the snake

yo: Ṣé bẹ́ẹ̀ ló ṣe ma máa ṣí sókè ní gbogbo ìgbà.
en: Is that how he always opens up?

yo: Àwọn ọba aládé kọ̀ọ̀kan ti ní kí Olúbàdàn yé fẹnu yẹpẹrẹ adé e wọn.
en: Each of the kings and queens have asked that the Olubadan kiss their crowns.

yo: Mákindé ti kéde pé Bísí Àjàká wà lára àwọn ọmọ ìgbìmọ̀ tí òún ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ yàn.
en: Makinde has announced that Bisi Ajaka is among the members of the committee he has just appointed.

yo: Aláṣẹ ilé ìwé gíga ní ìlú Ìbàdàn ní kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lọ fún ìsinmi díẹ̀
en: The head of the university in Ibadan asked the students to go for a short break.

yo: Ẹ bá mi gbé àwọn ìgo epo pupa tó wà ní ìtòsíi yín.
en: Take with me the bottles of red oil that are near you.

yo: Àwọn agbébọn gbé owó sálọ lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n pa akápò ẹgbẹ́ onígaàrí
en: The gunmen ran away with money after killing the bag of the group

yo: Mi ò ní le bọ́lẹ̀ mọ́ nítorí mi ò tíì dé ibùsọ̀ mi rárá.
en: I will not be able to bow down because I have not reached my station at all.

yo: Ṣé adájọ́ àgbà yìí tí wọ́n ní kó wà ní àtìmọ́lé ti kọ̀wé fiṣẹ́ sílẹ̀?
en: Has this chief judge who was asked to be in custody resigned?

yo: Adájọ́ pàṣẹ pé kí wọ́n fi ọlọ́pàá tó lọ́wọ́ nínú ikú u Kọ́ládé sí àhámọ́.
en: The judge ordered that the policeman who was involved in the death of Kolade be put in custody.

yo: Ọlọ́pàá ní àwọn ti mú afurasí kan tó mọ̀ nípa ikú u Bísọ́lá
en: The police said they have arrested a suspect who knows about Bisola's death

yo: Ìwádìí àyẹ̀wò nìkan ló le è sọ ohùn tó pa olùkọ́ tó kú ní ilé náà
en: Only an autopsy can reveal the voice that killed the teacher who died in the building

yo: Olóògbé ṣàdédé ṣubú tí àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀ sì dùú títí tó fi dé ilé ìwòsàn
en: The deceased suddenly collapsed and his children were sad until he reached the hospital

yo: Ìdájọ́ tí wọ́n fún Adémọ́lá kò túmọ̀ sí pé ó kúnjú òṣùwọ̀n láti daríi wa.
en: The judgment given to Ademola does not mean that he is qualified to lead us.

yo: Ó yẹ kí á ro ọ̀rọ̀ yí dáadáa nítorí kòì tíì bẹ̀rẹ̀, ìlú ti ń dàrú.
en: We should think this matter carefully because it has not yet started, the city is getting confused.

yo: Àìlenáwó lé ọmọ lórí ma ń ba nǹkan jẹ́ gidi ni.
en: Childlessness is really ruining things.

yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n ní àwọn òbí ayé òde òní kò ṣiṣẹ́ ẹ wọn bí iṣẹ́ lórí ọmọ
en: Professor, the parents of today's world do not work for them as work for their children

yo: Kò sí èyí tí ò ṣe pàtàkì nínú ọmọ, yálà obìnrin tàbí ọkùnrin.
en: There is nothing that is not important in a child, whether female or male.

yo: Iná sọ ní ìdíkọ̀ òfurufú látàrí àìbìkítà àwọn tó ń tún ọkọ̀ ṣe.
en: The fire was caused by the negligence of the people repairing the vehicle.

yo: Àwọn adigunjalè pa èèyàn púpọ̀ ní ilé ìfowópamọ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Oǹdó.
en: Robbers killed many people in a bank in Ondo state.

yo: Adélabú ní èró pọ̀ ní ojú irin Ìyànà ìpájà sí Òyìngbò nítoríi ọ̀wọ́n epo.
en: Adélabu has a lot of thoughts on the Iyanna train to attack Oyingboo because of the oil price.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn ń lọ ọ́ gba ojú irin dípò ojú u pópó nítorí ìjàm̀bá ìjínigbé
en: People are taking the train instead of the street because of the kidnapping accident

yo: Ǹjẹ́ okùn tí ẹ fi so àwọn ẹrù mí ká àwọn ẹrù náà dáadáa?
en: Are the ropes that you used to tie my goods to the goods good?

yo: Aláàfin Ọ̀rọ̀ǹpọ̀tọ̀niyùn jẹ́ obìnrin jagun jagun orí ẹṣin tí kò ṣeé fi ṣeré.
en: The Queen of Words is a woman who fights on a horse that cannot be played.

yo: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú yóò dìbò abẹ́lé lóṣù tó ń bọ̀ kí a tó dibò gbogbogbò.
en: Political parties will hold local elections next month before the general election.

yo: A máa jókòó dáada tí èró bá ti pé nínú ilé.
en: We will sit comfortably if there is enough thought in the house.

yo: Arákùnrin yẹ́n fẹ́ ṣẹ́ owó ọwọ́ ẹ̀ ló fi ń rìn kiri.
en: That brother wanted to break his hand and he was wandering around.

yo: Oníṣègún yọ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọyún tó ń gbé nínú un ẹyinjú àti etí arábìnrin kan.
en: The doctor removed many fetuses living in her ovaries and a sister's ears.

yo: Wọ́n ṣì ń wá àwọn ọmọ tí àgbàrá òjó wọ́ lọ ní Kétu ní Èkó.
en: They are still looking for the children who went missing in Ketu in Lagos.

yo: Ọládẹ̀jọ Òkédìjí, gbajúgbajà òǹkọ̀wé e Yorùbá, papòdà ní ọdún tó kọjá.
en: Oladadej Okediji, a famous Yoruba writer, returned last year.

yo: Olùkọ́ àti àwọn adarí ilée iwé kan takorawọn lóríi ẹ̀sun májèlé náà
en: The teacher and the administrators of a school are at odds with each other over the accusation of poisoning

yo: Ṣé ó yẹ kí wọ́n máa sọ pé ṣé a ò ríran ni?
en: Should they say that we do not see?

yo: Abíọ́lá sọ pé bàbá òún jẹ́ aránṣọ, tí ìyá òún sì jẹ́ ọlọ́jà wóróbo.
en: Abiola said that his father was a weaver and his mother was a yorbo seller.

yo: Ṣé ìfipágbàjọba àwọn ológun kò máa pọ̀ si nílẹ̀ adúláwọ̀?
en: Will the military coup not increase in a democratic country?

yo: Òbí ọmọ tí wọ́n jí gbé ti pariwo síta pé wọn ò rí àwọn ọmọ wọn.
en: The parents of the abducted child have shouted outside that they have not seen their children.

yo: Láíwọlá fagbára han Àdìsá nínú ìfigagbága wọn tó ṣe lọ yìí.
en: Laílá showed strength in Addisá in their previous competition.

yo: Àwọn agbófinró ń wá ọlọ́pàá tó yìnbọn lu àwọn olólùfẹ́ náà
en: Law enforcement officers are looking for the policeman who shot the lovers

yo: Àwọn ará àdúgbò rí orí àti ara àwọn ọkùnrin kan ní àdúgbò o wọn.
en: The local people found the head and body of some men in the locality and weighed it.

yo: Àwọn èèyàn díẹ̀ pàdánù ẹ̀míi wọn nínú ìjàm̀bá tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní alé àná.
en: A few people lost their lives in the accident that happened last night.

yo: Olùdíje kò nílò ìwé ẹ̀rí pé ó kàwé fún ipò ààrẹ tàbí ipò mìíràn.
en: A candidate does not need a certificate that he has studied for the position of president or any other position.

yo: Èyí ni àwọn ìlànà tí o lè fi gbowó lọ́wọ́ ẹni pẹ̀lú ọpọlọ
en: These are the principles that you can use to make money with your brain

yo: Ojoojúmọ́ ni mò ń gbé àwòrán an bàbá tó pọnmọ sẹ́yìn sójú u pópó.
en: Every day I bring the picture of my dear father back to him.

yo: Jẹ́jẹ́ fi òjò àti àrá ńlá ṣàmì ìpapòda rẹ̀ ní ìlú Ọ̀sun
en: Let rain and thunder mark his return in the city of Osun

yo: Tọ́lá sọ̀rọ̀ òdì sí ààrẹ tí ò bìkítà bí àwọn èèyan rẹ̀ ṣe ń gbé.
en: Tola spoke against the president who does not care how his people live.

yo: Ọ̀nà àbáyọ sí èlé owó epo rọ̀bì ni àwọn adaríi wa ń wá.
en: Our leaders are looking for a way out of the oil interest.

yo: Ọba Fálùádé ti gun orí àpèré àwọn baba rẹ̀ ní àná alánàá.
en: King Fáluádé had climbed on top of his ancestors' tomb the day before yesterday.

yo: Àwọn olùkọ́ àti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilée ìwé gíga ń sisẹ́ fún àwọn olóṣèlú
en: College teachers and students work for politicians

yo: Irú èyí kò le ṣẹlẹ̀ mọ́ nítorí ìyá ti jẹ gbogbo èèyàn lápọ̀jù.
en: This kind of thing can't happen anymore because the mother has eaten everyone too much.

yo: Èyí ni bí wọ́n ṣe ń lo ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ láti ṣekú pa àwọn oníjàgídíjàgan.
en: This is how they use social media to kill terrorists.

yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí nígbà kan rí kú nípasẹ̀ obìnrin.
en: The president of this country was once killed by a woman.

yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba ti ń kọ́ àwọn èèyàn bí wọ́n ṣe le dìbò
en: Government officials are teaching people how to vote

yo: Abiyamọ kan ní oníṣègùn kò lè sọ bóyá akọ ni ọmọ òun tàbí abo.
en: A mother has a doctor who cannot tell whether her child is a boy or a girl.

yo: Ṣúnkẹrẹ fàkẹrẹ lójúu pópó gbalẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ìjàm̀bá ọkọ̀ epo ní ìlú Ìbàdàn.
en: The road is slowly falling after the oil tanker accident in the city of Ibadan.

yo: Ó kù díẹ̀ tí arákùnrin yẹn ò bá kú, ọlọ́run ló kó o yọ.
en: If that brother does not die, God bless you.

yo: Ààrẹ ti fọwọ́sí pé kí wọ́n bùnkún owó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba.
en: The president has agreed to increase the salaries of government employees.

yo: Èyí kò wá túnmọ̀ sí pé owó náà yóò tán gbogbo ìṣòro tí èèyán ní.
en: This does not mean that the money will solve all the problems that people have.

yo: Ògiri ilé ìjọsin kan ní Agbo Ọba wó pa àwọn olùjọ́sìn kan
en: The wall of a church in Agbo Oma collapsed killing some worshippers

yo: Mímọ̀ pé àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè ń lọ ṣe dáada níta ń mú orí wú
en: Knowing that the children of the country are doing well outside is exciting

yo: Ẹ má bèrè nǹkankan lọ́wọ́ mi, ẹ bi ìyàwó o yín.
en: Do not ask anything from me, ask your wife.

yo: Ẹ bá mi ra àgbàdo, kí n lè rí ṣe ògì fún oṣù tó ń bọ̀.
en: Buy corn with me, so that I can make rice for the next month.

yo: Ọmọ ọba tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ bí ní ààfin olúbàdàn kò lè jẹ ọba láí.
en: The son of a king who was born in a foreigner's palace could never be king.

yo: Aìní èrò tó gún tó fa ìbànújẹ́ ayérayé fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ yẹn.
en: The lack of deep thought caused eternal sorrow for those students.

yo: Ìjọba gbé òṣùbà fún àtìlẹ́yìn aráàlú lásìkò yìí
en: The government raised the moon for public support at this time

yo: Oríléèdè púpọ̀ ló pàdánù àwọn èèyan wọn nínú un hílàhílo tó ṣẹlẹ̀.
en: Many countries lost their people in the crisis that happened.

yo: Ìlú Èkó ló ti lọ sí òde àríyá ní Òguǹ níbi tí wọ́n ti yìnbọn fun.
en: It was from Lagos that he went to a party in Ogun where he was shot.

yo: Ọwọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá tẹ àwọn ajínigbé kan ní ìyànà abúlé Onígbàálẹ̀.
en: The police arrested some kidnappers at the gate of Onigabaale village.

yo: Olùdarí ibùdó náà ní wọ́n ń fi àwòrán yíyà sín àwọn olùtọ́júu wọn jẹ
en: The director of the camp said they were feeding their guardians with painted pictures

yo: Ẹ wá rí iṣẹ́ àti ore Ọlọ́run nínú ayé mi àti àwọn ẹbí mi.
en: Come and see God's work and friendship in my life and my families.

yo: Ayọ̀mídé máa ń ka ọ̀rọ̀ kún gan nítorí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ ní ìgboyà.
en: Ayomide used to read a lot because he didn't have much courage.

yo: Ó kọ́ ìwà burúkú yìí láti ọwọ́ ọ bàbá a rẹ̀, kò sì mọ̀ ọ́ láìda.
en: He learned this bad behavior from his father, and he didn't know it.

yo: Mi ò mọ̀ bóyá ẹ máa fẹ́ mi tàbí ẹ̀ ń mú mi ṣeré.
en: I don't know if you will marry me or if you are playing with me.

yo: Ìwé tí mo ní kí o kà lọ́jọ́sí, wọ́n ti ṣe é sínu un fọ́nrán.
en: The book that I asked you to read today, they have made it into a book.

yo: Abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára àkọ́kọ́ tó ń dènà ibà yóò dì mímúlò ní ilẹ̀ yí.
en: The first vaccine against malaria will become effective in this country.

yo: Olórin tó ń fi ipá bá àwọn ọmọdé lòpọ̀ ti wà ní àhámọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá
en: A musician who sexually assaults children is in police custody

yo: Àwọn tó ń bèèrè fún àtúntò ń jà fún ikùn ara wọn ni nítorí wọn ò lóòótọ́.
en: Those who are asking for restructuring are fighting for their own belly because they are not really.

yo: Gbogbo ohun tí a ní tẹ́lẹ̀ ni mo fẹ́ kí á gbà padà lọ́wọ́ ọ wọn.
en: I want everything we had before to be taken back from you.

yo: A kú ọdún tuntun o, Olúwa á túbọ̀ máa bùnkún un wa o.
en: Happy new year, may the Lord continue to bless us.

yo: À ń wá Dèjì Adénúgà tó dáná sun àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbé ilé e bàbá a rẹ̀.
en: We are looking for Deji Adénuga who burned the people living in his father's house.

yo: Yẹmí lè lo odindi ọjọ́ kan láti máa bá èèyàn sọ̀rọ̀ lóríi ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀
en: You can spend an entire day talking to someone on the phone.

yo: Mo fẹ́ dábàá pé kí a dáwó fún Táíwò tí bàbá a rẹ̀ ṣẹ̀sẹ̀ kú.
en: I want to suggest that we pray for Taiwo whose father died recently.

yo: Àhámọ́ làwọn afurasí náà yóò wà di ìgbà tí wọn yóò fojú ba ilé ẹjọ́.
en: The suspects will remain in custody until they face the court.

yo: Gbígba àwẹ̀ fún àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn ìmọ̀lé jẹ́ ohun tó pàtàkì gan ni.
en: Fasting for enlightened believers is very important.

yo: Àwọn òyìnbó aláwọ̀ funfun ṣì tún ń bọ̀ wá kó wa lẹ́rú lẹ́ẹ̀kan síi.
en: The white men are still coming to enslave us once again.

yo: Ojoojúmọ́ ni àwọn òyìnbó ń pọ̀ si ní orílẹ̀ èdè yí.
en: Every day the number of people in this country is increasing.

yo: Kí gan làwọn nǹkan tó ń fa àìsan ibà ní àgọ̀ ara?
en: What are the things that cause fever in the body?

yo: Ọ̀gá àgbá dín wákàtí iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá kù nítoríi wàhálà tó lọ ní ìgboro.
en: The police chief reduced the hours of police work because of the trouble in the street.

yo: Ó ní ọwọ́ àwọn ológun ló le è ká rògbòdìnyàn tó lọ lọ́wọ́.
en: It was the hands of the military that led to the ongoing conflict.

yo: Gbogbo ẹni tó bá ń wá ìdùnnú àti ìlọsíwájú fún ẹni ló yẹ ká fà mọ́ra.
en: Everyone who is looking for happiness and progress should be loved.

yo: Èyí ni bí àwọn agbébọn ṣe gbé òṣìṣẹ́ ilé iṣẹ́ kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn
en: This is how gunmen killed a factory worker in Ogun state

yo: Oníṣòwò kán wọ wàhálà lóríi títa àwọn ọjà tí wọ́n ń wá ní Abẹ́òkuta.
en: The merchant is having trouble selling the products they are looking for in Abeokuta.

yo: Inú mi kàn máa ń dùn tí mo bá rántíi bàbá tó bí mi.
en: I only feel happy when I remember the father who gave birth to me.

yo: Dèjì Adénúgà ti padà sọ ìdí tí òún fí jó àwọn èèyàn mọ́lé.
en: Deji Adénuga has returned to say why he burned people.

yo: Àdùnní Adébáyọ̀ wà ní àhámọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá fún ẹ̀sùn tí ò mọ̀ nípa.
en: Adunni Adébayo is in police custody for an unknown charge.

yo: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá ni àwọn ọlọ́pàá mú arábìnrin yìí ní àdúgbò kan ní Orílé.
en: Last week the police arrested this sister in a community in Orile.

yo: Ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn án ni pé ó máa ń jí ọmọ gbé tà.
en: The accusation against him is that he used to steal children.

yo: Àwọn ará àdúgbò náà jẹ́rìí sí i pé pàjáwìrì ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà jẹ́.
en: The local people testified that the incident was an emergency.

yo: Kí ló dé tí ọ̀rọ̀ Ìyálọ́jà àti Bàbálọ́jà ń fa awuyewuye?
en: Why is the word Salvation and Salvation causing controversy?

yo: Wọ́n ní nínà ní àwọn ọlọ́pàá yìí fi lé obìnrin náà wọ inú ọkọ̀ ọ wọn.
en: They said that the police forced the woman into their car.

yo: Ṣé àlàfo tó wà láàárín àwọn olówó àti tálákà ń fẹ̀ sii ni?
en: Is the gap between the rich and the poor widening?

yo: Ọ̀rọ arábìnrin yìí kan nítorí àwọn ẹbí àti ará ti ń polongo pé ó sọnù.
en: This sister's words are relevant because the family and brothers are announcing that she is missing.

yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ní tí èèyàn kò bá tíì ṣe iṣé kan, kò yẹ kó gba owóo rẹ̀.
en: The Lagos state government says that if a person has not done any work, he should not receive his money.

yo: Àlàó Akálà ti padà sí ibiṣẹ́ ẹ rẹ̀ tó fi sílẹ̀ nítorí ẹ̀sùn ìkówójẹ.
en: Alao Akala has returned to his job which he left because of allegations of corruption.

yo: Agbẹjórò arákùnrin Adébóyè ti gbàá ní ìmọ̀ràn pé kó sọ òótọ́.
en: Adéboye's lawyer advised him to tell the truth.

yo: Àwọn èèyán pàdánù ẹ̀míi wọn nínú ìjàm̀bá ọkọ̀ akérò tó ya wọ ọjà
en: People lost their lives in the accident of the bus that entered the market

yo: Àjọ tó ń rísí ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ní àìsí àbò ń ṣàkóbá fún àwọn olùkọ́ ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: Organizations that see the education system as insecure are harming teachers in this country.

yo: À ń ṣe ìwádìí lórí àwọn obìnrin tí wọ́n ń wọ aṣọ tó ń ṣára sílẹ̀.
en: We are doing research on women who wear revealing clothes.

yo: Àwọn ẹlésìn ìgbàgbọ́ ti kéde ọjọ́ ọdún-un wọn tí á wáyé lẹ́yìn àwẹ ẹ wọn.
en: The religious people have announced the day of their anniversary that will be held after their fast.

yo: Àwọn olórin ní ilẹ̀ yí ti ń fi orin wọn sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú ìlú.
en: Musicians in this country have been using their music to talk about what is happening in the city.

yo: Ní àwùjọ wa, Ìjọba ayé òde òní ò lè pa àwọn oníròyìn.
en: In our society, the Government of today's world cannot kill journalists.

yo: Àwọn olórin ní òmìnira láti fi ohunkóhun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú àwùjọ kọ orin.
en: Musicians have the freedom to write music based on whatever is happening in the community.

yo: Àwọn adarí Ilé ìwé gíga tó wá láti Òṣogbo ní wọ́n jí olùkọ́ kan gbé
en: A teacher was kidnapped by the leaders of the University who came from Osogbo

yo: Wọ́n lè kọrin nípa àwọn ohun gidi nínú ìlú àti àwọn èyí tí ò da.
en: They can sing about the real things in the city and the things that are not.

yo: Ìjìyá ti wà fún ilé ìfowópamọ́ tó bá ṣì ní àyájọ́ọ ọjọ́ọ òmìnira.
en: There is a punishment for the bank that still has the independence day.

yo: Àwọn olórin a tún máa korin bú àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́.
en: The musicians will also sing the praises of the celebrities.

yo: Iṣẹ́ àwọn olórin ju búbú, kíkí tàbí yin èèyàn lọ.
en: The work of musicians is more than cursing, greeting or praising people.

yo: Púpọ̀ àwọn ìmọ̀le kìí bẹ̀rẹ̀ àwẹ̀ títí dìgbà tí wọ́n bá fojú rí oṣù.
en: Most people do not start fasting until they see the moon.

yo: Àwọn olórin a tún máa fi orin wọn kọ́ni lọ́gbọ́n.
en: Musicians will also teach their music wisely.

yo: Àwọn olórin tún máa ń mọ ìtàn nípa èèyàn, ìdílé àti ìlú lápapọ̀.
en: Musicians also know the history of people, families and cities in general.

yo: Ìdí ni pé ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà, àwọn nǹkan wọ̀nyí máa ń ṣojúu wọn.
en: Because in many cases, these things represent them.

yo: Wọ́n sì tún máa ń fimú fínlẹ̀ nípa gbogbo nǹkan.
en: And they also film about everything.

yo: Òótọ́ sì ni wọ́n máa ń sọ ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà, wọ́n kàn le fẹ ọ̀rọ̀ lójú ni.
en: And it's true what they say many times, they just want words in the face.

yo: Wọ́n tún máa ń fi orin ráńṣẹ́ ìkìlọ̀ sí àwọn èèyàn, bẹ́ẹ̀ wọ́n ń fi í pàrokò.
en: They also send warning music to people, so they use it as a secret.

yo: Ó máa sàn kí ẹ sọ nǹkan tí ẹ fẹ́ gangan yàtọ̀ sí ṣebí sọ̀hún tí ẹ̀ ń ṣe
en: It would be better if you say what you really want instead of what you are doing

yo: Bí o ṣe ń lo ìfẹ́ tí mo ní sí ẹ yìí láti ṣe ohun tó wù ọ́ kò tọ́ rárá.
en: How you use the love I have for you to do what you want is not right at all.

yo: Mo kàn ń wò ọ́ pẹ̀lú gbogbo ìranù tí ò ń ṣe láti àárọ̀ ni.
en: I'm just looking at you with all the crazy you've been doing since morning.

yo: Bí a ṣe jókòó kalẹ̀ láti àárọ̀ nìyí tí a ò ṣe nǹkankan.
en: How we sat down since morning and did nothing.

yo: Abíọ́dún kìí jẹ tàbí fi ojú rí àlùbọ́sà rárá nínú un óuńjẹ.
en: The birthday boy never eats or sees onions in his food.

yo: Alàgbà tó ń darí ilé ìjọsìn ńlá tó wà ní Ìpájà fẹ́ ìyàwó tuntun ní àná.
en: The elder who leads the big house of worship in Ipaja married a new wife yesterday.

yo: Inú ìwé ìròyìn aláròyé ni mo ti rí i kà ni àárọ̀ yí
en: I have seen it read in the newspaper newspaper this morning

yo: Ìyàwó o rẹ̀ tó kọ́kọ́ fẹ́ ní àárọ̀ ọjọ́ ọ rẹ̀ kú nígbà tí ó fẹ́ bí àwọn ìbejìi rẹ̀.
en: His first wife died in the morning when he was about to give birth to his twins.

yo: Irun àdìmẹ́yìn tí Adéọlá ṣe sórí rẹwà gidi gan ni
en: The last hairstyle that Adéola made on her head is really beautiful

yo: Mi ò wá síbí láti wá dájọ́ ẹnì kankan, nítorí kò sí ẹni tó dáa tán.
en: I did not come here to judge anyone, because no one is perfect.

yo: Àwùjọ wá gbà pé ìjẹ́ obìnrin ò ju kí a máa wọsọ, kunjú àti jáde lọ.
en: Society has come to believe that being a woman is more than just talking, dancing and going out.

yo: Agbára tí àwọn obìnrin ní tí wọ́n fi ń jẹ́ obìnrín wà nínú un wọn
en: The strength that women have by being women is in them

yo: Ẹ̀ṣọ́ lásán ni gbogbo èyí, ọ̀nà à ti túnbọ̀ gbé ẹwà jáde ni wọ́n jẹ́.
en: All this is just a decoration, they are a way of bringing out the beauty.

yo: Èèyàn pàtàkì ni ẹ́ sí mi ṣùgbọ́n a ò lè jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ mọ.
en: You are an important person to me but we can't be friends anymore.

yo: Ó ní irúfẹ́ ọbìnrin tí àwọn ọkùnrín máa ń mú fi ṣaya
en: She has the kind of woman that men are attracted to

yo: Òtítọ́ tó dájú ni èyí, ẹ̀gbọ́n obìnrin tó bá dàgbà jùlọ ló máa ń rẹwà jù.
en: This is a true fact, the older the older sister is the more beautiful.

yo: Bàbá fẹ́ mọ̀ bóyá o ti ní olólùfẹ́ ní ilé ìwé nítorí o ò mú ọkọ wálé rí.
en: Dad wanted to know if you had a boyfriend at school because you never brought home a husband.

yo: Ó sàn kí á ro nǹkan kúnná dáadáa ju kí á gbìnyànjú àti gbàgbé ẹ̀.
en: It is better to think about something carefully than to try and forget it.

yo: Wọn ò ní fé ṣe ohun tí yóò mú wọn pàdánù u bàbá mi.
en: They will not do what will make them lose my father.

yo: Ayọ̀ máa ń wùwà bí àgbàrá omi, tó bá ṣàn lọ, ó máa ń ṣàn padà.
en: Happiness is like water, when it flows, it flows back.

yo: Nígbà tí omijé bá ń bọ́ ní ojú ẹ, rántí pé Ọlọ́run ò kúrò ní àyè e rẹ̀.
en: When tears are coming from your eyes, remember that God does not leave his place.

yo: Bí wọ́n bá mọ̀ bí ìfẹ́ẹ wá ṣe rinlẹ̀ tó ni, wọ́n á máa jowúu wa ni.
en: If they know how strong our love is, they will be jealous of us.

yo: Má kàn máa sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ohun tí o fẹ́ ṣe tàbí ohun tí o fẹ́ dì lọ́la.
en: Don't just talk about what you want to do or what you want to do tomorrow.

yo: Má fẹnu tẹ́ḿbẹ́lú èèyàn kan fún ohun tí wọ́n ṣe tàbí wọn kò ṣe.
en: Don't criticize someone for what they did or didn't do.

yo: Gbìnyànjú láti ṣe gbogbo nǹkan tí ìwọ bá fẹ́ ṣe, kí o sì ṣe é ní àsìkò.
en: Try to do everything you want to do, and do it on time.

yo: Fi ojú sí ohunkóhun tí o bá fẹ́ ṣe, má ṣe jẹ́ kí ẹnikẹ́ni ṣì ọ́ lọ́nà.
en: Focus on whatever you want to do, don't let anyone lead you astray.

yo: Ìforítì yìí yóò fún èèyàn lágbára láti ṣe àṣeyọrí.
en: This perseverance will give a person the strength to succeed.

yo: Ọ̀pọ obìnrin ni wọn ò kí ń ronú pẹ̀lú orí pípé tó bá ti di ọ̀rọ̀ ọ ọkùnrin.
en: Many women are not able to think clearly when it comes to a man's words.

yo: Nígbà mìíràn tí àwọn èèyàn tí o bá nífẹ̀ẹ́ bá pa ọ́ lára, má sọ nǹkankan.
en: Sometimes when people you love hurt you, don't say anything.

yo: Ìdí ni pé, tí ìfẹ́ ò bá tó wọn, kò sí ọ̀rọ̀ kankan tó o lè sọ tó lè yé wọn.
en: Because, if love is not enough for them, no words you can say will make them understand.

yo: Ẹ ṣé ṣùgbọ́n mi ò fẹ́ jó, mi ò sì fẹ́ kí ẹ máa fọwọ́ jẹ mí lára.
en: Do it, but I don't want to dance, and I don't want you to hurt me.

yo: Tí mo bá ń wá ọkùnrin tí mo máa fẹ́, màá rí
en: If I am looking for a man to marry, I will find it

yo: Ààrẹ kan ní ẹni tó bá fẹ́ ipò nínú ìjọba gbọ́dọ̀ yan ẹranko kan láàyò.
en: A president has a person who wants a position in the government must choose an animal.

yo: Bí o bá jẹ́ ẹni tó ní àdáníkànjẹ, rántí pé kò sí nǹkan tí kìí tán.
en: If you are lonely, remember that nothing is finished.

yo: Àwọn nǹkan tí yóò tẹ̀yin kíkógbá wọlé àwọn iléeṣẹ́ aládàáni ò ní dáa rárá.
en: The things that will follow the entry into private companies will not be good at all.

yo: Bí o bá fún obìnrin gidi nífẹ̀ẹ́, o ó gba wúrà lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀.
en: If you give love to a real woman, you will receive gold from her.

yo: Ilé alájà mẹ́ta wó lulẹ̀ ní ìsàlẹ̀ Èkó, ènìyàn kán sì kú níbẹ̀
en: A three-storey building collapsed in the lower part of Lagos, and one person died there

yo: Mo lérò pé ẹ̀ ń tẹ́tí sí gbogbo nǹkan tí mò ń sọ láti ẹ̀ẹ̀kan.
en: I think you are listening to everything I am saying from the beginning.

yo: Ọwọ́ tẹ ọkùnrin tó ń fi òògùn burúkú ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn àìsan jẹjẹrẹ
en: The hand of the man who uses bad medicine to treat cancer patients

yo: Ìgbà wo lo lérò pé wàá padà lọ sí Èkó torí mo fẹ́ rán ẹ ní nǹkan
en: When do you think you will go back to Lagos because I want to send you something

yo: Mi ò lè sọ báyìí nítorí ètò mi ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ gùn mọ́, àti pé kò sówó.
en: I can't say now because my plan is not that long anymore, and it's not cheap.

yo: Ó yẹ kí n lè padà lọ sí Èkó ní oṣù tó ń bọ̀ nítorí a ní ìnáwó níbẹ̀.
en: I should be able to go back to Lagos next month because we have money there.

yo: Èkó ni mo ti kọ́kọ́ rí ibi tí ọmọkùnrin ti ń lu imú àti etí.
en: It was at school that I first saw a boy's nose and ears.

yo: Ẹ wo àwọn bàbá ìsàlẹ̀ tí wọ́n bá ìtìjú bọ̀ nínú ìbò tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́.
en: Look at the fathers below who came out with shame in the ongoing election.

yo: Ìwọ nìkan ni mo ṣọ fún yàtọ̀ sí Súnkànmí tí ó pè mí lánàá.
en: You are the only one I care for apart from Sunkanmi who called me yesterday.

yo: Jọ̀wọ́ bá mi kí ìyá a wa pẹ̀lú ọmọ pupa mi, Oyíndàmọ́lá.
en: Please let my mother come with my red child, Oyindamola.

yo: Mo ṣàwárí nǹkan ní òní, mo sì fé fi hàn ẹ́ nítorí mo fọkàn tán ẹ.
en: I discovered something today, and I want to show you because I trust you.

yo: Mo ti kọ́ nǹkan náà kalẹ̀ fún bí ọdún díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn, ó sì ń bà mí lọ́kàn jẹ́.
en: I've been writing about it for a few years now, and it's hurting me.

yo: Mo ní àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ gidi tí mo fẹ́ràn ṣùgbọ́n tí mi ò lè sọ fún ní kòrókòró.
en: I have real friends that I love but can't tell.

yo: Ohun tó tún wá ń ṣelẹ̀ ni pé mo máa ń bà wọ́n lọ́kàn jẹ́
en: What also happens is that I always hurt them

yo: Mo lè máa rẹ́rìn ín báyìí ṣùgbọ́n kò sí nǹkan tó yé mi mọ́.
en: I can laugh now but I don't understand anything anymore.

yo: Inú máa ń ṣàdédé bí mi lórí nǹkan tí ò tó nǹkan
en: I get angry all of a sudden over little things

yo: Ó ti yẹ kí wọ́n wá àtúnṣe sí àwọn kùdìẹ̀kudiẹ̀ tó wà ní ètò ìlera
en: The deficiencies in the health system should be addressed.

yo: Ẹ dákun, màá bá a yín wá owó náà kí ọjọ́ àyẹyẹ náà tó kò
en: Wait, I will find the money with you before the day of the celebration

yo: Gbogbo ohun tó dà wá pọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọkọ àti ìyàwó ni kí ẹ gbé ìṣirò lé
en: Everything that we have in common as husband and wife should be calculated

yo: Láti àárọ̀ tí a ti dé ibí yìí, mi ò tíì rí ẹnìkan tó wá yọjú sí mi
en: Since the morning we arrived here, I have not seen anyone come to me

yo: Kò sí ibi tí eku ò kí ń gbà wọ inú ilée rẹ̀ tí wọ́n á sì jẹ oúnjẹ tí ó rà sílé
en: There is no place where rats are not allowed to enter your house and eat the food you buy at home.

yo: Ẹní bá rí mi pẹ̀lú àdá nísinsìnyí, wọ́n á rò pé mo lè dá ejò náà pa
en: If anyone saw me with a snake now, they would think I could kill the snake.

yo: Ibi tí mo ti lọ forúkọ sílẹ̀ lénìí, àwọn èèyàn tí wọ́n tò sí orí ìlà kàn ń ti ara wọn
en: Where I went to register today, the people in the queue were pushing each other.

yo: Mi ò padà rí ohun tó gbé mi lọ síbẹ̀ láti àárọ̀ ṣe, mo kàn lọ fi àkókò ṣòfò ni
en: I did not return to see what took me there from the morning, I just wasted time

yo: Kí nìdí tó o fí ń fi ìyà ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tí àwọn ọmọ mi ò mọ̀ sí jẹ wọ́n?
en: Why are you punishing my children for a sin they don't know?

yo: Òjò tí ó rọ̀ lénìí pa mí dé ọjà, ó tún pa mí délé ni bí ó ṣe ṣẹ lánàá
en: This rain kept me from going to the market, it also kept me at home as it happened yesterday

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni àwọn aláboyún mìíràn ma ń kanra
en: It is true that other pregnant women are worried

yo: Ìwọ tí o ò tíì rí ìyàwó kan tọ́jú lọ tún fẹ́ fẹ́ ìyàwó tuntun
en: You who haven't found a wife, take care and want to marry a new wife

yo: Kò yẹ kí ìyà máa jẹ ẹni tí ó bá mọ iṣẹ́ ẹ̀ níṣẹ́ rárá
en: A person who knows his job should not be punished at all

yo: Ọkàn mí wà ní oko mi nítorí òjò tí ó rọ̀ dáada lásìkó yìí
en: My heart is in my farm because of the good rain this season

yo: Nítorí owó láti tọ́jú àwọn ọmọ wa lọ́la ló ṣe yẹ kí á yára sí iṣẹ́ ní àárọ̀ ọjọ́
en: Because of the money to take care of our children tomorrow why should we rush to work in the morning

yo: Kò sí ènìyàn tí kò ní ìṣòro tiẹ̀, aṣọ ni gbogbo wá fí ń bò ó
en: There is no person who does not have his own problems, clothes are all used to cover him

yo: Ta ni ò mọ̀ pé olúkúlùkù ló yẹ kí ó gbọ́ bùkátà ara ẹ̀
en: Who doesn't know that everyone should take care of themselves

yo: Kò mọ̀ pé ìwọ̀ntunwọ̀nsì ni èèyàn máa ń fi nǹkan kẹ́ ọmọ
en: He doesn't know that people judge children with balance

yo: Mi ò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ọkùnrin tí ó bá ń tọ ẹjọ́ jù nítorí irú u wọn á máa da ilé rù
en: I don't like a man who is too litigious because like him they will destroy the house

yo: Púpọ̀ lára àwọn tí wọ́n ń kọ ọkọ sílẹ̀ láyé òde òní kò ní ìtẹ́lọ́rùn rárá
en: Most divorcees today are not satisfied at all.

yo: Kò sí ìtọ́jú tí wọ́n fẹ́ fún ọmọ tí ó máa dà bíi ti òbí ẹ̀ fún un
en: There is no care they want for a child who will be like his parents for him

yo: Ọkàn mí fò ó láti sọ fún un yín pé ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀ ni mo máa ṣe ìgbéyàwó mi
en: My heart skips a beat to tell you that I will be getting married next week

yo: Ohun kan tí ó yẹ kí gbogbo wá mọ̀ ni pé ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ kìí ṣe oníṣẹ́
en: One thing that we all should know is that the beginning is not professional

yo: Ìyá tí ó jìyà jìṣẹ́ lórí ọmọ ò tún gbọdọ̀ jìyà a pé kó jẹun ọmọ
en: A mother who is punished for giving birth to her child should not be punished for feeding the child

yo: Ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ ni ó ń tí àwọn òde òní lọ ṣe aṣẹ́wó àbí kí wọ́n lọ ṣe ògun owó
en: It is lust that drives people today to become prostitutes or to make money.

yo: Níbi tí àwọn mìíràn ti ń sọ pé kò sí owó ni àwọn mìíràn ti ń kọ́ ilẹ́ mọ́lé
en: Where others are saying that there is no money, others are building land

yo: Ohun tí ó ká mi lára nínú ọ̀rọ̀ yìí ni pé kò sí ẹni tí ó mọ irú ìwà tí ó lè hù
en: What strikes me in this matter is that no one knows what kind of behavior he may commit

yo: Ọmọ òrukàn ni Abọ́sẹ̀dé ṣùgbọ́n ọkọ ẹ̀ ń ṣìṣe bàbá àti ìyá fún-un
en: Abode is an orphan, but her husband acts as a father and mother for her

yo: Tí mo bá lè ríbi lọ sílé, inú àwọn òbí àti àbúrò mí máa dùn gan
en: If I can go home, my parents and younger brother will be very happy

yo: Ó parọ́ fún mi pé ó ti ra aṣọ tuntun tí mo máa wọ̀ lọ sí ibi ayẹyẹ náà
en: He lied to me that he had bought a new dress for me to wear to the party

yo: Kí ilẹ̀ tó ṣú ni mo ti máa ń ti ìlẹ̀kùn ilé mi nítorí i àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ń lọ báyìí
en: I used to close the door of my house before it got dark because of the events that are going on now

yo: Ẹ kàn ń sọ pé kí ń máa forítìí ni, ẹ ò mọ ohun tí mò ń fara dà
en: You are just telling me to be patient, you don't know what I am going through

yo: Àwọn ará ibí yìí lè fara da ebi láti kó owó jọ fi ra aṣọ
en: The people of this place can endure hunger to save money to buy clothes

yo: Má rò pé torí èní ò da, bí á ṣe máa rí lọ fún ẹ nìyẹn
en: Don't think that because it's not good, that's how it will be for you

yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí obìnrin tí ó fẹ́ pẹ́ nílé ọkọ, ó gbọ́dọ̀ ní ìfaradà, ìtẹríba àti ìtẹlọ́rùn
en: As a wife who wants to stay at home with her husband, she must be patient, submissive and content.

yo: Nítorí nǹkan burúkú tí ó fẹ́ ṣe ni ó ṣe rọ ìyàwó ẹ̀ ní ọtí yó lálẹ́ àná
en: Because of the bad thing he wanted to do, he got his wife drunk last night

yo: Èló ni mò ń gbà lóṣooṣù tí ẹ fi rò pé mo máa rí adúrú owó yẹn ná
en: I earn so much every month that you think I will see that amount of money

yo: Ọmọ baba ni mí nípa ìgbàgbọ́ tí mo ní nínú Olúwa tó dá ọ̀run àti ayé
en: I am a father's son because of the faith I have in the Lord who created heaven and earth

yo: Aṣọ tí mo fẹ́ fọ̀ lénìí ni ó máa gba àkókò mi nítorí ó pọ̀ díẹ̀
en: The clothes I want to wash now will take my time because they are a little big

yo: Olóòótọ́ mélòó gan an ni a máa rí mú lóde ayé lónìí?
en: How many honest people will we find in the world today?

yo: Ìwà ẹ ò da o sì ń fi ojoojúmọ́ lọ sí gbogbo ìsìn tí wọ́n ń ṣe nílé ìjọsìn
en: Your behavior is good and you go every day to all the religious services that are held in the house of worship

yo: Iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ wùn mí kọ́ àmọ́ iṣẹ́ onídìrí ni mo máa kọ́
en: I don't like handicrafts, but I will learn to be a craftsman

yo: Mo ro àròjinlẹ̀ lórí ìgbésí ayé mi, mo ríi pé mo ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìrìn àjò mi ni
en: I thought about my life, I realized that I had just begun my journey

yo: Àwọn aṣèwádìí náà gbọ́dọ̀ ríi pé wọ́n ṣe ìwádìí i wọn fínnífínní
en: The researchers must ensure that they are thoroughly researched

yo: Lẹ́yìn tí bàbá àti ìyá bá kọ́ ọmọ gan, ó yẹ kí ọmọ náà tún ara rẹ̀ kọ́
en: After the father and mother have taught the child, the child should teach himself

yo: Ìfẹ́ tí ọkọ mi fi hàn sí mi kò jẹ́ kí n rò pé ó le padà wá kọ̀ ni sílẹ̀
en: The love that my husband showed to me did not make me think that he might come back and divorce him

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ìwòyí ti mú ìbálòpò gẹ́gẹ́ bíi kókó pàtàkì nínú u fífẹ́ ara wọn
en: These young people have taken sex as an important factor in their love for each other.

yo: Kí gan ni a fẹ́ pe Àdùnní, ṣé abiamọ ni a máa pè é ni tàbí abiagba?
en: What do we really want to call Adunni, should we call him a baby or a baby?

yo: Ẹ̀wà ni wọ́n máa fí ń ṣe àkàrà, mọ́ínmọ́ín àti ọbẹ̀ ẹ gbẹ̀gìrì
en: Beauty is used to make cakes, breads and soups.

yo: Tí ẹ bá ka ìwé e Fágúnwà kan, ẹ máa fẹ́ ka àwọn ìwé tó kù tí ó kọ
en: If you read one of Fagunwa's books, you will want to read the rest of his books

yo: Tí a bá pe èèyàn ní Ajíṣefínní, a jẹ́ pé onímọ̀ọ́tótó ni ẹni náà
en: If we call a person Ajizefinni, we mean that the person is honest

yo: Tí a bá wá pe ènìyàn ní Agùntáṣọọ́lò, a jẹ́ pé ẹni náà ga gogoro
en: If we call a person Aguntasholo, we mean that person is tall

yo: Ṣé ẹ ti ka ìwé Àjà ló lẹrù rí, ẹ̀rín máa pa yín dé bi pé inú á máa run yín
en: Have you ever read Aja's book?

yo: Tí a bá ní pé kí a fi owó tayò kí eré náà lé dùn, Ọlọ́run má jẹ kí ó fa ìjà
en: If we have to spend money to make the game fun, God forbid it causes a fight

yo: Yorùbá kú ti sọ pé bá mi na ọmọ mi kò dé inú ọlọ́mọ, jọ̀ọ́ má na ọmọlọ́mọ
en: The dead Yoruba said that my child is not pregnant with me, please don't be pregnant

yo: Orí ìyá mi ló kó mi yọ pé àwọn olè ò wọ ilé mi nígbà tí wọ́n wá jalè nílée wa
en: It was my mother's head that made me happy that thieves did not enter my house when they came to steal from our house

yo: Tí o ò bá mọ wèrè é ya, wà á fi wèrè sílẹ̀ fún àwọn tí ó mọ wèrè é yà
en: If you don't know how to be crazy, we will leave it to those who know how to be crazy

yo: Báwo ni ìyàwó tí a fẹ́ tí ó sì ti bímọ sílé ṣe máa máa rojọ́ kiri bẹ́yẹn?
en: How can a married wife who has given birth at home complain like that?

yo: Gbogbo nǹkan tàbí ìṣòro tí ó bá bá ẹ̀dá láyé yìí ń kọ́ wa ní ẹ̀kọ́ ni
en: Every thing or problem that happens to nature in this world teaches us a lesson

yo: Tí mo bá se oúnjẹ tí mo máa jẹ sí ẹnu mi tán, kìí ń wùn mí jẹ mọ́
en: If I cook the food that I am going to eat in my mouth, I don't want to eat anymore

yo: Mo gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run tètè ṣe owó tí ẹ máa le fi parí ilé e yín
en: I pray that God will soon make money that you can use to finish your house

yo: Bí ó ti wùn kí ó ṣe lè le fún àwọn ènìyàn tó, mo mọ̀ pé kò ní le mọ́ mi
en: No matter how hard it is for people, I know it will not be hard for me

yo: Bí wọ́n ṣe kọ́ mi ni pé a ò gbọdọ̀ fi ojú olóore wa gún gi
en: The way they taught me is that we should not be blindfolded

yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àṣà ìkíni ní àwùjọ Yorùbá, obìnrin máa ń kúnlẹ̀ ẹsẹ̀ kí àgbàlagbà
en: As a greeting in the Yoruba community, women kneel before elders

yo: Mi ò tètè mọ̀ pé mo ti lóyún nítorí mo ṣì ń ṣe nǹkan oṣù títí dí ìwòyí
en: I did not know that I was pregnant because I was still menstruating until the end

yo: Ìgbà ọdún báyìí ni àwọn ẹlẹ́ran àti aládìyẹ ma ń pa owó gidi
en: This is the time of the year when meat and poultry farmers make real money

yo: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ìwòyí kàn ń tètè é ṣe ìgbeyàwó ni láì mọ̀ pé ilé ọkọ ilé ẹ̀kọ́ ni
en: These young people are getting married early without knowing that it is a school bus house.

yo: Àti ẹni tí ó bímọ àti ẹni tí kò bímọ, ọmọ náà ni ó máa sin àwọn méjéèjì
en: And the one who has children and the one who does not have children, the child will serve both of them

yo: Mi ò kàn fẹ́ kí àwọn ọmọ mi máa ra oúnjẹ ní ọwọ́ obìnrin yẹn mọ́
en: I just don't want my children to buy food from that woman anymore

yo: Nígbà wo ni ọmọ yín bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìwàkiwà a kí ó máa dá sí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn àgbàlagbà
en: When did your child start to misbehave and interfere with adults

yo: Oorun ló kú ní pé ó fẹ́ sùn láti ẹ̀ẹ̀kan tí kò rí oorun náà sùn
en: The sun died because he wanted to sleep since he couldn't sleep

yo: Púpọ̀ lára ẹ̀dá tí ó wà láyé ni ó mọ rírì Olódùmarè tí wọ́n sì ń bù ọlá fún-un
en: Most of the creatures in the world know the Almighty and honor him.

yo: Àti ẹni tó lówó àti ẹni tó lọ́lá àti ẹni tó ní làákàyè, wọ́n ń kú
en: And the rich and the honorable and the intelligent, they are dying

yo: Má jẹ kí eṣinṣin wọ ilé mi nítorí mi ò lè ṣogun lílé ẹṣinṣin kiri ilé
en: Don't let flies enter my house because I can't fight a horse flying around the house

yo: Ta ni ò mọ̀ pé èèyàn tó burú mọ̀, ó kàn ń wá èèyàn tí ó máa sọ fún-un ni
en: Who does not know that he is a bad person, he is just looking for someone to tell him

yo: Lóòótọ́ ni mo pé ẹni tí ò lórí ò ní fìlà, ẹni tó sì ní fìlà ó rórí dé e sí
en: I truly know that the one who has a hat has no hat, and the one who has a hat has a hat

yo: Wọ́n ní ẹni tí ó lórí rere tí kò ní ìwà, ìwà a rẹ̀ ló máa ba orí rere rẹ̀ jẹ́
en: They say that a person with a good heart has no character, his character will destroy his good character

yo: Ilé ayé kìí ṣogun, àwọn èèyàn tó ń mu kóle náà ló ń ri bíi pé ó le
en: The world does not fight, it is the people who are building it that seems to be hard

yo: Ìṣòro kan ni kí èèyàn ní owó tí á dẹ̀ ni í lára láti na sí ara ẹ̀
en: It is a problem for a person to have money to spend on himself

yo: Tí a bá ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn ẹ̀yà tí wọ́n ní àṣà ìkíni, ẹ̀ya Yorùbá jẹ́ ìkiní
en: If we are talking about ethnic groups that have a greeting culture, the Yoruba ethnic group is a greeting

yo: Mi ò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí bí ọkọ ẹ̀gbọ́n mi ṣe má ń gbá mi nídìí
en: I don't like how my brother-in-law does not beat me

yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí olóyún, ẹ ò gbọdọ̀ rin ìrìn ọ̀sán gan àbí ìrìn òru
en: As a pregnant woman, you must not walk during the day or at night

yo: Báwo ni o ṣe máa máa pe èèyan ẹlẹ́ran ara bíi tì ẹ ní wèrè tàbí asínwín
en: How can you call a person like you crazy or insane

yo: Ọkùnrin tí ó bá ti mu ọtí máa kó obìnrin àbí kí ó máa fa wàhálà kiri
en: A man who has been drinking will pick up a woman or cause trouble

yo: Ìròyín wá láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn elétò ìlera pé wọ́n máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ṣe ayẹ̀wò ọ̀fẹ́
en: Health authorities have announced that they will start offering free screenings.

yo: Mi ò nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ìwà kò sí ẹnì tí ó le è mú mi si tí o máa ń hù rárá
en: I don't like the no-one-can-do attitude that you do at all

yo: Tí a ò bá ní omi nílé, kọ̀ǹga ilé kejì ni a ti lọ má ń pọn omi tí kò tún ní mọ́
en: If we don't have water at home, we have to go to the second house to get water that we don't have anymore.

yo: Ìbàjẹ́ ni ọmọ olóyè yìí wọ̀ lẹ́wù ní ọmọ tí ó sì yẹ kí wọ́n máa nà pẹ̀lú ẹgba
en: It is a shame that this nobleman wears clothes as a child and should be beaten with a necklace.

yo: Bí mo bá ti sọ̀rọ̀ pé mo máa ṣe nǹkan, mo má ń ríi pé mo mú ọ̀rọ̀ mi ṣẹ
en: If I say I will do something, I always make sure I keep my word.

yo: Ní ìwọ̀ntunwọ̀nsì ni ó yẹ kí àgbàlagbà máa bá àwọn ọmọdé wí
en: Adults should discipline children in moderation

yo: Àyìnkẹ́ mà rẹwà púpọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n kan tó bàá jẹ́ ni pé kò ní ìwà gidi
en: She is very beautiful but one thing is that she has no real personality

yo: Bí ìjì líle bá jà, á mú kí gbogbo igi oko ní èyí tó tóbi àti kékeré tẹríba
en: If there is a strong storm, it will cause all the trees of the farm, big and small, to bow down

yo: Ebi ló pa mí jí ní àárọ̀ yìí nítorí oúnjẹ kékeré ni wọ́n bù fún mi jẹ lánàá
en: I woke up hungry this morning because they gave me little food yesterday

yo: Mi ò lè sọ àkókò pàtó tí bàbá à mi sì máa toko dé ṣùgbọ́n wọn ò ní pẹ́ dé
en: I can't say the exact time when my father will arrive but they won't arrive soon

yo: Ta ni ó máa rí mi báyìí tí á sọ pé ilé olówó àti ọlọ́lá ni mo ti jáde?
en: Who will see me now that I have come out of a rich and noble house?

yo: Èmi ni mo ṣì máa fi òkò pa ẹran Ìyá Àdìsá nítorí i òórùn rẹ̀ lè pá èèyàn
en: I am the one who will kill Adisa's mother's animal with a gun because her smell can kill people

yo: Bí a bá ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àgbàlagbà gidi, wọ́n kìí ń ṣe láńgbá láńgbá
en: If we are talking about real adults, they are not lazy.

yo: Obìnrin á tún gbé ìwà oníwà wọ̀ láti lè tẹ́ ọkùnrin lọ́rùn láyé òde òní
en: A woman will also wear a moral character in order to satisfy a man in today's world

yo: Ìyà ò kí ń ṣe oúnjẹ àjẹsùn ni mo ṣe ń gbàdúrà kí Ọlọ́run má jẹ́ kí n jìyà
en: My mother is not cooking food and I am praying that God will not let me suffer

yo: Bóyá ó rò pé tí ó bá fi owó tí ó ní hàn mí, ó máa wọ̀ mí lójú
en: Maybe he thinks that if he shows me the money he has, it will make me laugh

yo: Tí mo bá ní kí n ka gbogbo ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ tí o ti ṣẹ̀ mí, ilẹ̀ á kún.
en: If I were to count all the sins you have committed against me, the earth would be filled.

yo: Mi ò fẹ́ kí èèyàn kan wá máa jẹ́ kí nǹkan tí ò tó nǹkan wá máa bí mi nínú
en: I don't want someone to make me angry for something that is not enough

yo: Ṣé oúnjẹ tí wọ́n fẹ́ fi ṣe òde wọ́n ti jiná.
en: Is the food that they want to cook with is far away?

yo: Ìlú tí mò ń lọ jìnnà sí ìgboro gidi ni
en: The city I'm going to is far from the real street

yo: Wọ́n kéde pé kí gbogbo èèyàn máa jìnà sí ara wọn ní ìta gbangba.
en: They announced that everyone should keep a distance from each other in public.

yo: Àwọn arábìnrin méjéèjì ti gba oúnjẹ wọn
en: Both sisters have received their food

yo: Àpo owó mi ò kún pẹ̀lú u gbogbo ọjà tí àwọn èèyán bá mi rà
en: My pocket is not filled with all the goods that people buy from me

yo: Ìbáṣepọ̀ ọlọ́jọ́ gbọọrọ ni tèmi àti olùkọ́ tuntun wá.
en: My new teacher and I had a close relationship.

yo: Ní gbogbo ìgbà ni Aderẹ̀mi a máa jẹ ọba ní ìlú u wá.
en: Adremi will always be king in his hometown.

yo: Ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ní àgbáyé ti wá di ohun ìbanilọ́kànjẹ́ gbáà.
en: The economic system in the world has become a very dangerous thing.

yo: Ó sọ̀wọ́n kí olùkọ́ ní ilé ìwé gíga tún jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ sí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọ rẹ̀.
en: It is good that a teacher in a university is also a friend to his students.

yo: Ìṣèlú ní ilẹ̀ yìí ti wá di lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run àti lọ́wọ́ àwa èèyàn.
en: Politics in this land has become in the hands of God and in the hands of people.

yo: Ìrònú àwọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin ìsẹ̀yín ò ju owó àti oge lọ.
en: Young women's thoughts are more than money and fame.

yo: Àwùjọ Yorùbá jẹ́ èyí tí àṣà, ìṣe àti èdè inú un rẹ̀ kò lẹ́gbẹ́.
en: The Yoruba society is one in which the customs, practices and language within it are unique.

yo: Ọ̀rẹ́ bí ọmọ ìyá ni èmi àti Ìfẹ́dọlápọ̀, alábàárò mi ni ó ń ṣe.
en: Love and I are like mother's children, my cousin is doing it.

yo: Àwọn tó pè wá sí ìpàdé ní ọjọ́ àìkú yóò sanwó ìtanràn.
en: Those who invite us to the meeting on the day of immortality will pay a fine.

yo: Ó ṣe pàtàkì kí gbogbo ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ wà ní ìjókòó ní ọjọ́ yẹn.
en: It is important that all members are present that day.

yo: A bẹ̀bẹ̀ ìdáríjì lọ́wọ́ọ gbogbo àwọn tó pàdánù ẹbí tàbí ará kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: We ask for forgiveness from all those who have lost a family or a relative.

yo: Ìdí fún ìpàdé yí ni láti wá kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ nítorí ẹ̀kọ́ ò pin síbìkan.
en: The reason for this meeting is to learn because education is not distributed anywhere.

yo: Èto ọrọ̀ ajé ní àgbáyé ti wá di ohun tó nílò àmójútó gidi ni.
en: The economic system in the world has become something that needs real care.

yo: Gbogbo ẹgbẹ́ dákẹ́ rọ́rọ́ nígbà tó di àsìkò à ti mú àbá wá.
en: All the groups were quiet when it was time to come up with a suggestion.

yo: Ó sọ pé àwọn olóríi wa ò tún nǹkan ṣe, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni wọn ò bá nǹkan jẹ́.
en: He said that our leaders did not change anything, nor did they destroy anything.

yo: Ǹjẹ́ ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè kan kìí ṣe ohun àjogúnbá, kìí ṣe oyè ìdílé.
en: Is the president of a country not a hereditary thing, not a family title.

yo: Olórí nǹkan pàtó kò gbọ́dọ̀ fẹ́ jẹ nítorí orúkọ àti ipò lásán.
en: A certain leader should not want to be just because of name and position.

yo: Olórí ìlú gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ ẹni tí a fi àwọn ohun pàtàkì lélẹ̀ kó tó kúrò nípò.
en: The head of the city must be a person who is entrusted with important things before leaving.

yo: Olórí gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ ẹni tó lóòótọ́, tí ò ní máa ṣọ̀tún-ṣòsì.
en: A leader must be a true person, who will not be left-right.

yo: Ohun tí mo ní láti sọ nípa ọ̀rọ̀ tó wà nílẹ̀ nìyẹn.
en: That is what I have to say about the matter at hand.

yo: Ọmọ títọ́ kìí ṣe tí àwọn òbí nìkan, gbogbo àwùjọ ló ń tọ́ ọmọ.
en: Raising a child is not only for parents, every society raises children.

yo: Àwọn ọmọlúàbí máa ń jẹ́ ọmọ tó wúlò fún gbogbo àwùjọ
en: Good children are useful children for every society

yo: Mo máa nílò kí àwọn ẹlòmíràn náà jáde láti wá sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ọ̀rọ̀ yìí.
en: I will need others to come out and talk about this issue.

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ náà ti ta bá gbogbo àwọn tó wà ní ìjókòó.
en: The word has spread to all those in the seat.

yo: Ó yé mi pé lára wá lè máa ráyè à ti máa wá ní ọjọ́ ìṣẹ́gun.
en: I understand that we may have a chance to come on the day of victory.

yo: Oríṣiríṣi ẹ̀yà ara ni àwa èèyàn àti àwọn ẹranko ní.
en: We humans and animals have different organs.

yo: Àwọn ẹ̀yà ara tó ṣe pàtàkì jùlọ ni ojú àti ọpọlọ.
en: The most important organs are the eyes and the brain.

yo: Fífi ọmọ lọ́kọ ní tipátipá kìí ṣe ohun gidi rárá.
en: Forced adoption is not a real thing at all.

yo: Àwọn Yorùbá a máa pe àwọn ìbejì ní ọba ọmọ
en: The Yoruba people call twins king sons

yo: Wọn máa ń sábà á se ẹ̀wà fún ìsọmọlórúkọ àti ọjọ́ ìbí àwọn ìbejì.
en: They often make jewelry for naming and birthdays of twins.

yo: Wọ́n gbà pé àwọn ìbejì ni òrìṣà a tiwọn.
en: They believe that the twins are their gods.

yo: Ìbáṣepọ àti ìfẹ́ tó wà láàárín àwọn ìbejì máa ń nípọn gidi
en: The relationship and love between twins is very strong

yo: Ìjà a wọn ò ṣeé dá sí kí wọ́n má baà yi lé èèyàn lórí.
en: Their fight cannot be stopped so that they don't turn on people.

yo: Àwọn Yorùbá náà ló tún má ń pe ìbẹta ní ọmọ ọba.
en: The Yoruba also do not call Boeta the king's son.

yo: Ó lè jẹ́ ọba ló ń gbọ́ bùkátà àwọn ìbẹta tí wọ́n bá bí nínú ìlú náà.
en: It may be the king who takes care of the visitors who are born in the city.

yo: Yorùbá gbà pé àwọn ọmọ wọ̀nyí jẹ́ ẹ̀bùn láti ọ̀dọ̀ ọ Elédùmarè.
en: The Yoruba believe that these children are a gift from Elédumare.

yo: Gbogbo ọmọ náà ni ó yẹ kí wọ́n máa kà ní pàtàkì
en: Every child should be read seriously

yo: Àwọn ọmọ tí wọ́n bá mú ẹsẹ̀ wáyé ní wọ́n ń pè ní Ìgè.
en: Children who are born with legs are called Ige.

yo: Obìnrin àti ọkùnrin ló le è jẹ́ Ìgè nínú àṣà ìṣọmọlórúkọ Yorùbá.
en: Both men and women can be called Igè in the Yoruba naming tradition.

yo: Ìbànújẹ́ ó tóbi tàbí ó kéré ò ní jẹ́ ti tiwa.
en: No big or small sadness will be ours.

yo: Òògùn nígbà mìíràn a máa wú oríṣiríṣi àìsàn kalẹ̀ nínú àgọ̀ ara wa.
en: Medicine sometimes we will spread various diseases in our body.

yo: Yorùbá gbà pé kò sí àìsàn tí ewé àti egbò ò le è wòsàn
en: Yoruba believe that there is no disease that leaves and herbs cannot cure

yo: Àwọn bàbá àti ìyá àgbà nínú ilé a máa dúró gẹ́gẹ́ bí adarí ilé
en: Fathers and grandmothers in the house will stand as the head of the house

yo: Wọ́n mọ oògùn tó tọ́ fún àìsàn kọ̀ọ̀kan.
en: They know the right medicine for each disease.

yo: Èyí tí wọn kò bá mọ̀ ni wọ́n pe àwọn oníṣègùn sí.
en: If they do not know, they call the doctors.

yo: Wọ́n ma ń ní àwọn ewé àti egbò yí ní àyíká ilé e wọn.
en: They often have these leaves and sores around their houses.

yo: Wọn a máa gbin àwọn mìíràn sínú oko wọn.
en: They will plant others in their fields.

yo: Púpọ̀ nínú oúnjẹ wọn, àwọn ni wọ́n ń gbìn ín, tí wọ́n ń ṣe é.
en: Most of their food, they grow it, they cook it.

yo: Ìran Yorùbá kìí ṣe ọ̀lẹ tàbí olè rárá.
en: The Yoruba people are not lazy or thieves at all.

yo: Àwọn ọkùnrin ilé ni wọ́n ń lọ sí ọkọ lóòótọ́.
en: The men of the house are really going to the husband.

yo: Àwọn obìnrin ilé ni wọ́n ń lọ sí ọjà lọ ta gbogbo ẹ̀.
en: Housewives go to the market to sell everything.

yo: Ìyàwó á yọ èyí tó bá jẹ́ èrè e tiwọn, wọ́n á kó ìyókù fún ọkọ wọn.
en: The wife will remove what is their own profit, they will take the rest for their husband.

yo: Bí ìyàwó bá ṣe mọ ọjà á tà sí ló máa ń hàn nínú ìdílé náà
en: If the wife knows what to sell, she will show it in the family

yo: Ní ìgbà náà, ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ ma ń wáyé láàárín àwọn obìnrin ilé.
en: At that time, cooperation was taking place between housewives.

yo: Èèyàn kankan ò jẹ́ gúnyán ẹlòmíràn kéré, pàápàá àwọn obìnrin.
en: No one is inferior to another, especially women.

yo: Àwọn náà dáàbòbo ilé àti ọ̀nà a wọn lọ́nàkọnà.
en: They also protect the house and the road in any way.

yo: Òpó ni àwọn obìnrín jẹ́ fún àwọn ìdílé e wọn.
en: Women are widows for their families.

yo: Púpọ̀ àwọn obìnrin yìí gan a máa lówó ju àwọn ọkọ wọn lọ.
en: Many of these women will be richer than their husbands.

yo: Bí wọ́n sì ṣe ń ṣe ètò ọ̀rọ ajé náà ni wọ́n ń fi ojú àwọn ọmọ wọn síi.
en: And when they do the business plan, they put their children in front of them.

yo: Wọ́n ń gbọ́ ti ilé, ọmọ àti ọkọ mọ́ gbogbo kìràkìtà a wọn yìí
en: They are hearing about the house, the children and the husband in every way

yo: Ipa obìnrin nínú àwùjọ Yorùbá ò tán síbẹ̀.
en: The role of women in Yoruba society does not end there.

yo: Obìnrin ló gbọ́dọ̀ lọ sí ilé ọkọ pẹ̀lú ìbálé.
en: A woman must go to her husband's house with a wife.

yo: Àìjẹ́bẹ́ẹ̀, ìdójútì ni irúfé obìnrin náà yóò jẹ fún àwọn òbí àti ẹbí i rẹ.
en: Otherwise, such a woman will be a shame for her parents and family.

yo: Yàtọ̀ sí pé ó le è jẹ́ oníṣekúṣe, oríṣiríṣi nǹkan lè fa kí ó máà ní ìbálé.
en: Apart from the fact that he can be immoral, various things can cause him not to have sex.

yo: Àwọn ẹlòmíràn wà tí wọ́n fipá bá lòpọ̀ rí.
en: There are others who are forced to have sex.

yo: Àwọn mìíràn wà tí ìbálé e wọ́n já toríi wàhálà láì sí ìbálòpọ̀.
en: There are others whose relationship broke up due to stress without sex.

yo: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó bá jáde ní abé obìnrin ni wọ́n fi ń mọ̀ bóyá ó ti bàlágà
en: The blood that comes out of a woman's vagina is used to know if she has reached puberty

yo: Ìwádìí ní ayé òde òní fihàn pé kìí ṣe gbogbo obìnrin ló ní èyí.
en: Research in today's world shows that not all women have this.

yo: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ yíyọ gan kìí ṣe odìwọn láti mọ ẹni tó ní ìbálé.
en: Blood flow is not the criterion to know who is having sex.

yo: Àwọn tí wọ́n fi ipá bá lò gan ò kín lè bá èèyàn kankan sọ ọ́.
en: Those who use violence can't talk to anyone.

yo: Gbogbo nǹkan yí ló lè ṣẹlẹ̀ ṣùgbọ́n onídọ̀tí ni irú obìnrin bẹ́ẹ̀.
en: All these things can happen but such a woman is dirty.

yo: Ti gbogbo ẹbí sì ni ẹ̀gbin yìí á jẹ́, ọmọ wọn ṣáà ni.
en: And if the whole family has this ugliness, it will be their son.

yo: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, orí ìyá ọmọbìnrin ni gbogbo ẹbí á yí ẹ̀gbin yìí lé.
en: Nevertheless, the head of the daughter's mother is the whole family will turn this evil on.

yo: Ọmọ burúkú ni ti ìyá ẹ, ti gbogbo èèyàn lọmọ gidi.
en: Your mother's is a bad child, whom everyone knows.

yo: Ní àsìkò yí, wọ́n á gbàgbé pé gbogbo àwọn ni wọ́n jọ tọ́ ọmọ yìí.
en: At this time, they will forget that they all raised this child together.

yo: Ìgbàgbé á ṣe wọ́n pé òun àti ìyá ẹ̀ ni wọ́n ti ṣe nǹkan gidi fún-un rí.
en: They will forget that he and his mother have done something real for him.

yo: Ẹ̀dá tí Ọlọ́run dá àwọn obìnrin lágbára gan ni.
en: God created women to be very strong.

yo: Àwọn òyìnbó ṣe ẹ̀rọ kan tí wọ́n ń dè mọ́ ikùn fún àwọn obìnrin
en: The witches made a machine that was tied to the stomach for women

yo: Nínú-un gbogbo ìgbàsílẹ̀ ẹ wọn, kò sí ọkùnrin tó lè gba ìnira yìí rárá.
en: In all their lives, no man can accept this hardship at all.

yo: Àwọn obìnrin a sì máa ṣe nǹkan oṣù bíi pé kìí ṣe bàbàrà.
en: And women will menstruate as if they are not on the same day.

yo: Àwọn obìnrin mìíràn ò ní torí ìnira má ṣiṣẹ́ ilé tàbí lọ sí ibi iṣẹ́.
en: Other women do not have to work at home or go to work.

yo: Àwọn ọkùnrin náà jẹ́ ẹ̀rí síi pé lóòótọ́, àwọn obìnrin ń gbìyànjú.
en: The men are proof that women are really trying.

yo: Oorun ní àsìkò tó yẹ jẹ́ ohun tó ń ṣe ara lóore.
en: Sun at the right time is what makes the body happy.

yo: Ìwádìí fi hàn pé ó ní iye wákàtí tó yẹ kí èèyán fi sùn ní ọjọ́ kan.
en: Research shows that there are a number of hours that a person should sleep in a day.

yo: Tí oorún bá ń lọ fún iye wákàtí tó tọ́, àlàáfíà máa ń tó ara.
en: If the sun goes for the right amount of hours, peace will be enough for the body.

yo: Ìwádìí fi hàn pé àrùn-un kògbóògùn ti ń pọ̀ si ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
en: Research shows that drug-related diseases are increasing in this country.

yo: Àwọn oníṣègùn òyìnbó ní àrùn-un kògbóògùn ti peléke síi.
en: The number of doctors in medicine has increased.

yo: Iye àwọn èèyàn tí wọ́n ti mọ̀ dájú pé wọ́n ní àrùn yí ti pọ̀ ju àtẹ̀yìnwá lọ.
en: The number of people who have known for sure that they have this disease is more than in the past.

yo: Wọ́n pèsè àyẹ̀wọ̀ ọ̀fẹ́ ní àwọn ilé ìwòsàn ìjọba.
en: They provide free examination in government hospitals.

yo: Wọ́n kéde pé kí gbogbo èèyàn máa lo ìdáàbòbò ní ìgbàkúgbà.
en: They announced that everyone should use protection at all times.

yo: Ìdáàbòbò yí jẹ́ ìṣọ́ fún àrun kògbóògùn àti ọ̀nà láti fètò sí ọmọ bíbí.
en: This protection is a guard against disease and a way to prevent childbirth.

yo: Wọ́n rí ọmọ tuntun kan ní ẹ̀bá odò kan ní Ìlúpéjú lọ́jọ́sí.
en: A new baby was found by a river in Ilupeju today.

yo: Àwọn ìlú ti pinnu pé gbogbo ẹbíi Balógun ni àwọ́n lé kúrò ní ìlú
en: The towns have decided that all Balogun families will be evicted from the town

yo: Ọwọ́ ara ẹni la fi ń tán ìṣòro ara ẹni
en: We solve our own problems with our own hands

yo: Àwọn àgbàgbà ìlú ní olóyè tó bá ń rí ọba fín ti jẹbi ikú.
en: The elders of the city and the chief who saw the king were sentenced to death.

yo: Ìgbàkúgbà tí mo bá rántí, inú mi ma ń dùn ni.
en: Every time I remember it, I feel happy.

yo: Agbẹjórò ní kò sí ohun tó jọọ́ pé orílẹ́èdè kan ń fún òun ní ìrànwọ́
en: The lawyer said there is nothing wrong with a country giving him help

yo: Amẹ́ríkà ń gbèrò láti dá Ìgbòho padà sílé ẹ̀
en: America is planning to return Igbho to his home

yo: Ṣé ní òótọ́ ni pé wíwọ páàdì lè já ìbálé obìnrin?
en: Is it true that wearing a pad can break a woman's relationship?

yo: Lásìkò nǹkan tí mo ṣẹ lóṣù yìí, mo jẹ tẹ́tẹ́ oríire
en: At the time of my accomplishment this month, I was very lucky

yo: Ọgbẹ́ inú ló pa Tọ́pẹ́ àti Adélàńwá
en: Tope and Adélanwa were killed by internal wounds

yo: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn ìbejì Adégbàyí ni Amọ́lẹ́gbẹ́
en: One of Adégbayi's twins is Amoleleg

yo: Àjọ eré ìdárayá lágbàáyé ti lé Olúṣeéní kúrò nílé
en: The World Sports Organization has kicked Olúsheeni out of the house

yo: Wọ́n ti kéde ètò ìsìnkú Ajímájàṣán àti ọjọ́ tí wọn yóò sin-ín
en: They have announced the funeral plan of Ayamajashan and the day he will be buried

yo: Onígà ti kú. Jídé Kòsọ́kọ́ ló sọ bẹ́ẹ̀
en: Oniga is dead. Jide Kososoka said so

yo: Yọ̀mí Fábíyìí àti àwọn míì ṣè ìdárò Onígà tó lọ
en: Yommi Fabiyi and others mourned Oniga's passing

yo: Ìyá ìyàwó àti àwọn ọbàkán sọ̀rọ̀ ìwúrí nípa olóògbé níbi ìsìnkú
en: The bride's mother and relatives spoke of the deceased at the funeral

yo: Nítòótọ́ ni à ń gbé óúnjẹ lọ fún àwọn ajínigbé
en: We are indeed taking food to the kidnappers

yo: Kí ebí má ba à pa àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọ wa ni a fi ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀
en: We do this so that our students will not starve

yo: Agbẹnusọ fún àjọ alámòójútó ètò ìdìbó ti fi ìwé pe Sàràkí
en: The spokesperson for the electoral management organization has sent a letter to Saraki

yo: Sàlàkọ́ àti àwọn ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ ti mú arákùnrin ẹni ogójì ọdún dání
en: Salakoh and the detectives have arrested the 40-year-old brother

yo: Ẹni tó fí ìbínú lu Ábúdù ọlọ́kadà pa ní Abẹ́òkuta ti sálọ.
en: The person who killed Abudu Olakadada in Abeokuta has escaped.

yo: Ikọ̀ ọ Yorùbá ti bá agbẹjọ́rò Ìgbòho sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìdí tó fi wà ní àhámọ́
en: Yoruba language has spoken to Igbho's lawyer on why he is in prison

yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ di bóò-lọ-yà nígbà tí mo fèsì lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ọ Kúnlé
en: I was speechless when I responded to Kunle's speech

yo: A ò ní sọ pé kí ará ìlú má ṣe dìbò fún wọn
en: We will not say that the people of the city should not vote for them

yo: Amẹ́ríkà ti sọ abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára di dandan fún gbogbo arìnrìnàjò.
en: America has made vaccination mandatory for all travelers.

yo: Ẹran mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin ni a ti fi ṣọwọ́ sí Nàìjíríà
en: Four million animals have been imported into Nigeria

yo: Bákàrè ní lèmọ́mù àkọ́kọ́ ní Sódẹkẹ́ Abẹ́òkúta ni bàbá òun
en: His father was Bakare in the first month of Sodère Abeokuta

yo: Bí Kádàrá ṣe dèrò ẹ̀wọ̀n nítorí ó bú Bùhárí nìyẹn
en: That's how Kadara planned to be imprisoned because he cursed Buhari

yo: Àwọn olóríi Fúlàní béèrè àsìkò díẹ̀ si lóríi gbèǹdéke ìjọba
en: The Fulani leaders asked for some more time on the government's behalf

yo: Mo rán wọn láti lọ lé àwọn ọ̀daràn kúrò nínú igbó
en: I sent them to chase the criminals out of the forest

yo: Kàkà kí n jalè, màá yáa lọ múra síṣẹ́ ọwọ́ mi.
en: Instead of stealing, I will go and prepare to work with my hands.

yo: Ọwọ́ ọlọ́pàá ti tẹ arákùnrin tó múra bí obìnrin yẹn
en: The police hand pressed the brother who dressed like that woman

yo: Ó fẹ́ láti bá ọ̀rẹ́bìrin rẹ̀ jókòó kọ ìdánwò èdè e Gẹ̀ẹ́sì
en: He wants to sit with his sister and write the English test

yo: Wo àwọn nǹkan tó yẹ kí o mọ̀ báyìí tí ìrìnàjò ẹ́ ti súnmọ́.
en: Take a look at the things you should know now that your trip is near.

yo: Ọkọ̀ ọ bààlúù mẹ́ta bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ padà láàárin Nàìjíríà sí Amẹ́ríkà
en: Three helicopters resume operations between Nigeria and the US

yo: Ọdúnayọ̀ Adékùróyè sanwó orí ẹ̀ lásìkò, ó sì dùn mọ́ ọ nínú.
en: Odunayo Adekuroye paid him on time, and he was happy.

yo: Ìrètí i Nàìjíríà fún góòlú ni pé kí Adékùróyè pòfo nínú ìjàkadì
en: Nigeria's hope for gold is for Adekuroye to fail in the fight

yo: Tóò bá dédé jádé sí wọn lóru, wọn ò ní yìnbọn fún ẹ.
en: If you come out to them at night, they will not shoot you.

yo: Ìrètí sọ fótò àti fídíò rẹ̀ nù lóríi fóònù
en: Hope deleted her photos and videos from her phone

yo: Àwọn náà ló gbé ètò tuntun jáde lásìkò náà.
en: They also brought out a new plan at that time.

yo: Kí ló dé tí ajá fi ń jùrù lójú oorun?
en: Why do dogs throw up in their sleep?

yo: Èèyàn mẹ́rin ló kú nínú ìjàm̀bá mìíràn tó ṣèlẹ̀.
en: Four people died in another accident.

yo: Ayọ̀bámi ti tún lùgbàdì aàrùn-un kòró ní ìlú ẹ̀.
en: Ayobami has also fought a severe disease in his town.

yo: Afẹ́nifẹ́re ti gbóṣùbà fún àwọn Adájọ́ kan fún iṣẹ́ ribiribi wọn
en: A fan has rebuked some Judges for their hard work

yo: Nàìjíríà ti kẹ́dùn lórí ìdájọ́ méjì tó ṣẹlẹ̀ nípa Ọmọọba Ìgbòho
en: Nigeria has lamented over the two judgments that have taken place regarding the King of Igbho

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀mí àti dúkìá àìmoye ló ṣòfò nínú ìjàm̀bá a omíyalé
en: Many lives and untold amounts of property were lost in the disaster.

yo: Ọba Gbọ́láhàn ṣómólú ti jẹ́wọ́ pé àṣìṣe ni òún ṣe.
en: King Gollahan Somolu has admitted that he made a mistake.

yo: A kò gbọdọ̀ tún ṣe àṣìṣe irú ẹ̀ mọ́ lọ́dún tó ḿ bọ̀.
en: We must not make the same mistake next year.

yo: Ìgbòho ti sọ gbogbo ohun tó fẹ́ kí á ṣe tí ọ̀rọ́ bá bẹ́yìn yọ
en: Igbho has said everything he wants us to do if the issue arises

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀mí àti dúkìá àìmoye mílíọ̀nú-un náírà ló ṣòfò nínú ìjàm̀bá ọkọ̀
en: Many lives and property worth billions of naira are wasted in car accidents

yo: Àrá sán pa èèyàn bíi mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gún níbi ayẹyẹ ìgbéyàwó kan.
en: Brother killed about fifteen people at a wedding ceremony.

yo: Ṣèyí Mákindé ti di Gómìnà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́
en: This Makinde has become the Governor of Oyo region

yo: Ọpẹ́lọpẹ́ òun tó jẹ dòdò lọ́kàn alàgbà yẹn
en: His gratitude filled the heart of that elder

yo: Báwọn kan ṣe ń pe bàbá náà ní alátẹnujẹ kò bójú mu.
en: As some call the father a comforter, it is not appropriate.

yo: Obìnrin kan gbé ilé ọtí lọ silé ẹjọ́ nítorí ìpolówó ọjà
en: A woman took a pub to court over advertising

yo: Nígbà a ààwẹ̀, kò sí ààyè fún pípolówó oúnjẹ lóríi amóhùnmáwòrán.
en: During fasting, there is no space for advertising food on television.

yo: Gómínà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ fi ọjọ́ ajé àti Ìṣẹ́gun sílẹ̀ fún ìṣìnmi ọdún-un eégún
en: Oyo state governor leaves business day and Isegun for New Year's holiday

yo: Ọ̀gágun Jẹ́mibẹ̀wọ́n ń faraya lóríi bí àwọn jàǹdùkú ṣe ń borí ọmọ ogun wa.
en: General Jemibeweon is worried about how the thugs are defeating our army.

yo: Ayọ̀túndé ti tún gún òǹlàjà lọ́bẹ pa.
en: Ayutunde has stabbed the survivor again.

yo: Adé ni ẹni tó jẹ́ ẹ̀gbọ́n ẹni tí wọ́n ń jọ ń jà nínú ọjà
en: Adé is the person who is the brother of the person they are fighting together in the market

yo: Ohun tó bá wu oníkálùkù ni kó sọ, mò ń gbìyànjú
en: Whatever everyone wants to say, I'm trying

yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ bùkátà ló wà níwájú mi báyìí o.
en: There are many tasks in front of me now.

yo: Fálànà ní ẹnú ya òun bí ìjọba ṣe lo ìlànà tí kò tọ́
en: Falana was surprised how the government used the wrong policy

yo: Ó ti tó àádọ́ta ọdún tí a ti fi ẹ̀sùn kan Ìgbòho àti Káyọ̀dé
en: It has been 50 years since Igbho and Kayode were charged

yo: Agbẹjọ́rò ti kéde ọjọ́ tó ṣeéṣe kí àwọn afurasí kúrò lọ́gbà ẹ̀wọ̀n
en: The prosecutor has announced the possible date for the suspects to be released from prison

yo: Àwọn ará Ọ̀sun wo bí Babaláwo ṣe gé apá àti ẹsẹ̀ ẹ ẹ̀
en: The people of Osun watched as Babalawo cut off his arms and legs

yo: Adékúnlé àti ìyàwó ẹ̀ fi orí àti ọ̀kan oníbàárà a wọn balè.
en: Adékunle and his wife put their heads and hearts to rest.

yo: Ìfẹ́dayọ̀ Ọlárìndé ní òun yóò fi ìfẹ́ hàn lásìkò ààwẹ̀
en: It is the will of Olarinde that he will show love during fasting

yo: Ẹni tí àwọn ìjọ Ọlọ́run gbógun tì ni ó ti di olóríire báyìí
en: The one whom the churches of God fought against is now blessed

yo: Ìjọba ní kí ẹnikẹ́ni má dá wàhálá sílẹ̀ lórúkọ òun
en: The government asked that no one should create trouble in his name

yo: Wàá fojú winá òfin tí o bá ṣe ohun tí a ní kí o má ṣe
en: You will face the law if you do what we tell you not to do

yo: Tírélà agbépo ṣekú pa ọmọ ọdún méjì àti àwọn mẹ́ta míì
en: A trailer killed a two-year-old child and three others
